Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?




Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.





Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 400 million active users per month.


Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growth with high profitability, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap.


Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.


A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.





We at the Infrastructure team, work on a vision to empower our product-oriented teams with a complete self-service analytics platform to make data-driven decisions possible in Truecaller, guaranteeing the stability, velocity, and delivery of the mainstream events pipeline.




As a Data Engineer, you will play an important role in the Data Platform team which is responsible for building and maintaining a scalable, robust, self-service analytics platform.


Tasks


What will you work on





Maintaining and improving the ingestion pipeline to reliably deliver billions of events daily in defined SLA


Provide support for all teams in building and optimizing their complex pipelines


Work closely with other teams to identify pain points and problems around the platform


Develop new tools and frameworks to improve the data platform


Facilitate company-wide to be data-driven


Work in close collaboration with data scientists and data analysts to help support their work in production


Work with vast projects such as building an ML platform and streaming use cases


Setup best practices and processes around software and data development



Requirements


What do we expect from you:





3+ years of experience in data engineering


Experience working with orchestration tool (ex: Airflow)


Experience working with a large data set


Experience building complex ETL pipelines


Experience working with cloud providers such as GCP, AWS, or Azure


Strong programming skills in Spark with Scala and Python


Experience working with CI/CD tools like Jenkins and Git


Strong understanding of Software Engineering practices and principles


Excellent problem-solving and communication skills


Self-motivated and have a proven ability to take initiative to own the problems that come up and solve them



Benefits


What we offer:





A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.


A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.


Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.


Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There is something for everyone!





Come as you are:
Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.

  • Provide support for all teams in building and optimizing their complex pipelines

  • Work closely with other teams to identify pain points and problems around the platform

  • Develop new tools and frameworks to improve the data platform

  • Facilitate company-wide to be data-driven

  • Work in close collaboration with data scientists and data analysts to help support their work in production

  • Work with vast projects such as building an ML platform and streaming use cases

  • Setup best practices and processes around software and data development


Requirements

What do we expect from you:



  • 3+ years of experience in data engineering

  • Experience working with orchestration tool (ex: Airflow)

  • Experience working with a large data set

  • Experience building complex ETL pipelines

  • Experience working with cloud providers such as GCP, AWS, or Azure

  • Strong programming skills in Spark with Scala and Python

  • Experience working with CI/CD tools like Jenkins and Git

  • Strong understanding of Software Engineering practices and principles

  • Excellent problem-solving and communication skills

  • Self-motivated and have a proven ability to take initiative to own the problems that come up and solve them


Benefits

What we offer:



  • A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.

  • A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.

  • Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.

  • Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There is something for everyone!


Come as you are:
Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.

Role Summary

Our department plays an important role in Scania’s data strategy to deliver top analytical solutions. We enable and enhance data to empower our employees to perform at their best by providing excellent solutions that increase and secure the right decisions to reach and exceed business goals.

You will be a part of a Squad consisting of Data Engineers and a Service Delivery Manager working towards the People and Culture business area. You will be part of a like-minded team that has a passion for working with BI solutions, and together you will create data solutions that bring value to our customers. You will also be involved and contribute to the Centers of Excellence (CoEs) in the organization. We work closely with the business (Business & IT as One) and with various stakeholder groups to gather and document reporting requirements to meet business needs.

We use scrum methodologies and sprints to follow up our work. Together with the squad, you will be developing high-quality BI solutions. You will develop new data products and work with our existing portfolio as well as documentation and performance adjustments. Our technical platforms are in the cloud and on-premises. The cloud setup is in AWS with Snowflake as a data warehouse, Matillion as our ETL/ELT tool, and PowerBI as a visualization tool. Our legacy on-premises platform with the Scania common data warehouse is Oracle-based with Oracle 19C and Oracle Data Integrator. We are in a transition phase to move away from on-premises into our highly capable cloud platform.

Who You Are



4+ years of experience with DW development and support
2+ years of experience with cloud technologies, preferably AWS/Snowflake
Deep knowledge of dimensional modeling, data access, and data storage
Advanced SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases
Working experience with both low-code and high-code environments for ETL
Knowledge of PowerBI in Cloud, Tabular Editor, and other BI/DW tools is meriting
Basic understanding of git branching, and the ability to push and pull code to and from a git repository
Strong English language skills
Good knowledge of requirements collection for reporting applications



These skills are a bonus but not a must:



Experience in people and culture domains, procurement, or finance
Experience and enjoyment of agile methods and DevOps to deliver value continuously
An academic degree in computer science or equivalent



We hope that you are someone that adds energy to the group and push the team to reach new levels. You take responsibility for your own and the team’s development and are happy to drive improvements within both processes and tools. You are a team player who dares to take initiative and easily adapts to different situations and work conditions. You communicate fluently in English and have the ability to connect with users and their representatives, understanding requirements and analyzing data. You meet users’ expectations and bring clarity to unclear requirements through dialogue. Additionally, a person who enjoys having fun with colleagues is much appreciated!

Scania Offers

We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.

Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.

Application

Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.

Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-05-04 Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.

We look forward to your application!
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Junior Data Engineer – Stockholm (Hybrid)




📍 Location: Stockholm – 3 days/week onsite

💼 Full-time, Permanent

🎁 Generous benefits package




Are you passionate about data and eager to kickstart your career in a modern, forward-thinking tech environment? We’re looking for a Junior Data Engineer to join a well-established, values-driven company with a strong foundation and long-term vision. Based in central Stockholm, this organization is part of a larger, family-owned group with over 140 years of history – providing stability, resources, and a commitment to innovation.




You’ll join a high-performing Data & Analytics team working with modern tools and architectures in Azure. This is a great opportunity for someone who’s just starting out or has 1-2 years of experience and wants to take the next step in a supportive environment that encourages learning, experimentation, and ownership.




🌟 What’s in it for you:

Exclusive opportunity - not advertised elsewhere
Work with top-tier colleagues - existing team members are highly skilled and collaborative
Modern cloud-based data stack - Azure, Databricks, Synapse, Fabric, and more
Freedom with responsibility - a flat, agile organization where your ideas matter
Excellent work-life balance - 30 days of vacation, wellness & healthcare allowance, and hybrid flexibility




🛠️ What You’ll Be Doing:

Building and maintaining robust, scalable data pipelines in Azure
Supporting the design and development of data models and ETL processes
Helping the organization leverage data for smarter decision-making
Collaborating across departments to deliver business-driven data solutions




🎓 What You Bring:

Relevant academic background (e.g., Computer Science, IT Systems, Engineering)
A strong interest in data engineering and analytics

Either:

Recent graduate with relevant studies and projects, OR
1-2 years of hands-on experience in data engineering or BI development
Exposure to SQL and either Python or Scala
Understanding of data modelling and ETL concepts
Fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written




✅ Nice to Have:

Experience with Microsoft Azure services like Data Factory, Synapse, or Databricks
Knowledge of Power BI or Microsoft’s on-prem BI stack (SSIS, SSAS)
Familiarity with object-oriented programming and agile methodologies




🎁 Perks & Benefits:

30 days’ vacation
Great pension plan
3,500 SEK annual wellness allowance (gym, etc.)
2,000 SEK annual healthcare allowance (dental, glasses, etc.)
Amazing on-site restaurant (you’ll pay about a third of what you would in the city)
Stable, purpose-driven organization with a long-term digital vision




❗ Additional Info:

Swedish work permit or citizenship required (no visa sponsorship available)
No travel required
Hybrid setup: 3 days per week in the Stockholm office




If you're excited to build your skills in a supportive team and help shape the future of data at a well-established, forward-looking company - we'd love to hear from you.




Ready to take the next step? We’re excited to meet you.

Title: Data Engineer within Credit Risk area
Description:
Are you eager to contribute with your engineering skills in the Credit Risk area?

In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:


Be part of a cross functional team that implements, maintains and operates credit risk models contributing to one of the banks most prioritized initiatives.
Collaborate with developers, analysts, risk officers, architects and product owners for creating the best solutions.
Identify, quality assure, and source data needed for the models.
Analyse requirements and participate in investigations of our solutions.
Control technical debt.
Ensure that documentation of our solutions and our models is up to date.



What is needed in this role:


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field.
A few years’ experience as a Data Engineer, SAS developer or similar.
Knowledgeable SAS 9.4 stack is (e.g. DI Studio, Enterprise Guide, Management Console).
Knowledge in some ETL tools.
Being comfortable in writing SQL and having knowledge around SQL databases and data modelling concepts.
Having the desire and motivation to learn how to develop credit risk solutions, even without prior experience, is an advantage.
Having experience with metadata management and data modelling tools is an advantage.
Interest in, and understanding of, banking and finance is an advantage.
Creative and driven problem solver.
Analytical mindset.
Team player who likes to share your knowledge as well as learning from colleagues.
Proficient in English.
Proficiency in Swedish is an advantage.
Adaptive to new ways of working as well as changed technologies/tools.
Experienced in Mainframe, Informatica PowerCenter or Oracle Data Integrator is an advantage.



With us, you can experience:


Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.





"Join our team and...

become part of a knowledgeable and helpful team, working together to implement reliable credit risk models which are of great importance to Swedbank. Group Risk is a group function with the mission to measure, report and analyse all Swedbank's risks, of which the largest risk type is Credit Risk. Within the Credit Risk Models value stream, we are implementing the credit risk models needed to assess the bank's portfolio risks (IRB Models) and expected credit losses (IFRS9). The team consists of Product Owners, Scrum Masters, Business Analysts and Data Engineers." Frida Nilsson, your future manager

We look forward to receiving your application by 19.05.2025. We work with continuous selection, which means that the position may be filled before the application deadline.

Location: Sundbyberg/Umeå

Recruiting manager: Frida Nilsson, +46 73 033 79 46

We may begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.

We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.

Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
More independence, freedom, and better pay

Coody believes in combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.

It's not rocket science.

Overpaid managers, fancy offices, and heavily burdened organizations are history.

The tech talent of tomorrow deserves a new, independent, and well-paid standard.

Welcome to what we call Gravity Free Consulting.

Why Coody

At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a slimmed and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no luxurious conferences. But, what does this mean in practice?

Maximized Compensation - Typically a +40% salary increase.

Freedom & Flexibility - No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.

Employment Security - Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.

Shaping the Future - Projects and assignments for digital game changes like Mojang, Spotify, Volumental, Volvo Cars, Varjo, Toca Boca, Hemnet, and exciting startups and scaleups.

This is Coody

We’re a diverse community of ambitious tech people from more than 14 nationalities working on exciting challenges with customers across Sweden, Finland, USA, and the UK in industries ranging from gaming, AR, EV, AI, Medtech and Fintech.

Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy. Everything we do, we do to make sure individuals working here can live according to their own priorities and unique ambitions. A consultant-first environment where you have better control over your career.

Explore our Employee Handbook and discover a company that actually puts consultants first.

What you’ll be doing

As a Data Engineer Consultant at Coody, you'll be diving into technically exciting and intellectually challenging assignments to help companies strengthen their teams and projects. You’ll be designing and setting up fully automated data platforms and data pipelines that creates values for businesses and products in exciting industries. You’ll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments and usually work on 1-2 assignments per year.

Who you are

We’re looking for a Data Engineer with 5+ years of experience and a proven track record of making things happen. Here’s what we’re after:


Experience in designing, developing, and maintaining scalable data pipelines, infrastructure, and tools
Professional experience with tools like Python, Snowflake, Airflow, DBT, Tableau, ELT/ETL, BigQuery, Looker Studio, Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, SQL
A solid understanding of cloud environments; AWS / Google Cloud / Azure
A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Mathematics (or similar)
Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency
Fluent in English (spoken and written)


How To Apply

Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Din roll

Som Data Engineer hos oss kommer du att arbeta som konsult och få möjlighet att samarbeta med olika kunder i varierande branscher. Du kommer att arbeta med att samla in, hantera och analysera stora mängder data för att stödja affärsbeslut och skapa innovativa lösningar. I rollen ingår att designa och implementera dataflöden som är skalbara och effektiva, samt bidra med insikter och förbättringar för att optimera våra processer.

Du kommer att få erfarenhet av olika miljöer och utmaningar, vilket ger dig en unik möjlighet att bredda din kompetens och förståelse för hur data kan användas för att driva verksamheter framåt. I nära samarbete med andra team kommer du att vara med och utveckla lösningar som möjliggör smart och datadriven verksamhet.

Det här är en roll där du får möjlighet att arbeta med hela datalivscykeln och bidra till att skapa insikter som driver beslut och innovation.

Vem är du?

Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av:


Datainsamling samt att bygga och underhålla data pipelines och flöden, ELT/ETL, och Airflow.
Större datalagringslösningar såsom data warehouses, data lakes och delta lakes.
Datahantering inklusive datamodellering och rensning.
Datavisualisering och analys med verktyg som Power BI, QlikSense och Grafana.
Utveckling av REST API:er.
Det är krav på svenska i tal och skrift samt svenskt medborgarskap.



Du har dessutom kunskap och intresse av:


Kringliggande discipliner som data science, maskininlärning, analys och statistik.
Azure och Databricks.
Python och gärna PySpark.



Varför Knowit?

På Knowit Connectivity får du möjlighet att arbeta i en dynamisk och innovativ miljö där vi kombinerar teknik och kreativitet för att skapa värde för våra kunder. Du blir en del av ett kompetent team där samarbete och kunskapsdelning är i fokus. Hos oss får du möjlighet att utvecklas, lära dig nya teknologier och arbeta i spännande projekt.

Låter detta som en roll för dig?

Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig och diskutera hur du kan bli en del av vårt team.
Show more

Det här är en roll där du får möjlighet att arbeta med hela datalivscykeln och bidra till att skapa insikter som driver beslut och innovation.

Vem är du?

Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av:

  • Datainsamling samt att bygga och underhålla data pipelines och flöden, ELT/ETL, och Airflow.
  • Större datalagringslösningar såsom data warehouses, data lakes och delta lakes.
  • Datahantering inklusive datamodellering och rensning.
  • Datavisualisering och analys med verktyg som Power BI, QlikSense och Grafana.
  • Utveckling av REST API:er.
  • Det är krav på svenska i tal och skrift samt svenskt medborgarskap.


Du har dessutom kunskap och intresse av:

  • Kringliggande discipliner som data science, maskininlärning, analys och statistik.
  • Azure och Databricks.
  • Python och gärna PySpark.


Varför Knowit?

På Knowit Connectivity får du möjlighet att arbeta i en dynamisk och innovativ miljö där vi kombinerar teknik och kreativitet för att skapa värde för våra kunder. Du blir en del av ett kompetent team där samarbete och kunskapsdelning är i fokus. Hos oss får du möjlighet att utvecklas, lära dig nya teknologier och arbeta i spännande projekt.

Låter detta som en roll för dig?

Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig och diskutera hur du kan bli en del av vårt team.

Title: BI-specialist – Utveckla och optimera BI-lösningar för verksamhetens beslutstöd
Description:
Vi på Vindex söker en erfaren och drivande Business Intelligence Specialist med stark teknisk kompetens till ett spännande interimsuppdrag hos vår kund. I rollen har du en viktig position där du leder utvecklingen av BI-lösningar som möjliggör datadrivna beslut i hela verksamheten.




Uppdraget pågår i cirka 12 månader och startar i mitten av maj.







Om rollen




I rollen som BI-specialist kommer du att ansvara för att driva digital utveckling inom finansiell analys och rapportering. Du kommer att arbeta nära verksamheten för att tillgängliggöra data som kan stötta beslut på olika nivåer i organisationen. Ditt arbete kommer att vara centralt för att säkerställa att data används strategiskt för att skapa insikter och driva affärsförbättringar. Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete med ekonomifunktion, controlling och IT – där du fungerar som en brygga mellan verksamhetens behov och tekniska lösningar. Du kommer även att delta i initiativ för att standardisera rapporteringsstrukturer, effektivisera dataleveranser och stötta organisationen i att arbeta mer datadrivet.







Placering: Stockholm







Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter




Utveckling och underhåll av BI-lösningar, främst med hjälp av Microsofts BI-stack (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Power BI).
Ansvara för datamodellering och design av ETL-processer.
Samarbeta med verksamheten för att säkerställa att rätt data är tillgänglig för beslutsfattande.
Arbeta i agila team för att leverera lösningar i linje med verksamhetens behov.
Delta i vidareutveckling och optimering av datalager och BI-plattformar.
Etablera en centraliserad strategi för BI-verktyg, utveckla rapporter samt utbilda interna användare.
Översätta affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar och kravspecifikationer.
Utveckla dashboards och visualiseringar som ger ökad insikt i verksamhetens nyckeltal.
Delta i datakvalitetsarbete och bidra till förbättringar av masterdata.







Kvalifikationer




Minst 5 års erfarenhet av BI-utveckling, inklusive arbete med Microsofts BI-verktyg (SSIS, SSRS, Power BI).
Gedigen kompetens inom datamodellering, dataanalys och SQL.
Relevant akademisk examen inom datavetenskap, systemvetenskap, ekonomi eller liknande.
Erfarenhet av datalager lösningar, ETL-processer och integrationer.
Erfarenhet av agila arbetsmetoder.
God förståelse för ekonomiska processer, finansiell rapportering och nyckeltal.
Meriterande med erfarenhet från offentlig sektor samt Azure Data Factory och Synapse Analytics.
Meriterande med kunskaper inom data governance eller informationsarkitektur.







Om dig




För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är en självgående och analytisk person som trivs med att arbeta i team och mot högt ställda mål. Du har ett stort systemintresse och stark teknisk kompetens inom BI-verktyg, och en gedigen erfarenhet inom Business Intelligence. Du engageras av att lösa komplexa problem genom att tillgängliggöra data som kan skapa värde för verksamheten. Du har ett strukturerat arbetssätt och är van vid att omsätta affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar. Du är kommunikativ och trivs i en roll där du får vara en brygga mellan teknik och verksamhet. Din erfarenhet från BI-utveckling gör att du snabbt kan sätta dig in i nya uppdrag och leverera lösningar som gör skillnad.







Ansökan




Låter detta som en roll för dig - skicka in din ansökan idag! Urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Skicka ditt CV i Word-format till oss på Vindex och ange referensnummer AXBI2859. Tveka inte att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Alexander Butler (alexander.butler@vindex.se, 0709-208 492) vid fler frågor kring rollen.




Välkommen med din ansökan!







Vad vi erbjuder




Under din anställning som konsult hos Vindex får du alltid fast månadslön och omfattas av både olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring.




Som en del av processen för varje roll utförs en bakgrundskontroll på de aktuella slutkandidaterna som då kommer att informeras i förväg.







Om Vindex




Vindex är en rekryteringsbyrå som specialiserar sig på att hitta rätt talanger för ekonomiska och finansiella roller. Vi strävar efter att skapa långsiktiga och värdefulla relationer med både våra kunder och kandidater. Hos oss får du hjälp av erfarna rekryterare som förstår din kompetens och hjälper dig att hitta nästa spännande utmaning i karriären. Är du intresserad av fler spännande tjänster och uppdrag? Kika in under fliken Lediga tjänster.

Title: Data Innovation Manager
Description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions.

Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.

Role Summary

Hey! Have you ever wondered what fascinating insights can be derived from a vast pool of connected vehicles? Are you keen on helping our customers to understand the best way for electrification for them?

If this sounds like you - then you might be the perfect fit for our creative, diverse, and dynamic team with a very mixed background. What unites us is the ability to solve problems with data and finding innovative solutions to new problems.

You get the chance to try out new ideas and creative solutions within the framework of e-Mobility analytics. You will become part of an organization that is still defining the future of working with electric vehicles from a sales & marketing perspective. This means a lot of freedom, but also a lot of individual responsibility.

The job offers flexible working arrangements, allowing you to balance your professional and personal commitments effectively. As one example, we have an office close to Hötorget complementing our main site in Södertälje. A hybrid work setup is a natural part of our way of working.

In today's dynamic workforce, professional development is crucial, and this role offers ample opportunities for growth and advancement, ensuring you stay ahead in your career.

Job Responsibilities

We are looking to continue strengthening our competence within data and analytics. You will work as a part of the team, analyzing data from our connected vehicles, in combination with our simulation tools, and transform it into actionable insights in communication with customers and internal stakeholders.

Who You Are

You ideally have:



An engineering degree within system/computer science or similar
Proven experience (minimum 3 years) in software development, data/analytics, business analytics, or a similar role
Experience from working with e-mobility solutions and/or heavy vehicles
Understanding of data technologies, including cloud solutions and modern database solutions such as Snowflake
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or SQL, and experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think creatively and strategically
Exceptional communication skills with the ability to translate complex data concepts into actionable business insights, both internally and towards our customers



Of course, what you know is really important, but who you are is also a key aspect. To feel at home in our group, we think you should have



An explorative mindset
A self-going approach, with a strong ability to take and complete your own initiatives conscious drive for spreading the message on data to other cross-functions
An inspiring and inviting attitude
A liking for working in a still developing environment
An openness for new perspectives and solving problems as a team
An interest to lead and educate others in your areas of specialty



This Is Us

We are part of the Sales & Marketing organization at Scania. The world of transport and logistics is electrifying rapidly, and Scania is facing the biggest shift in our history. Our target is to take a leading role in the transformation by introducing new tailor-made products, services, and sustainable transport solutions.

We are working within the area of e-Mobility analytics, working both with our end customers to describe their operations in an electrified world – but also cross-functionally within the company, using our vast pool of connected vehicle data to create strategic insights.

Application

Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.

Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-05-11. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.

If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Marie Hammar (head of the team), marie.hammar@scania.com, +46 737483141

We look forward to your application!

If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Marie Hammar (head of the team), marie.hammar@scania.com, +46 737483141

We look forward to your application!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Hi all,

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated - Data Engineer to join in our client site - Stockholm.

Company Overview:

ITIVE AB is a leading technology company that specializes in providing innovative solutions for businesses across various industries. Our team of experts is committed to delivering cutting-edge technology and services to our clients, helping them stay ahead of the competition.

Key Responsibilities


Independently develop and optimize complex data pipelines, ensuring smooth data flow across multiple domains.
Utilize complex SQL querying techniques to extract, manipulate, and analyze data for various business needs.
Confidently use programming languages such as Java or Python to write classes, functions, and apply object-oriented programming principles, along with basic unit testing.
Guide junior Data Engineers on tasks and best practices, effectively delegating to promote team growth.
Understand business issues, create data-driven solutions, and present them to stakeholders, ensuring alignment with goals.
Identify optimization opportunities in data systems, plan implementations, and develop risk mitigation strategies.
Work with stakeholders and teams to drive data initiatives, providing leadership and contributing to the organizations data strategy.



Qualifications


Relevant academic degree in any technical field in BSc, BE or a related field
3-6 years of working experience in Data Engineering with strong experience in SQL, Python, or similar languages
Proficient in data modelling, warehousing, pipeline development, and documentation
Experience with production methodologies, software development principles, and Agile practices
Understanding of business needs related to the product scope
Deep understanding of cloud technologies and cloud development, as well as ability to select appropriate(cost-effective) tools for different tasks
Have a collaborative and co-creative mindset with excellent communication skills
Motivated to work in an environment that allows you to work and take decisions independently
Experience in working with data visualization tools



Cloud certification Required : Yes

Benefits:


Competitive salary and benefits package
Opportunity for growth and career advancement
Collaborative and dynamic work environment
Regular team building and social events
Continuous learning and development opportunities.



If you are interested and matching your CV, Kindly apply asap.

HTML:
Vi på Vindex söker en erfaren och drivande Business Intelligence Specialist med stark teknisk kompetens till ett spännande interimsuppdrag hos vår kund. I rollen har du en viktig position där du leder utvecklingen av BI-lösningar som möjliggör datadrivna beslut i hela verksamheten.


Uppdraget pågår i cirka 12 månader och startar i mitten av maj.



Om rollen


I rollen som BI-specialist kommer du att ansvara för att driva digital utveckling inom finansiell analys och rapportering. Du kommer att arbeta nära verksamheten för att tillgängliggöra data som kan stötta beslut på olika nivåer i organisationen. Ditt arbete kommer att vara centralt för att säkerställa att data används strategiskt för att skapa insikter och driva affärsförbättringar. Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete med ekonomifunktion, controlling och IT – där du fungerar som en brygga mellan verksamhetens behov och tekniska lösningar. Du kommer även att delta i initiativ för att standardisera rapporteringsstrukturer, effektivisera dataleveranser och stötta organisationen i att arbeta mer datadrivet.



Placering: Stockholm



Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter


  • Utveckling och underhåll av BI-lösningar, främst med hjälp av Microsofts BI-stack (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Power BI).
  • Ansvara för datamodellering och design av ETL-processer.
  • Samarbeta med verksamheten för att säkerställa att rätt data är tillgänglig för beslutsfattande.
  • Arbeta i agila team för att leverera lösningar i linje med verksamhetens behov.
  • Delta i vidareutveckling och optimering av datalager och BI-plattformar.
  • Etablera en centraliserad strategi för BI-verktyg, utveckla rapporter samt utbilda interna användare.
  • Översätta affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar och kravspecifikationer.
  • Utveckla dashboards och visualiseringar som ger ökad insikt i verksamhetens nyckeltal.
  • Delta i datakvalitetsarbete och bidra till förbättringar av masterdata.



Kvalifikationer


  • Minst 5 års erfarenhet av BI-utveckling, inklusive arbete med Microsofts BI-verktyg (SSIS, SSRS, Power BI).
  • Gedigen kompetens inom datamodellering, dataanalys och SQL.
  • Relevant akademisk examen inom datavetenskap, systemvetenskap, ekonomi eller liknande.
  • Erfarenhet av datalager lösningar, ETL-processer och integrationer.
  • Erfarenhet av agila arbetsmetoder.
  • God förståelse för ekonomiska processer, finansiell rapportering och nyckeltal.
  • Meriterande med erfarenhet från offentlig sektor samt Azure Data Factory och Synapse Analytics.
  • Meriterande med kunskaper inom data governance eller informationsarkitektur.



Om dig


För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är en självgående och analytisk person som trivs med att arbeta i team och mot högt ställda mål. Du har ett stort systemintresse och stark teknisk kompetens inom BI-verktyg, och en gedigen erfarenhet inom Business Intelligence. Du engageras av att lösa komplexa problem genom att tillgängliggöra data som kan skapa värde för verksamheten. Du har ett strukturerat arbetssätt och är van vid att omsätta affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar. Du är kommunikativ och trivs i en roll där du får vara en brygga mellan teknik och verksamhet. Din erfarenhet från BI-utveckling gör att du snabbt kan sätta dig in i nya uppdrag och leverera lösningar som gör skillnad.



Ansökan


Låter detta som en roll för dig - skicka in din ansökan idag! Urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Skicka ditt CV i Word-format till oss på Vindex och ange referensnummer AXBI2859. Tveka inte att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Alexander Butler (alexander.butler@vindex.se, 0709-208 492) vid fler frågor kring rollen.


Välkommen med din ansökan!



Vad vi erbjuder


Under din anställning som konsult hos Vindex får du alltid fast månadslön och omfattas av både olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring.


Som en del av processen för varje roll utförs en bakgrundskontroll på de aktuella slutkandidaterna som då kommer att informeras i förväg.



Om Vindex


Vindex är en rekryteringsbyrå som specialiserar sig på att hitta rätt talanger för ekonomiska och finansiella roller. Vi strävar efter att skapa långsiktiga och värdefulla relationer med både våra kunder och kandidater. Hos oss får du hjälp av erfarna rekryterare som förstår din kompetens och hjälper dig att hitta nästa spännande utmaning i karriären. Är du intresserad av fler spännande tjänster och uppdrag? Kika in under fliken Lediga tjänster.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Sektionen Business Management söker nu en erfaren Business Intelligence Analyst med flerårig erfarenhet, där fokus är affärs- och marknadsanalys för hela affärsområdet i Sverige. I rollen arbetar du datadrivet och insiktsbaserat för att bidra till faktabaserade beslut och långsiktig affärsutveckling.

Om rollen

Som Business Intelligence Analyst blir du en viktig del i att optimera lönsamheten för Preem AB, där du ansvarar för att ta fram underlag och analyser så att Preem som helhet fattar så bra affärsbeslut som möjligt. Du kommer att vara involverad i lönsamhet- & verksamhetsutvecklande initiativ/projekt samt koordinera större lönsamhetsanalyser.

I rollen ingår även att säkerställa att Preem har relevanta analyser som underlag för affärsbeslut. Du kommer därför arbeta med breda kontaktytor såväl inom som utanför affärsområdet samt samla in information från externa källor.

Du rapporterar direkt till Sektionschef för Business Management och är en del av ledningsgruppen, vars övergripande ansvar spänner över områdena produkterbjudande, prissättning, logistik samt projekt och affärsutveckling. I den här rollen är du en nyckelperson i att navigera i en snabbt föränderlig värld och skapa hållbar lönsamhet.

Tjänsteresor kan förekomma i rollen.

Fler huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter


Projektleda större Preem-gemensamma lönsamhetsanalyser.
Genomföra affärs- och konkurrentanalyser.
Presentera projekt och egna analyser för ledningsgrupper.


Vi erbjuder dig

Du blir en viktig del av Preem – en arbetsplats som präglas av välkomnande stämning, förtroende för medarbetarna och goda utvecklingsmöjligheter. Vi arbetar utifrån syftet att göra resan till en bättre framtid möjlig. Just nu genomgår vi den största omställningen i vår historia där det fossila successivt fasas ut och ersätts av förnybara alternativ. En omställning vi gör för att vi vill, kan och måste. Hos oss får du frihet under ansvar och uppmuntras att ta egna initiativ för att utveckla verksamheten framåt. För oss är det viktigt att du delar våra värderingar, Ansvarstagande, Nyskapande och Inkluderande eftersom de ligger till grund för allt vi gör.

Har du den här bakgrunden?


Ekonomisk-, kommersiell-, eller ingenjörsutbildning från högskola/universitet eller likvärdig arbetslivserfarenhet.
Flerårig erfarenhet av, och goda kunskaper i, omvärlds- och konkurrensanalys.
Avancerad användare i Excel och PowerPoint samt mycket goda kunskaper i modellbyggande.
Flerårig erfarenhet av att driva större projekt och en god presentationsförmåga.
Mycket god systemvana.
Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


Är det här du?

Vi söker dig som har en god analytisk förmåga och ett strukturerat arbetssätt, kombinerat med förmågan att identifiera strategiska och kommersiella insikter baserat på data och fakta. Du är självgående och målinriktad, med en tydlig affärsförståelse och ett intresse för att driva förändring genom väl underbyggda beslut. Din kommunikativa förmåga är god, och du har lätt för att anpassa budskap till olika målgrupper och intressenter. Hög integritet, ansvarstagande och ett uttalat kvalitetsfokus är egenskaper vi värdesätter högt. I denna rekrytering lägger vi stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.

Nästa steg

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan så snart som möjligt, men allra senast 26 maj 2025. Du ansöker genom att bifoga CV samt besvara urvalsfrågor. För att säkra objektiva bedömningar använder vi tester i samband med urval.

Om du har frågor om rollen eller processen är du välkommen att kontakta Malin Åblad, Sektionschef Business Management på malin.ablad@preem.se eller Recruitment Partner Caroline Ohlsson på caroline.ohlsson@preem.se alternativt 010-4501209.

Då Preem bedriver en samhällsviktig verksamhet genomförs alltid bakgrundskontroll samt alkohol-/drogtest inför ett anställningserbjudande. Vid intervju ska för Sverige godkänd ID-handling kunna uppvisas. Preem är även till del ett säkerhetsklassat företag och en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kan därför genomföras vid behov. Säkerhetsprövningen genomförs i enlighet med bestämmelser i säkerhetsskyddslagen.

Facklig kontaktperson finns här.

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

Preem är Sveriges största drivmedelsbolag. Vår vision är att leda omvandlingen mot ett hållbart samhälle. Senast 2035 har Preem som mål att producera cirka 5 miljoner kubikmeter förnybara drivmedel och vara klimatneutrala i hela värdekedjan.

Preems raffinaderier räknas till de mest moderna och miljöanpassade i Europa med en raffineringskapacitet på över 18 miljoner kubikmeter per år. Vi förädlar och säljer drivmedel, eldnings- och smörjolja samt andra produkter till företag och privatpersoner.

Vi har ett rikstäckande servicenät med ca 500 stationer för privat- och yrkestrafik. Preem AB har cirka 1 500 anställda varav 1 100 arbetar vid raffinaderierna. För helåret 2023 var Preems omsättning 138 miljarder SEK.
Show more

Title: Product Analyst
Description:
Working with analytics at Hemnet is about more than just numbers – it’s about making a real impact. As a Product Analyst at Hemnet you’ll deep dive into data while contributing with valuable insights into both the business and the technology behind Sweden’s leading property platform.

In this role you will have the opportunity to drive and develop product analytics in the consumer domain, an area that evolves around the search experience on hemnet.se and in our apps. You will play an important role in the cross functional team that aims to develop and improve our products with a well-proven data and insight driven work method. It is all about understanding user behavior by gathering, interpreting and visualizing data to get powerful insights.

We have two open positions, a permanent position and a one-year parental leave cover with the possibility of extension.

🛑 Last application day is May 19th

What You’ll Do

By turning data into actionable insights, you’ll help drive smarter, faster decisions that shape Hemnet’s future. You’ll have plenty of opportunities to influence our direction – and be part of creating the next chapter in our journey.

As a Product Analyst you’ll be a key member of a cross-functional product team. Working closely with your team, you’ll bring data to the heart of decision-making and help us build even better user experiences by understanding and driving insights into user behavior. You’re expected to push the analytics efforts by shaping and strengthening the domain’s analytical capabilities.

Besides the product team you will also be a part of the Analytics team together with other product analysts and BI developers. Together you are responsible for serving the organisation with data and insights on all levels to support our business goals. Together with the team, you’ll contribute to Hemnet’s overall analytics work and shape the future direction of our analytics function.

You’ll get to:


Drive the analytics work in the Consumer domain and act as a strategic partner on everything from prioritizations to hypothesis testing and insight-driven product development
Analyze user behavior and trends to uncover opportunities and inform product improvements
Build dashboards and reports that provide clear, actionable insights to your team
Design, run and evaluate A/B tests and other experiments to optimize the user experience
Be part of the broader Analytics team at Hemnet – collaborating with other product analysts and BI developers to strengthen how we work with data and insight across the whole company


What We Think You Bring


Extensive experience as a product analyst, preferably in a tech environment, agile team, or data-driven company
Strong communication skills – you know how to turn data into clear insights and guide others to act on them
Solid skills in working with raw data and writing SQL queries
Experience using tools like Google BigQuery, Amplitude, Google Analytics, GTM, Looker Studio or or other similar analytics tools
Experience with experimentation, conversion optimization, and A/B testing
A curious and solution-oriented mindset – you enjoy finding new ways forward and challenging the status quo
For this role, we are looking for someone who has a professional proficiency in both Swedish and English


🏡 Your career at Hemnet

Are you ready to play a meaningful role in one of the biggest decisions people make in life? If so – welcome to Hemnet! Since 1998, we’ve taken pride in making the life-changing, often stressful journey of finding a new home as smooth and enjoyable as possible.

At Hemnet, our mission is to connect every seller with every buyer, empower buyers to discover every home for sale, and enable real estate agents to match seamlessly with sellers. With over 40 million monthly visits, we’re Sweden’s most popular property platform and the first choice for Swedes looking to buy or sell a home. Together, we’re creating an open, transparent housing market, making home transactions in Sweden among the most efficient in the world.

Our success is built on a strong, friendly culture that values creativity, inclusivity, and collaboration. Hemnet is a place where everyone has a voice, and our welcoming environment helps you thrive and grow as you work alongside passionate colleagues from around the globe.

A Hybrid Way of Working

Our vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are currently building a Global Data Science team for a Global Infectious Disease company. We are looking for 2 Data Science Contractors to help support the project.




You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.

Responsibilities

Analyze raw data: assessing quality and cleansing
Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms
Collaborate with engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production
Generate actionable insights for business improvements




Qualifications




Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
At least 2 - 3 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modeling
Deep understanding of predictive modeling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
Fluency in a programming language (Python)
Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools.

Show more

  • Deep understanding of predictive modeling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Junior Data Engineer – Stockholm (Hybrid)




📍 Location: Stockholm – 3 days/week onsite

💼 Full-time, Permanent

🎁 Generous benefits package




Are you passionate about data and eager to kickstart your career in a modern, forward-thinking tech environment? We’re looking for a Junior Data Engineer to join a well-established, values-driven company with a strong foundation and long-term vision. Based in central Stockholm, this organization is part of a larger, family-owned group with over 140 years of history – providing stability, resources, and a commitment to innovation.




You’ll join a high-performing Data & Analytics team working with modern tools and architectures in Azure. This is a great opportunity for someone who’s just starting out or has 1-2 years of experience and wants to take the next step in a supportive environment that encourages learning, experimentation, and ownership.




🌟 What’s in it for you:

Exclusive opportunity - not advertised elsewhere
Work with top-tier colleagues - existing team members are highly skilled and collaborative
Modern cloud-based data stack - Azure, Databricks, Synapse, Fabric, and more
Freedom with responsibility - a flat, agile organization where your ideas matter
Excellent work-life balance - 30 days of vacation, wellness & healthcare allowance, and hybrid flexibility




🛠️ What You’ll Be Doing:

Building and maintaining robust, scalable data pipelines in Azure
Supporting the design and development of data models and ETL processes
Helping the organization leverage data for smarter decision-making
Collaborating across departments to deliver business-driven data solutions




🎓 What You Bring:

Relevant academic background (e.g., Computer Science, IT Systems, Engineering)
A strong interest in data engineering and analytics

Either:

Recent graduate with relevant studies and projects, OR
1-2 years of hands-on experience in data engineering or BI development
Exposure to SQL and either Python or Scala
Understanding of data modelling and ETL concepts
Fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written




✅ Nice to Have:

Experience with Microsoft Azure services like Data Factory, Synapse, or Databricks
Knowledge of Power BI or Microsoft’s on-prem BI stack (SSIS, SSAS)
Familiarity with object-oriented programming and agile methodologies




🎁 Perks & Benefits:

30 days’ vacation
Great pension plan
3,500 SEK annual wellness allowance (gym, etc.)
2,000 SEK annual healthcare allowance (dental, glasses, etc.)
Amazing on-site restaurant (you’ll pay about a third of what you would in the city)
Stable, purpose-driven organization with a long-term digital vision




❗ Additional Info:

Swedish work permit or citizenship required (no visa sponsorship available)
No travel required
Hybrid setup: 3 days per week in the Stockholm office




If you're excited to build your skills in a supportive team and help shape the future of data at a well-established, forward-looking company - we'd love to hear from you.




Ready to take the next step? We’re excited to meet you.

Show more
HTML:
Junior Data Engineer – Stockholm (Hybrid)


📍 Location: Stockholm – 3 days/week onsite

💼 Full-time, Permanent

🎁 Generous benefits package


Are you passionate about data and eager to kickstart your career in a modern, forward-thinking tech environment? We’re looking for a Junior Data Engineer to join a well-established, values-driven company with a strong foundation and long-term vision. Based in central Stockholm, this organization is part of a larger, family-owned group with over 140 years of history – providing stability, resources, and a commitment to innovation.


You’ll join a high-performing Data & Analytics team working with modern tools and architectures in Azure. This is a great opportunity for someone who’s just starting out or has 1-2 years of experience and wants to take the next step in a supportive environment that encourages learning, experimentation, and ownership.


🌟 What’s in it for you:

  • Exclusive opportunity - not advertised elsewhere
  • Work with top-tier colleagues - existing team members are highly skilled and collaborative
  • Modern cloud-based data stack - Azure, Databricks, Synapse, Fabric, and more
  • Freedom with responsibility - a flat, agile organization where your ideas matter
  • Excellent work-life balance - 30 days of vacation, wellness & healthcare allowance, and hybrid flexibility


🛠️ What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Building and maintaining robust, scalable data pipelines in Azure
  • Supporting the design and development of data models and ETL processes
  • Helping the organization leverage data for smarter decision-making
  • Collaborating across departments to deliver business-driven data solutions


🎓 What You Bring:

  • Relevant academic background (e.g., Computer Science, IT Systems, Engineering)
  • A strong interest in data engineering and analytics

Either:

  • Recent graduate with relevant studies and projects, OR
  • 1-2 years of hands-on experience in data engineering or BI development
  • Exposure to SQL and either Python or Scala
  • Understanding of data modelling and ETL concepts
  • Fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written


✅ Nice to Have:

  • Experience with Microsoft Azure services like Data Factory, Synapse, or Databricks
  • Knowledge of Power BI or Microsoft’s on-prem BI stack (SSIS, SSAS)
  • Familiarity with object-oriented programming and agile methodologies


🎁 Perks & Benefits:

  • 30 days’ vacation
  • Great pension plan
  • 3,500 SEK annual wellness allowance (gym, etc.)
  • 2,000 SEK annual healthcare allowance (dental, glasses, etc.)
  • Amazing on-site restaurant (you’ll pay about a third of what you would in the city)
  • Stable, purpose-driven organization with a long-term digital vision


❗ Additional Info:

  • Swedish work permit or citizenship required (no visa sponsorship available)
  • No travel required
  • Hybrid setup: 3 days per week in the Stockholm office


If you're excited to build your skills in a supportive team and help shape the future of data at a well-established, forward-looking company - we'd love to hear from you.


Ready to take the next step? We’re excited to meet you.

Title: Data Quality Control Analyst
Description:
Media help partners understand the changing advertising landscape. Specialising in audience measurement, consumer targeting and in-depth intelligence into paid, owned and earned media, their global coverage and local expertise enable better understanding of media audiences and their relationships with brands.

Kantar Media is a wholly owned but operationally independent part of the Kantar Group.

Job Details

As people increasingly move across channels and platforms, Kantar Media’s data and audience measurement, targeting, analytics and advertising intelligence services unlock insights to inform powerful decision-making.

Working with panel and first-party data in over 80 countries, we have the world’s fastest growing cross-media measurement footprint, underpinned by versatility, scale, technology and expertise, to drive long-term business growth for our clients and partners.

Our versatility, scale, technology, and expertise enable our 5000 people across Latin America, Europe, the Middle East, Asia Pacific, North America, and Africa to understand audiences and help the world’s leading organisations succeed and grow

Location: Stockholm

Role Description

Excitingly Kantar Media has partnered with the MMS to build a new Cross-Media Measurement panel in Sweden, that will be one of the first of its kind in the world. We are looking for forward-thinking, diverse, and client-focused individuals to join our team and make this audience measurement panel a success for MMS and Kantar Media.

We have a vacancy for a Data Quality Control Analyst. You will supervise and maintain the quality of the panel as well as the data which should be delivered to clients daily.

As a Data Quality Engineer, you will analyze data throughout the entire data processing pipeline. This process starts inside the individual meters, installed in panelists’ homes, and ends at the point where data is delivered to the clients. You will investigate issues or weaknesses in this process and resolve them by implementing direct fixes or developing tools or analyses. These can be used by yourself or other members of the Kantar Media team to generate insights which contribute to improving or maintaining the quality of the panel and the data it produces. You will be included in setting up an exciting and large project from scratch. Therefore, we are looking for a professional who is eager to help build this project using innovative tooling in an international, data-driven organization.

Tasks And Responsibilities


Validate the quality of data produced by deployed systems by comparing data, generating metrics and calculating statistics.
Build complete understanding of the data structure at each step of the generation process and the edits which happen between these steps to ultimately generate the delivery data.
Design, develop, test and maintain data analysis pipelines for automated checking of data.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues in data generation process to ensure correct and consistent data quality and integrity.
Configure and implement new features in the data without disrupting the existing structure.
Combine and organize data from different sources (Azure Blob Storage, SQL, APIs among others) to help generate valuable insights.
Create impactful visualizations and interactive tools using Power BI, Databricks, or equivalent solutions, both for your own use as well as to be used by others.
Demonstrate strong communication skills, conveying intricate technical concepts effectively.
Exhibit trustworthiness, resilience, and a quick-learning aptitude.
Demonstrate flexibility in taking on various tasks and adapting to changing priorities.


Required


Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Writing Python, R or Scala scripts for data analysis and automation solutions.
SQL programming for effective data combination and acquisition.
Cloud environment (Azure).
Industry big data platform stack (Databricks, Spark)
Data visualization and dashboarding (Python, R, Power BI, Databricks)
Analytical and creative problem solving skills for effective troubleshooting of data issues.


Good To Have


Advanced statistics and machine Learning skills
Azure and DevOps Knowledge
Advanced Excel skills


At Kantar Media we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.

We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion, and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us.

We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted, and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and wellbeing is taken into consideration. We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.

At Kantar Media, the diversity of our employees provides a richer environment for our employees and broader depth and breadth of thinking for our clients. Kantar is committed to inclusion and diversity; therefore, we welcome applications from all sections of society and do not discriminate based on age, race, religion, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristics.

Interested? Apply today or get in contact with maria.bonal@kantar.com to learn more.

Country

Sweden

Why join Kantar?

We pride ourselves on understanding people, and what makes us think and act the way we do.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.


Show more

Title: Data engineer
Description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.

Job Description


Design and implement scalable data pipelines and ETL processes.
Collaborate with data analysts and scientists to understand data requirements and deliver working solutions for production.
Ensure data quality and integrity
Optimize data storage and retrieval for performance and cost-efficiency.
Provide technical expertise and support to team members and stakeholders.


Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Experience working with both data engineering and data science
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and data warehousing solutions.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Skills and experience in working with time-series data and time-series databases such as influxDB or Timebase
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and frameworks.
Skills in developing models to forecast future trends based on historical data.
Knowledge of data privacy and security regulations.
Basic understanding of web applications and REST APIs


Application deadline: 16-05-2025

About Us

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!

🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.

🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.

🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.

💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.

🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?

🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.

📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.

🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.

Title: Sustainability Analyst
Description:
YOUR MISSION AT VOI

As the Sustainability Analyst you will report to our Head of Sustainability and collaborate closely with internal and external stakeholders to drive the development and implementation of our global sustainability strategy and communication, work proactively to ensure sustainability performance and compliance with environmental regulations and industry standards, and contribute to building the Voi brand sustainability content. This will include:




Sustainability strategy: Collaborate closely with the Head of Sustainability and other colleagues to define and implement Voi’s sustainability strategy, including optimising resource use to reduce environmental impact, and drive progress to position Voi as a global leader in sustainability.
Monitoring & supporting change: Work continuously to stay up to date on sustainability related regulations, industry peer activity, academic research, assess risk associated with the sustainability goals, and initiate and support change initiatives to achieve key sustainability goals.
Data collection: Collaborate with internal stakeholders and external suppliers to collect data related to sustainability metrics, e.g. carbon emissions, energy consumption and waste management, ensuring transparency, traceability, accountability and compliance with regulations, e.g. CSRD, CBAM and the EU taxonomy.
Analysis & reporting: Analyse data and develop recommendations for sustainability management and sustainability performance reports.
Communication: Support the sustainability-, tender-, investor relations- and marketing teams in crafting and delivering the Voi sustainability narrative based on the strategic sustainability direction and progress.




WHAT YOU NEED TO EMBARK

We’re looking for an analytical, thorough and solution oriented sustainability professional, with the ability to manage and sanity check large data sets, and collaborate efficiently with diverse stakeholders. Apart from being fluent in English, self-sufficient and goal-oriented, we believe the right person has:




B.Sc. in Engineering or Business, preferably with a sustainability specialisation
Experience from management consulting, sustainability consulting or a similar position in a fast-paced dynamic environment
Experience from managing data collection, data analysis and projects with multiple stakeholders
Experience from working with large data sets and data bases, experience using SQL and python is a merit
Experience of sustainability-, CSR or ESG controlling/reporting, industry standards (e.g. GRI, CSRD) and environmental management system (e.g.ISO 14001) is a merit
Experience with sustainable procurement and audits of external suppliers is a merit




WHY VOI?

Working at Voi is more than just a job; Our People Promise includes a personal voyage where you will grow as a professional and be a part of a team and culture that builds something meaningful for society. In addition to this you’ll have the opportunity to:




Join Europe’s #1 micromobility operator and one of the fastest growing scaleups
Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program
Have a direct impact on Voi’s sustainability strategy, brand sustainability content and position as a global leader in sustainability
Collaborate with inspiring, motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal
Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution




Are you ready to become a Voiager?

Since 2018, Voi has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.




Diversity Matters

As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

Show more

Title: Impact Analyzer
Description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".

We are now looking for an Impact Analyser to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Analytics & Innovation Director.

How you can contribute and have an impact?


Follow and measure the impact of the incubators work and ensure the sustainability aspect within the projects and activities and to record/share learnings.
Impact Measurement: Develop and implement metrics and methodologies to measure the impact of incubator projects and activities.
Sustainability Assurance: Ensure that all projects and activities within the incubator are designed and executed with sustainability in mind.
Data Collection and Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret data to assess the effectiveness and sustainability of incubator initiatives.
Reporting: Prepare detailed reports on the impact and sustainability of projects, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
Knowledge Sharing: Record and share learnings from incubator projects with internal teams and external stakeholders to promote best practices and continuous improvement.
Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with project teams, mentors, and external partners to gather feedback and ensure alignment with sustainability goals.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for enhancing the impact and sustainability of incubator activities and implement necessary changes.


What we look for:


Proven experience in impact measurement, sustainability management, or a related role.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Sustainability, Innovation Management, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage.
Business viability mindset.
New business model experience
Customer journey understanding.
Lifecycle management.
New business model design, Pricing, Market sizing.
Workshop animation.
Strong analytical, project management, and communication skills.
Ability to work with diverse stakeholders and drive continuous improvement.
Detail-oriented, proactive, and passionate about sustainability and innovation.


Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Amsterdam Netherlands


Show more
