Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".

We are now looking for an Impact Analyser to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Analytics & Innovation Director.

How you can contribute and have an impact?

  • Follow and measure the impact of the incubators work and ensure the sustainability aspect within the projects and activities and to record/share learnings.
  • Impact Measurement: Develop and implement metrics and methodologies to measure the impact of incubator projects and activities.
  • Sustainability Assurance: Ensure that all projects and activities within the incubator are designed and executed with sustainability in mind.
  • Data Collection and Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret data to assess the effectiveness and sustainability of incubator initiatives.
  • Reporting: Prepare detailed reports on the impact and sustainability of projects, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
  • Knowledge Sharing: Record and share learnings from incubator projects with internal teams and external stakeholders to promote best practices and continuous improvement.
  • Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with project teams, mentors, and external partners to gather feedback and ensure alignment with sustainability goals.
  • Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for enhancing the impact and sustainability of incubator activities and implement necessary changes.

What we look for:

  • Proven experience in impact measurement, sustainability management, or a related role.
  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Sustainability, Innovation Management, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
  • Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage.
  • Business viability mindset.
  • New business model experience
  • Customer journey understanding.
  • Lifecycle management.
  • New business model design, Pricing, Market sizing.
  • Workshop animation.
  • Strong analytical, project management, and communication skills.
  • Ability to work with diverse stakeholders and drive continuous improvement.
  • Detail-oriented, proactive, and passionate about sustainability and innovation.

Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Amsterdam Netherlands

Title: (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst - based at our Luxembourg
Description:
This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.

The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Legal Directorate (JU) – Coordination Division (COORD) – at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst* - This is a full time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.


internal benchmark (Associate) Officer Business Support for IT Applications


Panel interviews are forseen as of March 2025.

Purpose

This role is based in the Coordination Division of the Legal Directorate. As an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst, you will work in coordination with a Senior Legal Engineering and Innovation Officer to: (i) co-ordinate the prospecting of new applications suitable for the Legal Directorate, (ii) ensure maintenance, assistance, development and deployment of IT applications for the Legal Directorate, (iii) liaise with stakeholders in the Legal Directorate to ensure close alignment with business needs, and (iv) contribute to successful IT project delivery and change management. You will also contribute to the development and maintenance of the Legal Directorate’s intranet presence and to compliance with the Bank’s data governance and data quality frameworks.

Operating Network

You will report to and work under the supervision of the Head of Division of JU Coordination. You will work closely with the senior management team of the Legal Directorate, JU divisions and various other counterparts. You will cooperate with central IT Services with other Data Officers and with external consultants.

Accountabilities


Contribute to the development and deployment of new IT applications in the Legal Directorate to ensure broad-based, timely and efficient take up of new technologies
Provide support to internal clients concerning existing IT applications used by the Legal Directorate
Develop, deploy and provide ongoing support for the intranet presence of the Legal Directorate
Find new use cases for existing or new IT applications, taking into account the needs of the Legal Directorate relative to the overall IT environment of the Bank
Perform the role of JU Data Officer by: (i) taking the lead in matters related to compliance with EIBG’s data governance, data management and data quality framework, (ii) identifying and remedying data governance issues adversely affecting the functioning of the Legal Directorate; and (iii) participating in meetings of the Information Governance Steering Committee and analogous bodies to represent the interests of the Legal Directorate
Contribute to streamlining of JU internal processes and map, standardize, control, and automate legal workflows, documents, templates, and electronic records
Provide change management support to IT, Legal Tech & Innovation projects in the Legal Directorate


Qualifications


University degree, preferably in Business Administration, Computer Science/Engineering and / or in another area relevant to the job
At least 3 years of relevant professional experience in a role related to IT engineering and/or innovation
Familiarity with the SDLC (software development lifecycle), ideally at the EIBG or other relevant organization, is required
Business analysis and change management experience would be a strong asset
Knowledge of all or most of the following: Microsoft Sharepoint online, Business Object, Microsoft 365, OpenText Livelink, Smart-IT is required
Excellent organisational skills and ability to prioritise and meet deadlines, with strong result and customer orientation
Understanding of the EIB ’s mission, organisation and activities
Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (*) with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage


Competencies

Find out more about EIB core competencies here

To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here

(*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.

We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.

We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.

Deadline for applications: This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Din roll

Som Data Engineer hos oss kommer du att arbeta som konsult och få möjlighet att samarbeta med olika kunder i varierande branscher. Du kommer att arbeta med att samla in, hantera och analysera stora mängder data för att stödja affärsbeslut och skapa innovativa lösningar. I rollen ingår att designa och implementera dataflöden som är skalbara och effektiva, samt bidra med insikter och förbättringar för att optimera våra processer.

Du kommer att få erfarenhet av olika miljöer och utmaningar, vilket ger dig en unik möjlighet att bredda din kompetens och förståelse för hur data kan användas för att driva verksamheter framåt. I nära samarbete med andra team kommer du att vara med och utveckla lösningar som möjliggör smart och datadriven verksamhet.

Det här är en roll där du får möjlighet att arbeta med hela datalivscykeln och bidra till att skapa insikter som driver beslut och innovation.

Vem är du?

Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av:


Datainsamling samt att bygga och underhålla data pipelines och flöden, ELT/ETL, och Airflow.
Större datalagringslösningar såsom data warehouses, data lakes och delta lakes.
Datahantering inklusive datamodellering och rensning.
Datavisualisering och analys med verktyg som Power BI, QlikSense och Grafana.
Utveckling av REST API:er.
Det är krav på svenska i tal och skrift samt svenskt medborgarskap.



Du har dessutom kunskap och intresse av:


Kringliggande discipliner som data science, maskininlärning, analys och statistik.
Azure och Databricks.
Python och gärna PySpark.



Varför Knowit?

På Knowit Connectivity får du möjlighet att arbeta i en dynamisk och innovativ miljö där vi kombinerar teknik och kreativitet för att skapa värde för våra kunder. Du blir en del av ett kompetent team där samarbete och kunskapsdelning är i fokus. Hos oss får du möjlighet att utvecklas, lära dig nya teknologier och arbeta i spännande projekt.

Låter detta som en roll för dig?

Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig och diskutera hur du kan bli en del av vårt team.

Title: CRM-Analytiker till Rusta
Company: KiMM - en del av Wise Professionals
Description:
Som CRM-Analytiker får du en viktig roll i att analysera kund- och försäljningsdata för att identifiera trender, beteenden och möjligheter för förbättring! Du kommer till en energifylld arbetsplats med mycket driv, med kontoret placerat i fina lokaler på huvudkontoret i Upplands Väsby. Du rapporterar till Head of Digital and Customer Insights

Exempel På Uppgifter Och Ansvarsområden


Analysera kund och försäljningsdata för att identifiera trender, beteenden och möjligheter för förbättring.
Utveckla och underhålla rapporter och dashboards för att övervaka viktiga KPI:er.
Samarbeta med marknadsförings- inköps- och försäljningsteam för att implementera datadrivna strategier.
Utföra segments- och målgruppsanalys för att stödja framtagandet av erbjudanden, kampanjer som driver kundengagemang.
Övervaka och optimera CRM-system för att säkerställa datakvalitet och integritet.
Presentera insikter och rekommendationer till Marknadsledningen och andra intressenter.


Vem är du?

För att bli framgångsrik i rollen tror vi att du har mycket god kommunikations- och presentationsförmåga. Du trivs i att arbeta både självständigt och i team.

Vi Ser Gärna Att Du Har/är


Några års erfarenhet av dataanalys, helst inom CRM eller kundanalys.
Stark analytisk förmåga och erfarenhet av att arbeta med stora datamängder.
Erfarenhet av att använda analysverktyg som SQL, Excel, Tableau, Power BI eller liknande.
Relevant utbildning inom statistik eller datavetenskap, alternativt kunskap genom erfarenhet.
Förståelse för databashantering och goda statistikkunskaper.
Förståelse för CRM-processer, kundstrategier och kundrelaterade nyckeltal.
Mycket god engelska i tal och skrift.


Om Rusta

På Rusta är vi övertygade om att företagets framgång bygger på medarbetarnas framgång. Det finns fler anledningar till att det är roligt och utmanande att arbeta med marknad och kommunikation hos oss. Framför allt för att vi lyckats förvalta vår historia parallellt med stort fokus på innovation, hållbarhet och marknadstrender!

Rusta vill vara det självklara förstahandsvalet när du ska förnya och fylla på hemma. Sedan vi öppnade 1986 har vi fördubblat vår omsättning vart femte år. Detta tack vare ett unikt och framgångsrikt affärskoncept, där logistiken är en av det viktigaste pusselbitarna. Vi har nämligen full kontroll över både inköps- och transportkedja och undviker på så sätt dyra mellanhänder.

Allt efter vi växer kan vi erbjuda dig ännu längre priser. Det innebär också att vi får bättre förutsättningar att kunna erbjuda ännu fler kunder Rustas breda sortiment av hem-och fritidsprodukter, med bra kvalitet till marknadens lägsta priser. Vår devis Det ska inte vara dyrt att välja hållbart är ett fundament som vi står stadigt på. Hos Rusta ska det vara enkelt att förnya och fylla på hemma utan att behöva kompromissa med vårt gemensamma ansvar gentemot kommande generationer.

Låter det intressant?

I den här rekryteringen samarbetar vi med KIMM / Wise Professionals. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan med CV på kimm.se. Vi tar tyvärr inte emot ansökningar via mail pga GDPR. Processen innehåller arbetspsykologiska tester.

Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Vi gör löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag.

Har du frågor om tjänsten vänligen kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Maggie Klingenstierna på maggie.klingenstierna@kimm.se.

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
Show more

Title: Data Engineer Insight
Description:
Data Engineer

Do you want to build the next datamodels för AI, ML and datawarehouse empowered solutions?

Nexer Insight, a Microsoft partner, invites you to embark on a journey as a Data Engineer where you'll be part of an extraordinary team, engage in exciting activities, work with fascinating clients, tackle varied and challenging tasks, and enjoy exceptional benefits. We are committed to leveraging cutting-edge technologies such as Databricks to drive innovation and excellence in everything we do.

Do you want to be our next ”Data Ninja”?

Joining Nexer Insight means becoming a vital part of a company that embodies entrepreneurship and innovation. Here, you'll have the chance to engage with cutting-edge technology from Microsoft, Databricks, and DBT Labs, as we proudly partner with them. We're committed to investing in our employees, empowering them to excel in their fields through professional growth and development opportunities. Collaboration is at the heart of our approach, as we value teamwork and foster a vibrant community spirit. Dive into the exciting intersection of data engineering and data science, where you'll have the chance to make a meaningful impact.

Key Responsibilities:


Develop and operate scalable and robust analytical models.
Set up data platforms and build data models and pipelines.
Innovate and collaborate with customers to learn and find new business opportunities.
Become a champion in best practices regarding architecture, data quality, reliability, and performance.
Be at the forefront of the latest data engineering technology.
Leveraging Microsoft Azure services for data processing, transformation, and storage.
You propel progress and ensure delivery by constructing top-tier cloud solutions, empowering our customers to adopt a data-driven approach.



Based on our criteria för the role, we expect you to have:


Hands-on project experience of working with cloud solutions (Azure, AWS or GCP)
Experience working with ETL tools such as Azure Data Factory, Databricks, DBT, Snowflake
Experience with Data Lakes or Lakehouse Architecture
In-depth knowledge of SQL syntax
Experience in information and dimensional modelling
Good knowledge of DevOps processes with git version control and CI/CD methodology
Speaks English and Swedish fluently



Meritorious experience:


Platform modernisation
Tabular cubes and DAX
Data Vault modelling
Experience in setting up Azure, AWS or GCP Infrastructure
Show more

  • In-depth knowledge of SQL syntax
  • Experience in information and dimensional modelling
  • Good knowledge of DevOps processes with git version control and CI/CD methodology
  • Speaks English and Swedish fluently


Meritorious experience:

  • Platform modernisation
  • Tabular cubes and DAX
  • Data Vault modelling
  • Experience in setting up Azure, AWS or GCP Infrastructure

Title: Data Innovation Manager
Description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions.

Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.

Role Summary

Hey! Have you ever wondered what fascinating insights can be derived from a vast pool of connected vehicles? Are you keen on helping our customers to understand the best way for electrification for them?

If this sounds like you - then you might be the perfect fit for our creative, diverse, and dynamic team with a very mixed background. What unites us is the ability to solve problems with data and finding innovative solutions to new problems.

You get the chance to try out new ideas and creative solutions within the framework of e-Mobility analytics. You will become part of an organization that is still defining the future of working with electric vehicles from a sales & marketing perspective. This means a lot of freedom, but also a lot of individual responsibility.

The job offers flexible working arrangements, allowing you to balance your professional and personal commitments effectively. As one example, we have an office close to Hötorget complementing our main site in Södertälje. A hybrid work setup is a natural part of our way of working.

In today's dynamic workforce, professional development is crucial, and this role offers ample opportunities for growth and advancement, ensuring you stay ahead in your career.

Job Responsibilities

We are looking to continue strengthening our competence within data and analytics. You will work as a part of the team, analyzing data from our connected vehicles, in combination with our simulation tools, and transform it into actionable insights in communication with customers and internal stakeholders.

Who You Are

You ideally have:



An engineering degree within system/computer science or similar
Proven experience (minimum 3 years) in software development, data/analytics, business analytics, or a similar role
Experience from working with e-mobility solutions and/or heavy vehicles
Understanding of data technologies, including cloud solutions and modern database solutions such as Snowflake
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or SQL, and experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think creatively and strategically
Exceptional communication skills with the ability to translate complex data concepts into actionable business insights, both internally and towards our customers



Of course, what you know is really important, but who you are is also a key aspect. To feel at home in our group, we think you should have



An explorative mindset
A self-going approach, with a strong ability to take and complete your own initiatives conscious drive for spreading the message on data to other cross-functions
An inspiring and inviting attitude
A liking for working in a still developing environment
An openness for new perspectives and solving problems as a team
An interest to lead and educate others in your areas of specialty



This Is Us

We are part of the Sales & Marketing organization at Scania. The world of transport and logistics is electrifying rapidly, and Scania is facing the biggest shift in our history. Our target is to take a leading role in the transformation by introducing new tailor-made products, services, and sustainable transport solutions.

We are working within the area of e-Mobility analytics, working both with our end customers to describe their operations in an electrified world – but also cross-functionally within the company, using our vast pool of connected vehicle data to create strategic insights.

Application

Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.

Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-05-11. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.

If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Marie Hammar (head of the team), marie.hammar@scania.com, +46 737483141

We look forward to your application!
Show more

We look forward to your application!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Hi all,

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated - Data Engineer to join in our client site - Stockholm.

Company Overview:

ITIVE AB is a leading technology company that specializes in providing innovative solutions for businesses across various industries. Our team of experts is committed to delivering cutting-edge technology and services to our clients, helping them stay ahead of the competition.

Key Responsibilities


Independently develop and optimize complex data pipelines, ensuring smooth data flow across multiple domains.
Utilize complex SQL querying techniques to extract, manipulate, and analyze data for various business needs.
Confidently use programming languages such as Java or Python to write classes, functions, and apply object-oriented programming principles, along with basic unit testing.
Guide junior Data Engineers on tasks and best practices, effectively delegating to promote team growth.
Understand business issues, create data-driven solutions, and present them to stakeholders, ensuring alignment with goals.
Identify optimization opportunities in data systems, plan implementations, and develop risk mitigation strategies.
Work with stakeholders and teams to drive data initiatives, providing leadership and contributing to the organizations data strategy.



Qualifications


Relevant academic degree in any technical field in BSc, BE or a related field
3-6 years of working experience in Data Engineering with strong experience in SQL, Python, or similar languages
Proficient in data modelling, warehousing, pipeline development, and documentation
Experience with production methodologies, software development principles, and Agile practices
Understanding of business needs related to the product scope
Deep understanding of cloud technologies and cloud development, as well as ability to select appropriate(cost-effective) tools for different tasks
Have a collaborative and co-creative mindset with excellent communication skills
Motivated to work in an environment that allows you to work and take decisions independently
Experience in working with data visualization tools



Cloud certification Required : Yes

Benefits:


Competitive salary and benefits package
Opportunity for growth and career advancement
Collaborative and dynamic work environment
Regular team building and social events
Continuous learning and development opportunities.



If you are interested and matching your CV, Kindly apply asap.
Show more

Title: Were You at Women in Tech? Join Our Talent Pool!
Description:
Why Join Us?

At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond. 

To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.

Hello,

Did our booth at Women in Tech spark your interest? If so, we’re excited to connect with you!

At Tobii Dynavox, we develop life-changing technology, and we’re always looking for talented engineers to join us on this journey.

Don’t See a Role for You Right Now? Apply Anyway!

Even if we don’t have the perfect position for your skills today, we want to stay connected. By submitting an open application, we’ll consider your profile for future opportunities—whether it’s in six months, a year, or beyond. You will also get invited to events that we host that suits your profile.

How To Apply

Share your CV and if you want also a brief personal statement explaining your interests and expertise.

We’re excited about the possibility of working together to shape the future of assistive technology.

Our Values:

At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.

What We Offer:

At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:


Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
“Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer with interest in Financial Crime Prevention | SEB, Stockholm
Description:
SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fuelled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.

Join Our Mission Against Financial Crime

Would you like to work with a team of highly skilled Software Engineers to build solutions that empower complex investigations? We’re looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join our Financial Crime Prevention team—where data, technology, and purpose align to detect and prevent bad actors.

About The Role

As a Data Engineer in the Financial Crime Prevention team, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining new technical capabilities in a smart way to allow us to detect bad actors. Here you will have a chance to make a difference and work with challenging tasks. You will have great opportunities to both develop and take further steps in your career working within a highly collaborative environment.

To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have


Experience in large scale Data Engineering projects
Experience in Streaming technology such as Data Flow
Experience of batch technology such as Data Proc
Experience in Schema Registry
Experience in Infrastructure as Code such as Terraform
Knowledge in Graph DB is an advantage
Analytical mindset and ability to solve complex technical problems
Passion for challenges to drive your personal development and professional growth
Being a team player open for growth and learning is crucially important for the role


What We Offer


Innovative company at the forefront of technology
Extensive training and learning opportunities
Attractive compensation and benefits
Work-life balance
Friendly and welcoming culture 


Do you want to be part of SEB?

Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 31st of May 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact rasmus.hallberg@seb.se

Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/techcareers

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Starka tillsammans - Bli en av oss

Som en av Nordens främsta inom betallösningar kan vi erbjuda en stimulerande och kreativ arbetsmiljö. Vi är öppna för nya idéer och arbetssätt samtidigt som vi alltid strävar efter att göra det enkelt och lätt för våra kunder.




Hos oss kan du utveckla din kompetens tillsammans med engagerade ledare och kollegor. Vill du utmanas i din yrkesroll och arbeta i en stark gemenskap där vi tar hand om varandra, samtidigt som vi visar varandra uppskattning är vi rätt arbetsplats för dig.




Läs gärna mer om oss på career.payexgroup.com.




Vi söker en driven och lösningsorienterad Data Engineer som vill vara med och bygga vår moderna dataplattform.




Kreditfunktionen inom PayEx ansvarar för övergripande kvalitetssäkrad kreditriskhantering och skall initiera och leverera styrande dokument, beslutsordning, effektiva och regelrätta kreditprocesser samt monitorering, rapportering och analys av de finansiella affärerna samt att styra mot uppsatta kreditriskmål.




Idag består kreditfunktionen av 8 personer i Stockholm, Visby och Oslo och är indelade i ett team med controllers och i ett analysteam med analytiker som arbetar tätt tillsammans. Denna roll är placerad i analysteamet och placeringen kan vara i Stockholm eller Visby.




Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:

Utveckla och underhålla ETL-processer för att samla in, transformera och ladda data från olika källor samt optimering av databaser och flöden.
Designa och bygga robusta datamodeller som stödjer avancerad analys och rapportering samt kontinuerligt säkerställa att data finns tillgängligt och är strukturerat på ett tillfredsställande sätt.
Arbeta med medaljarkitektur för att säkerställa hög tillgänglighet, prestanda och säkerhet för våra datalösningar.
Utveckla och underhålla datalösningar i Microsoft Azure.
Arbeta nära tillsammans med analytiker och andra stakeholders för att förstå och möta deras databehov som du sedan kommer att implementera.
Dokumentation av teknisk lösning och alla processer.
Utforska nya tekniker och verktyg för att förbättra vår datainfrastruktur.




Din profil:

Vi ser gärna att du har ett par års erfaren av att liknande arbete som data engineer, och erfarenheter från bank- finans- betal- kredit branscherna är meriterande.




Tidigare erfarenhet från programmering och databaskunskaper i SQL är ett krav, och stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personliga egenskaper.




Relevant akademisk utbildning inom datavetenskap, statistik eller liknande.
Solid kunskap inom SQL, DBT, Git, Python och analysprodukter i Azure-plattformen (t.ex. Azure Databricks, Microsoft Fabric).
Erfarenhet av datamodellering, ETL-processer och datavarhusslösningar.
Erfarenhet av medaljarkitektur eller liknande.
God problemlösningsförmåga, noggrann och med förmåga att ta stort eget ansvar.
God kommunikationsförmåga i svenska och engelska, både skriftligt och muntligt.




Meriterande:

Erfarenhet av arbete inom finansbranschen.
Certifieringar inom Azure eller liknande.
God kunskap inom Power BI.




Vad kan vi erbjuda dig? Tillsammans med drivna och inspirerande kollegor får du vara en del av ett drivet team som bidrar till bolagets framgång. En härlig arbetsmiljö med kontor i centrala Stockholm såväl som Visby innerstad. Utöver det så erbjuder vi alla våra medarbetare ett attraktivt förmånspaket.




Vill du bli vår kollega? Skicka din ansökan redan idag!

Tjänsten är på heltid med start snarast möjligt eller eller enligt överenskommelse.




Placeringsort: Stockholm eller Visby




Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-05-03. Ansökningarna behandlas konfidentiellt. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum. Vid frågor gällande tjänsten kontakta Johan Råberg, Head of Credit Risk Analytics, johan.raberg@payex.com

Finansförbundet: Heidi Larsson +46 73 04 42 168

SACO: Sofia Enekvist +46 70 27 88 106




Vi värdesätter de kvaliteter som en mångfald av människor tillför i vår verksamhet. För att vara så fördomsfria som möjligt i vår rekrytering använder vi oss av anonymisering av CV:n. Vi ber dig även utesluta: namn, ålder, kön och bilder i ditt personliga brev.




Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess validerar vi identitet och genomför bakgrundskontroller för att säkerställa en trygg anställningsprocess.




Vi har redan valt våra rekryteringskanaler och undanber oss därför kontakt från externa rekryteringsfirmor och annonsförsäljare.




PayEx är en av Nordens främsta leverantörer av kompletta betallösningar och består av två affärsområden: PayEx Ledger and Financing och Swedbank Pay.




PayEx Ledger & Financing är namnet på vårt erbjudande för tjänster inom rating och billing, faktura- och reskontrahantering, inkasso, kredithantering och finansiering.




Swedbank Pay erbjuder produkter och tjänster som förenklar betalningar där försäljare och kunder möts – både i fysiska butiker och online.




Vi drivs av innovationskraft och vår strävan efter att hjälpa människor, företag och samhällen att växa. Idag är vi ett av de ledande företagen inom betallösningar med verksamhet i Sverige, Norge, Danmark och Finland. Något som inte hade varit möjligt utan våra engagerade och kompetenta medarbetare! Vår verksamhet genomsyras av våra värderingar – Öppen, Enkel och Omtänksam i allt vi gör.




Välkommen att kontakta oss om du vill veta mer.

Show more

  • Utforska nya tekniker och verktyg för att förbättra vår datainfrastruktur.


Din profil:

Vi ser gärna att du har ett par års erfaren av att liknande arbete som data engineer, och erfarenheter från bank- finans- betal- kredit branscherna är meriterande.


Tidigare erfarenhet från programmering och databaskunskaper i SQL är ett krav, och stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personliga egenskaper.


  • Relevant akademisk utbildning inom datavetenskap, statistik eller liknande.
  • Solid kunskap inom SQL, DBT, Git, Python och analysprodukter i Azure-plattformen (t.ex. Azure Databricks, Microsoft Fabric).
  • Erfarenhet av datamodellering, ETL-processer och datavarhusslösningar.
  • Erfarenhet av medaljarkitektur eller liknande.
  • God problemlösningsförmåga, noggrann och med förmåga att ta stort eget ansvar.
  • God kommunikationsförmåga i svenska och engelska, både skriftligt och muntligt.


Meriterande:

  • Erfarenhet av arbete inom finansbranschen.
  • Certifieringar inom Azure eller liknande.
  • God kunskap inom Power BI.


Vad kan vi erbjuda dig? Tillsammans med drivna och inspirerande kollegor får du vara en del av ett drivet team som bidrar till bolagets framgång. En härlig arbetsmiljö med kontor i centrala Stockholm såväl som Visby innerstad. Utöver det så erbjuder vi alla våra medarbetare ett attraktivt förmånspaket.


Vill du bli vår kollega? Skicka din ansökan redan idag!

Tjänsten är på heltid med start snarast möjligt eller eller enligt överenskommelse.


Placeringsort: Stockholm eller Visby


Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-05-03. Ansökningarna behandlas konfidentiellt. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum. Vid frågor gällande tjänsten kontakta Johan Råberg, Head of Credit Risk Analytics, johan.raberg@payex.com

Finansförbundet: Heidi Larsson +46 73 04 42 168

SACO: Sofia Enekvist +46 70 27 88 106


Vi värdesätter de kvaliteter som en mångfald av människor tillför i vår verksamhet. För att vara så fördomsfria som möjligt i vår rekrytering använder vi oss av anonymisering av CV:n. Vi ber dig även utesluta: namn, ålder, kön och bilder i ditt personliga brev.


Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess validerar vi identitet och genomför bakgrundskontroller för att säkerställa en trygg anställningsprocess.


Vi har redan valt våra rekryteringskanaler och undanber oss därför kontakt från externa rekryteringsfirmor och annonsförsäljare.


PayEx är en av Nordens främsta leverantörer av kompletta betallösningar och består av två affärsområden: PayEx Ledger and Financing och Swedbank Pay.


PayEx Ledger & Financing är namnet på vårt erbjudande för tjänster inom rating och billing, faktura- och reskontrahantering, inkasso, kredithantering och finansiering.


Swedbank Pay erbjuder produkter och tjänster som förenklar betalningar där försäljare och kunder möts – både i fysiska butiker och online.


Vi drivs av innovationskraft och vår strävan efter att hjälpa människor, företag och samhällen att växa. Idag är vi ett av de ledande företagen inom betallösningar med verksamhet i Sverige, Norge, Danmark och Finland. Något som inte hade varit möjligt utan våra engagerade och kompetenta medarbetare! Vår verksamhet genomsyras av våra värderingar – Öppen, Enkel och Omtänksam i allt vi gör.


Välkommen att kontakta oss om du vill veta mer.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Nielsen, we are passionate about our work to power a better media future for all people by providing powerful insights that drive client decisions and deliver extraordinary results. Our talented, global workforce is dedicated to capturing audience engagement with content - wherever and whenever it’s consumed. Together, we are proudly rooted in our deep legacy as we stand at the forefront of the media revolution. When you join Nielsen, you will join a dynamic team committed to excellence, perseverance, and the ambition to make an impact together. We champion you, because when you succeed, we do too. We enable your best to power our future.




About the position: (This is a Maternity Cover role - FTC 11 months )

Are you adept at problem-solving and able to provide a high level of service to colleagues and members? As a Panel Administrator you will be integral in fostering and maintaining high engagement and strong cooperation from Nielsen’s panel members in Denmark. 

The Data Analyst / Panel supporter maintains a close relationship with individual panel members as well as field technicians in order to ensure smooth and efficient data collection from the panel.







Responsibilities:
Provide clear and effective telephone and written support for both panel members and Nielsen field technicians
 Ensure that information in databases is accurate, valid and up to date
Ensure that data received from participating households adheres to quality control standards
Resolve problems by clarifying issues, researching and exploring answers and alternative solutions, implementing solutions, and escalating unresolved problems
Manage projects from start to finish (ideation/initiation to execution and evaluation), that can improve overall data quality and efficiency





Key Competencies:
University degree (preferably long-term higher education programme) within fields such as business administration, sociology, media studies
Able to speak Danish fluently.
Analytical skills and an ability to work with data in a structured manner
Able to drive continuous process improvements.A good understanding of media usage habits. 
Advanced knowledge of the ever-changing media landscape. 
Have a good sense for Tone of Voice when communicating with panel members
Able to speak and communicate in English


Nice to have :
General good IT skills (e.g. Google Sheets/Excel)
Adept at understanding and learning to use new IT systems and applications












Please be aware that job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by scammers seeking personal data or money. Nielsen recruiters will only contact you through official job boards, LinkedIn, or email with a nielsen.com domain. Be cautious of any outreach claiming to be from Nielsen via other messaging platforms or personal email addresses. Always verify that email communications come from an @nielsen.com address. If you're unsure about the authenticity of a job offer or communication, please contact Nielsen directly through our official website or verified social media channels.

Title: Senior Analytics Consultant
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com

Job Description

We are looking for a dynamic Senior Analytics Consultant to join our Northern Europe analytics team, specializing in credit risk management with a strong focus on client engagement and innovative solutions. The ideal candidate will have 4 to 8 years of experience in the banking and finance sector or management consulting, with a deep understanding of credit risk management and EU/local regulations such as IRB, IFRS 9, NPL management and ESG standards.

You will be responsible for building and maintaining client relationships, leading and managing analytics projects, and delivering analytics solutions to the benefit of our clients and their customers. Proficiency in Python, PySpark, and SQL is preferred, along with excellent communication skills and the ability to present complex information clearly. You will also play a key role in developing new scores and attributes, new analytics products and use cases of analytics platforms, staying updated on industry trends. If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive business decisions and have a keen interest in fintech development, we would love to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities


Build client relationships, and identify and drive client opportunities, being a trusted advisor for our clients.
Participate in pre-sales and sales meetings with clients and prospects to describe and position Experian's analytics projects, determine the client requirements across the full range of Experian Decision Analytics solutions ensuring the relationship with the client is productive and professional.
Engage in a consultative way with the clients to identify problems and define, design and deliver solutions and identify new opportunities. Create and present proposals and recommendations to clients for solutions.
Lead and manage project teams, ensure successful delivery of analytics projects, delivery of value-driven recommendations, knowledge transfer and effective advisory.
Lead innovation analytics driven projects, playing an active role in developing new analytics products and solutions for our clients.
Act as a Project Manager for projects involving statistical modelling, analytics platforms, sandbox use or regulatory analytics, assessing project scope, duration, resources and cost to define the project plan.
Review the project deliveries to ensure that all analysis is thorough and established, quality procedures are followed to help guarantee the robustness of the solution and that all critical business issues are identified through data analysis.
Stay on top of industry trends and engage and collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Sales, Pre-Sales, Product, Operations, Data and Platforms as well as international teams to ensure scaling Experian Analytics presence & capabilities across financial services.
Lead workshops and knowledge sharing sessions with our clients, joining Experian events as a speaker to provide expertise and insights to our clients.
Analyze and identify value creation and improvement opportunities at the intersection of business, data and technology.
Mentor and coach junior colleagues in the team.


Qualifications


Master’s degree in quantitative fields such as Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Business Science, Economics, Management or a related field.
4 to 8 years of proven experience in credit risk management within the banking and finance sector or in any management consulting or analytics and data driven industry.
Strong understanding of credit risk management and analytics areas. Knowhow with EU and local credit risk regulations, including IRB, IFRS 9, NPL Management and ESG standards.
Strong understanding of analytical products, data and analytics. Proficiency in Python, PySpark, SQL and Databricks knowledge is a plus and familiarity with advanced analytics techniques and tools such as machine learning and AI.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly to clients and bridge the gap between technical and non-technical teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, ability to analyze large datasets and develop predictive models, innovative thinking and the ability to translate data and analytics into business outcomes.
In-depth knowledge of market trends, financial products including strong market knowledge and experience in the Nordic financial sector.
Experience in managing projects and leading teams.
Fluency in Danish or Norwegian and English is a must.


What we offer?


Great compensation package and bonus plan.
Core benefits including health insurance, Experian shares discount, pension and wellbeing benefits.
Flexible work environment, hybrid work.
Flexible work hours including volunteer time off and 6 weeks holidays.


Additional Information

Proud to be a Worlds Best Workplace 2024

Our uniqueness is that we celebrate yours. Experian's culture and people are main differentiators. We take our people agenda very seriously and focus on what truly matters; DEI, work/life balance, development, authenticity, engagement, collaboration, wellness, reward & recognition, volunteering... the list goes on. Experian's people first approach is award-winning; Great Place To Work™ in 24 countries, FORTUNE Best Companies to work and Glassdoor Best Places to Work (globally 4.4 Stars) to name a few. Check out Experian Life on social or our Careers Site to understand why.

Experian is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Innovation is a critical part of Experian's DNA and practices, and our diverse workforce drives our success. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Aalborg Municipality, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Data Analyst – Drive Operational & Strategic Impact in the Global Music Industry

Location: Aalborg, Denmark (Hybrid possible)

Company: Music Manager




Do you dream of working with big data, music, and real-world impact—every day?

At Music Manager, we work with some of the most prominent investment firms and label groups in the world to help them unlock the full commercial potential of their music rights. Our data-driven platforms power strategic decisions behind thousands of top digital assets globally.




We're now looking for a Data Analyst to join us in Aalborg and take a central role in our operational and technological evolution.




What you’ll do:

As our in-house Data Scientist, you'll help us turn complexity into clarity—both for our internal teams and our clients. You will:

Support end-to-end execution of client projects by bringing structure, insights, and clarity to large, messy, and complex data sets.
Source, structure, and manage critical datasets, working with everything from consumption to rights metadata across platforms and stakeholders.
Analyze and produce metadata at scale, optimizing commercial output for high-value digital music catalogs.
Explore innovative ways to monetize and enhance data, tapping into collection societies, platforms, and other industry stakeholders across the value chain.
Co-develop internal systems and tools that directly contribute to our company’s intellectual property.
Work closely with our CTO (Lisbon) on the next generation of our platform—building new features and capabilities on a path from ML to AI.
Report directly to the Founder & CEO (Aalborg), and collaborate with finance (Aalborg), client services (Copenhagen), and tech (Lisbon).

What you bring:

A background in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or similar.
Strong Python + SQL skills. Familiarity with libraries like Pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn is a plus.
Experience working with large datasets and building custom data pipelines or models.
Bonus if you’ve worked with music, media, or rights/royalties data—but not required.
Curiosity and a systems mindset: you don’t just analyze—you improve, automate, and optimize.
You’re passionate about using data to fuel strategy, not just dashboards.

What we offer:

A rare chance to work at the intersection of music, finance, and data science.
Real ownership in developing systems and products used by the world’s leading music investors.
A close-knit, high-trust team with global collaboration (Aalborg, Copenhagen, Lisbon).
Hybrid work flexibility + a cozy HQ in central Aalborg.
Lots of autonomy. Even more impact.




Apply now, or reach out directly via LinkedIn—we’re hiring with heart, and we’d love to hear from you.




Company Description

Music Manager is a technology-driven company specializing in maximizing the commercial potential of music rights portfolios. Partnering with labels, investment firms, and rights holders worldwide, we deliver tailored solutions through music catalog auditing and portfolio management, using cutting-edge technologies for measurable results.

Advisory Segment

Role type

Part-time

Areas of Interest

Data & Analytics

Location(s)

Copenhagen - Hovedstaden - Denmark

Are you looking for a student job in data analytics and do you have an interest for the real estate market? Then this is a unique opportunity to combine your analytical skills with a substantive function in a commercial environment!

What will you be doing?

The real estate market is undergoing a significant and exciting change – driven by data and technology. The main focus of this position will be to support the team in leveraging our product portfolio and developing new data driven solutions to address new business challenges of our clients. The role will establish a profound relationship with the regional and EMEA research teams.

Your Key Responsibilities


Support the automation of manual tasks and reports by making intelligent use of available analytics and data visualization
Review and evaluate collected data and secure data quality, consistency, accuracy and comprehensiveness
Liaise with EMEA and Local CBRE research team to collaborate and implement new solutions
Contribute to the broader rollout of the Core Enablement Platform in collaboration with the Digital & Technology and Customer Success teams


Who are you?

We are looking for a committed, ambitious and independent student who has a great sense of responsibility for tasks and deadlines. You should be detail oriented with strong analytical skills and have a positive, innovative and opportunistic mindset. You must thrive in an international environment and an informal tone, where it is crucial that you speak and write English at a high level.

Preferably you are studying a bachelor’s degree in economics, finance, data analytics, business intelligence or related disciplines.

Qualifications

Other qualifications we are looking for (you do not have to tick all the boxes to be the right match for the position):


You have experience in an analytically oriented, data, or quantitative role
You have programming experience in Python or R and respective data analysis libraries
You have basic knowledge of some of the following technologies: Alteryx, SQL and relational database concepts, and an intrinsic motivation to develop these skills
You have basic knowledge of reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI and enjoy converting data into valuable insights
You have strong numerical skills including the ability to handle and manipulate large amounts of numerical data into clearly defined outputs based on a project driven approach.
You'll take ownership of data quality, including performing manual data entry tasks as needed to ensure our end users have reliable information. You recognize that consistent data maintenance is key to driving successful data analysis
You have an excellent understanding of the English language but can also communicate in Danish


About Us

CBRE is the world’s largest commercial real estate services with more than 100,000 employees worldwide. We are present in more than 100+ countries in more than 500 offices and work with every corner of the real estate market. CBRE's international angle, specialization and more than 100 years of experience guarantee a market insight with the highest standards.

We have a flexible working environment with excellent development opportunities in a dynamic and diverse organization.

What Can We Offer


A team consisting of both young ambitious and experienced employees
Assignments with great variety and a steep learning curve with challenges and growing responsibilities
Flexible working hours 15-25 hours per week
A good work and student environment
Attractive employee benefits


Next Step

We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis and please note that virtual interviews are part of this recruiting process. We are looking forward to hearing from you.

If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Senior Analyst, D&T Lead, Htet Aung, on email: htet.aung@cbre.com.

Title: Data Analyst (Marketing Insights)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 116 million registered users and 243,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 431+million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.165.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

We are seeking a talented and driven Data Analyst or Senior Data Analyst to join us in shaping the future of our newly established Demand Analytics team. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in enhancing our team's capabilities around Marketing analytics while benefiting from a robust support structure designed to foster growth and innovation.

As a Marketplace, Marketing is one of Too Good To Go’s most powerful levers for driving demand. Consequently, a strong foundation in marketing metrics is essential for this role. The models and methodologies you will help develop are largely marketing-focused, emphasizing the importance of experience with causal impact modeling and econometric modeling.

That said, Demand Analytics at Too Good To Go extends beyond Marketing. We are looking for someone who can also contribute to broader analytical initiatives, such as demand forecasting and other data-driven projects.

If you’re passionate about leveraging analytics to make a real-world impact and thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment, we’d love to hear from you.

This role can be baised either in Copenhagen or London (Shoreditch).

Your role


Support business leaders in identifying the right KPIs to drive business performance
Provide data-driven guidance to business leaders on key strategic decisions
Design and deliver self-service tools to various functional groups for operational excellence
Collaborate with marketing teams to optimize campaign strategies and resource allocation based on data-driven insights
Conduct in-depth analyses to identify the drivers of demand and measure marketing impact
Utilize marketing insights to inform and enhance demand forecasting models


Requirements


You have an understanding of Marketing Data and KPIs, or a strong appetite to learn this space.
Having experience in analyzing and interpreting marketing performance metrics would be a clear advantage.
You are a great communicator and storyteller - someone who enjoys helping non-technical audiences see what you see in the numbers!
You have hands-on experience working closely with senior stakeholders, ideally within Marketing, to deliver data-driven insights.
You are skilled in designing, executing, and interpreting A/B tests, as well as applying causal inference and impact modeling techniques.
You have econometric modeling experience; familiarity with marketing mix models (MMM) is a plus.
You are proficient in SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and transformation
You have Python expertise for data pre-processing, or statistical analysis. R would also be considered.
You are passionate about data literacy, continuously striving to improve your own skills and those of your team.


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above.
Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Please submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

  • Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.

Title: Consultant - McKinsey Digital
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you’ll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have


Continuous learning Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package, which includes medical, dental, mental health, and vision coverage for you, your spouse/partner, and children.


Your Impact

As a junior associate, you will join a client service team and take ownership of a workstream to solve some of the toughest challenges our clients face. And these aren’t just any clients—they're some of the most influential organizations around, from Fortune 500 giants to innovative startups. We will expect you to go the extra mile, delivering solutions that solve immediate problems and drive long-term change. And we’ll rely on your judgment and integrity to ensure our recommendations are effective and long-lasting.

You will take on a role that goes beyond advising. You’ll be at the heart of the action—helping to uncover the true challenges behind a client’s strategy and creating actionable plans that drive real change. Working alongside clients and other McKinsey colleagues, you’ll combine research, analyzing data, interviews, and brainstorming to generate fresh insights and breakthrough solutions. Your commitment to our values will be crucial in earning our clients' trust and delivering results that matter.

As you collaborate directly with clients, you’ll help them solve problems, refine strategies, and implement transformations. By equipping them with the tools and knowledge to continue innovating and improving after we’ve left, you’ll ensure the impact of our work endures. In doing so, you’ll uphold McKinsey’s commitment to making a meaningful difference in the industries and communities we serve.

Read more about McKinsey Digital here.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Degree in a technical subject such as computer science, engineering, IT, hard sciences or mathematics; advanced degree is a plus
Excellent organization capabilities, including the ability to initiate tasks independently and see them through to completion.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, in English and local office language(s), with the ability to adjust your style to suit different perspectives and seniority levels.
Proficient in rational decision making based on data, facts, and logical reasoning.
Ability to create work product-focused materials / outputs, which may include PowerPoint decks, Excel models, articles, or other written deliverables.
Exceptional time management to meet your responsibilities in a complex and largely autonomous work environment.
Ability to work or attend meetings outside of traditional business hours or take on projects with limited or no notice at times.
Ability to travel to and work in varying environments that may be challenging and/or not accessible (e.g., factories, hospitals, mines).
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a Data Analyst that want to play a key role in shaping data-driven insights and deliver functional Power BI solutions? Do you want to support one of Europe’s largest residential portfolios, providing essential data insights to business users? Then this role with us, may be your next step!







The Team

Join the AnalytiX team as our Data Analyst and contribute to our mission of delivering innovative Power BI solutions and automating manual data processes. You’ll be part of a cross-functional team consisting of data engineers, data analysts. You’ll have opportunities to collaborate across Data & AnalytiX function, where our shared passion for data drives us toward common goals of quality and ensuring satisfaction with our products.

This full-time position is based in either our Copenhagen group office.







Key Responsibilities:

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role on delivering visually appealing, functional, and high-quality Power BI reports and ensuring adoption by connecting with end-users of the solutions.




your core responsibilities encompass:

Develop, maintain and fine-tune Power BI reports to meet business needs
Provide proactive maintenance of current solutions while optimizing them for better performance
Document solution designs and workflow in Miro for clear communication and alignment
Take part in developing data models that enable self-service BI
Facilitate discussions and meetings with product owners to understand business needs and align solutions accordingly
Ensure the smooth transition of existing solutions to a more scalable and future-proof setup
Contribute to the technical debt management of the Power BI platform and ensure best practices







To fit this role, we look for you who has:

Minimum Bachelor’s degree in relevant fields
Strong passion for statistics and data analysis, and experience with large datasets and dimensional modelling.
Knowledge of ETL tools and data processing techniques.
Experience with data warehousing, data modeling and DAX programming.
Ability to work within an agile setup and prioritize tasks efficiently.
Confidence in engaging with stakeholders across various functions and asking insightful questions.
Fluent in English; Strong verbal/written communication and presentation skills.




You have a systematic, analytical mindset. As a person you are naturally curious about new methods and technologies, enabling effective interaction with both technical and business teams (with the ability to translate tech lingo to something non-tech people can understand). You immediately take our values, Care, Dare, Share to your heart and enjoy working in an informal atmosphere where flexibility and responsibility goes hand in hand.










Join Us

Joining Heimstaden means being part of a team that dreams big, works passionately, and continuously strives for improvement.




We celebrate talent in all its forms and encourage you to apply, even if you don’t meet every qualification listed. Let’s explore together how your unique strengths can contribute to our shared goals.

Apply today to connect with the People & Culture team to further explore this opportunity!







We will initiate conversations with selected candidates prior to the application deadline.

We conduct background checks as part of our recruitment process. If you have any questions regarding this, you are welcome to contact us.




We know the value of challenging unconscious bias and the importance of focusing on the full potential and competences of each individual. That is why we do not require a cover letter when applying to our positions, and we use testing as a tool in the process.

For questions, please contact Franco Hurtado at franco.hurtado@heimstaden.com

Show more

Support the automation of manual tasks and reports by making intelligent use of available analytics and data visualization
Review and evaluate collected data and secure data quality, consistency, accuracy and comprehensiveness
Liaise with EMEA and Local CBRE research team to collaborate and implement new solutions
Contribute to the broader rollout of the Core Enablement Platform in collaboration with the Digital & Technology and Customer Success teams


Who are you?


We are looking for a committed, ambitious and independent student who has a great sense of responsibility for tasks and deadlines. You should be detail oriented with strong analytical skills and have a positive, innovative and opportunistic mindset. You must thrive in an international environment and an informal tone, where it is crucial that you speak and write English at a high level.

Preferably you are studying a bachelor’s degree in economics, finance, data analytics, business intelligence or related disciplines.

Qualifications


Other qualifications we are looking for (you do not have to tick all the boxes to be the right match for the position):


You have experience in an analytically oriented, data, or quantitative role
You have programming experience in Python or R and respective data analysis libraries
You have basic knowledge of some of the following technologies: Alteryx, SQL and relational database concepts, and an intrinsic motivation to develop these skills
You have basic knowledge of reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI and enjoy converting data into valuable insights
You have strong numerical skills including the ability to handle and manipulate large amounts of numerical data into clearly defined outputs based on a project driven approach.
You'll take ownership of data quality, including performing manual data entry tasks as needed to ensure our end users have reliable information. You recognize that consistent data maintenance is key to driving successful data analysis
You have an excellent understanding of the English language but can also communicate in Danish


About Us


CBRE is the world’s largest commercial real estate services with more than 100,000 employees worldwide. We are present in more than 100+ countries in more than 500 offices and work with every corner of the real estate market. CBRE's international angle, specialization and more than 100 years of experience guarantee a market insight with the highest standards.

We have a flexible working environment with excellent development opportunities in a dynamic and diverse organization.

What Can We Offer



A team consisting of both young ambitious and experienced employees
Assignments with great variety and a steep learning curve with challenges and growing responsibilities
Flexible working hours 15-25 hours per week
A good work and student environment
Attractive employee benefits


Next Step


We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis and please note that virtual interviews are part of this recruiting process. We are looking forward to hearing from you.

If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Senior Analyst, D&T Lead, Htet Aung, on email: htet.aung@cbre.com.

Service line: Advisory Segment

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you thrive at the intersection of data and strategy? Are you excited about turning complex analytics into impactful marketing insights? Then you might be our new Marketing Data Analyst, ready to join our dynamic and international marketing team!

First, who on earth is Dalux?

Dalux is an innovative Contech company committed to push the boundaries of how technology can secure a smarter and more efficient construction and real estate industry. Today we provide our user-friendly digital tools and BIM Technology (3D information models) to leading contractors and advisors in more than 147 countries. And we are not slowing down our expansion journey anytime soon, so this is a great time to join us and directly influence the future of Dalux! Today we are present in 24 countries and counting, and therefore this is a great time to join us, and directly influence the future of Dalux!

Awesome! But what will my new role be?

In this role, you’ll work at the intersection of data and marketing, analyzing and interpreting data from a wide variety of marketing channels such as ads, social media, website performance, webinars, events, and more. Your insights will drive decision-making, shape marketing strategies, and optimize performance across the organization.

Your responsibilities will include:


Collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data from various marketing sources (e.g., Google Analytics, Google Ads, social platforms, events, webinars).
Developing and maintaining dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, SQL, and Access.
Providing actionable insights to optimize campaign performance and achieve marketing goals.
Collaborating with Performance Marketing and other teams (Content, Events, Commercial Revenue Operations) to align on data-driven strategies.
Monitoring and reporting on KPIs, campaign ROI, and trends to guide both short-term and long-term planning.
Identifying areas of opportunity and proposing data-informed strategies for growth and efficiency.


Sure, sounds exciting! How can I be considered for this role?

You have experience in marketing data analysis or a related field, with proficiency in Power BI, SQL, and Microsoft Access. Strong knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Ads dashboards, as well as analytical and problem-solving skills, are essential. Experience visualizing data for non-technical stakeholders and strong collaboration skills are also key.

Preferred qualifications include experience in performance marketing or commercial revenue operations, familiarity with A/B testing, and additional data visualization tools.

If you’re collaborative, curious, and eager to learn, you’ll thrive in our supportive and creative environment.

Why Choose Dalux?

At Dalux, we care—not just about our work and customers but about each other. We believe in creating a work environment that is light-hearted, informal, and welcoming, with room for everyone. Forget fancy titles and rigid dress codes; we’re here to make your work life both rewarding and enjoyable.

At our HQ in Østerbro, you’ll join a team of 17 skilled colleagues dedicated to driving high customer engagement. Networking with our users is our passion, and we deliver great content, engaging events, and cutting-edge ConTech insights.

Being part of a social company, you’ll also enjoy activities like wine tasting, running club, knitting club, and more. At Dalux, your personal and professional growth is important to us.

Application deadline:

As soon as possible
Show more
