Title: Data Engineer (Copenhagen)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We're looking for a Data Engineer for our Copenhagen office

Hi there! Are you our new colleague at Dreaminfluence?

We’re looking for a skilled Data Engineer to join our R&D team and help shape the data infrastructure that powers data-driven decision-making across Dreaminfluence. In this role, you’ll play a key part in building and maintaining robust data pipelines, ensuring data quality, and scaling our internal data architecture to support the company’s continued growth and operational excellence.

You're a great match for Dreaminfluence if you're


Team-oriented – You believe the best work comes from collaboration, shared responsibility, and open communication.
Honest – You value transparency, give and receive constructive feedback openly, and speak your mind—even when it’s not the easy route.
Goal-driven – You work effectively in short delivery cycles, and you stay focused on both short-term deliverables and long-term outcomes.
Analytical – Data isn’t just your job—it’s your mindset. You make decisions based on insights, not assumptions.
You have strong business acumen – You understand how businesses work and align your decisions with broader company goals, considering impact on revenue, customer value, growth, and efficiency.
You thrive on taking full ownership of your work, feel empowered to make decisions, and proactively drive initiatives forward with independence and confidence
You care about building clean, scalable systems that make working with data easier for the whole company.
You love to get feedback and improve your craft, and you're not afraid to provide feedback to your colleagues so they can improve.


We’re a great fit for you if


You want to be part of a fast-moving SaaS start-up.
You thrive in a culture of ownership and flexibility.
You want to work onsite in our Copenhagen office alongside a talented, cross-functional R&D team.


About The Job

As a Data Engineer at Dreaminfluence, you’ll play a central role in shaping and scaling the data infrastructure that powers decision-making across the business. You’ll join our R&D team and work closely with stakeholders from multiple departments, including product, finance, marketing, and executive leadership, to ensure our data is clean, accessible, and actionable.

We already have a strong foundation in place, but we’re growing fast, and so are our data needs. That’s where you come in.

Your Primary Responsibilities Will Include


Designing and developing robust data pipelines to collect, clean, and transform raw data from multiple sources into high-quality datasets used across the company.
Building scalable ETL/ELT processes to support both real-time and batch data workflows, ensuring consistent data flow from ingestion to reporting.
Enhancing data discoverability and access by designing intuitive, well-documented data models that business users and analysts can trust and explore.
Improving the performance and scalability of our existing data infrastructure by optimizing queries, storage, and pipeline execution for large and growing datasets.
Driving best practices in data governance and quality, including monitoring, validation, and alerting for data anomalies or inconsistencies.


The perfect candidate also brings some of the following (nice to have, but not required):


Experience with statistics and/or machine learning
Familiarity with SaaS business KPIs
Prior experience with the HubSpot and Chargebee APIs


You’ll have the opportunity to significantly impact the way Dreaminfluence uses data, shaping internal reporting and enhancing product features.

Our Current Data Stack Includes


A Databricks-based data lake built on top of AWS
Python (Pandas, numpy, PySpark) for data processing, transformation, and scripting
SQL for data modeling and exploration


Hiring Process


Intro chat with our CTO, Morten Frank
In-depth personal interview
Personality test + walkthrough
Technical case + interview with our Data Scientist


What You Get


Full-time health-care insurance
5 weeks vacation + 5 additional holidays
Flexible company pension scheme
MacBook Pro (personal use allowed)
Daily free lunch at the office
A central role in a growing product-focused company


Excited? We’d love to hear from you. Join us in building the data backbone of modern influencer marketing.
Show more
HTML:
We're looking for a Data Engineer for our Copenhagen office

Hi there! Are you our new colleague at Dreaminfluence?

We’re looking for a skilled Data Engineer to join our R&D team and help shape the data infrastructure that powers data-driven decision-making across Dreaminfluence. In this role, you’ll play a key part in building and maintaining robust data pipelines, ensuring data quality, and scaling our internal data architecture to support the company’s continued growth and operational excellence.

You're a great match for Dreaminfluence if you're

  • Team-oriented – You believe the best work comes from collaboration, shared responsibility, and open communication.
  • Honest – You value transparency, give and receive constructive feedback openly, and speak your mind—even when it’s not the easy route.
  • Goal-driven – You work effectively in short delivery cycles, and you stay focused on both short-term deliverables and long-term outcomes.
  • Analytical – Data isn’t just your job—it’s your mindset. You make decisions based on insights, not assumptions.
  • You have strong business acumen – You understand how businesses work and align your decisions with broader company goals, considering impact on revenue, customer value, growth, and efficiency.
  • You thrive on taking full ownership of your work, feel empowered to make decisions, and proactively drive initiatives forward with independence and confidence
  • You care about building clean, scalable systems that make working with data easier for the whole company.
  • You love to get feedback and improve your craft, and you're not afraid to provide feedback to your colleagues so they can improve.

We’re a great fit for you if

  • You want to be part of a fast-moving SaaS start-up.
  • You thrive in a culture of ownership and flexibility.
  • You want to work onsite in our Copenhagen office alongside a talented, cross-functional R&D team.

About The Job

As a Data Engineer at Dreaminfluence, you’ll play a central role in shaping and scaling the data infrastructure that powers decision-making across the business. You’ll join our R&D team and work closely with stakeholders from multiple departments, including product, finance, marketing, and executive leadership, to ensure our data is clean, accessible, and actionable.

We already have a strong foundation in place, but we’re growing fast, and so are our data needs. That’s where you come in.

Your Primary Responsibilities Will Include

  • Designing and developing robust data pipelines to collect, clean, and transform raw data from multiple sources into high-quality datasets used across the company.
  • Building scalable ETL/ELT processes to support both real-time and batch data workflows, ensuring consistent data flow from ingestion to reporting.
  • Enhancing data discoverability and access by designing intuitive, well-documented data models that business users and analysts can trust and explore.
  • Improving the performance and scalability of our existing data infrastructure by optimizing queries, storage, and pipeline execution for large and growing datasets.
  • Driving best practices in data governance and quality, including monitoring, validation, and alerting for data anomalies or inconsistencies.

The perfect candidate also brings some of the following (nice to have, but not required):

  • Experience with statistics and/or machine learning
  • Familiarity with SaaS business KPIs
  • Prior experience with the HubSpot and Chargebee APIs

You’ll have the opportunity to significantly impact the way Dreaminfluence uses data, shaping internal reporting and enhancing product features.

Our Current Data Stack Includes

  • A Databricks-based data lake built on top of AWS
  • Python (Pandas, numpy, PySpark) for data processing, transformation, and scripting
  • SQL for data modeling and exploration

Hiring Process

  • Intro chat with our CTO, Morten Frank
  • In-depth personal interview
  • Personality test + walkthrough
  • Technical case + interview with our Data Scientist

What You Get

  • Full-time health-care insurance
  • 5 weeks vacation + 5 additional holidays
  • Flexible company pension scheme
  • MacBook Pro (personal use allowed)
  • Daily free lunch at the office
  • A central role in a growing product-focused company

Excited? We’d love to hear from you. Join us in building the data backbone of modern influencer marketing.

Title: Data Analyst til Claims Analytics - barselsvikariat
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Gjensidige er et nordisk skadeforsikringsselskab, som er noteret på Oslo Børs. Vi har ca. 4.500 medarbejdere, heraf 1.100 i Danmark, og vi tilbyder skadeforsikring i Norge, Danmark og Sverige. I Norge tilbyder vi også pension og opsparing. Driftsindtægterne var 36 mia. NOK i 2023, mens forvaltningskapitalen udgjorde 148 mia. NOK.

Brænder du for analyse og data? Vil du bidrage til at gøre Gjensidige endnu mere indsigtsdrevet? Nu har du muligheden!

Gode grunde til at arbejde i Gjensidige

I Gjensidige har vi arbejdet for at sikre liv, sundhed og værdier i over 200 år. Vi har som ambition at være Nordens mest kundeorienterede skadeforsikringsselskab, og koncernens strategi er at være indsigt- og analysebaseret. Vi søger nu efter en engageret og dygtig Data Analytiker til et vikariat.

Division Skade skal levere markedets bedste kundeoplevelser, når skaden er sket. Vi har satset stort på ny teknologi og automatisering de sidste år, og har ambitiøse mål for fortsat effektivisering og teknologiudvikling. Teamet i Claims Analytics er helt centralt i dette arbejde. Afdelingen består af 7 dygtige medarbejdere, 4 i Norge og 3 i Danmark. Den ene data scientist i Danmark skal på barselsorlov i september 2025 og vi søger derfor en vikar for hende i denne periode. Vi arbejder sammen på tværs for at gøre Skade endnu mere analyse- og indsigtsdrevet, og udnytte nye muligheder. I rollen som Data Analyst kan du gøre en forskel i dette arbejde. Hos os vil du arbejde med spændende og udfordrende opgaver.

Din hverdag som Data Analyst i Claims Analytics vil blandt andet bestå af:


Bidrage til at opnå koncernens ambitiøse mål for at reducere erstatningsomkostninger, bæredygtige og effektive skadeprocesser samt markedets bedste kundeoplevelser drevet af AI, data og analytics
Udvikle gode styreværktøjer for skadeorganisationen
Overvåge, analysere og formidle indsigt knyttet til drift, erstatningsomkostninger og udvikling
Rapportering og prognoser



Vi forestiller os, at du har:


En relevant videregående uddannelse på kandidatniveau inden for f.eks. statistik, matematik, økonomi, IT eller lignende
Kendskab og erfaring med programmering og analyseværktøjer (for eksempel SAS/ SQL/ Python/ Power BI/ dbt /Databricks)
Det er en fordel hvis du har kendskab til forsikring, men det er ikke et krav
Omgængelig, trives med at formidle indsigt og kommunikerer godt på et skandinavisk sprog og engelsk (mundtligt og skriftligt)
Forretningsorienteret og relationsskabende både indenfor og udenfor teamet
Nysgerrig og kan lide at udforske potentialet i komplekse og store mængder data fra flere forskellige kilder
Gåpåmod og er vedholdende
Tager initiativ, kan lide et højt tempo, er selvmotiverende og samtidig en holdspiller



Hvad kan vi tilbyde

Du kommer til at arbejde tæt sammen med en samling af drevne, fagligt dygtige og søde kollegaer i både Danmark og Norge.

Gjensidige er et af Nordens største forsikringsselskaber, så der er mange muligheder for både faglig og personlig udvikling – på tværs af fag og landegrænser.

Du får gode vilkår herunder fordelagtige forsikringer og pensionsordning og - hvis vi selv skal sige det - et hav af gode kollegaer. Derudover får du en arbejdsplads placeret i København SV, i moderne omgivelser med nem adgang til offentlig transport og gode parkeringsmuligheder.

Du vil blive omfattet af forsikringsoverenskomsten.

Barselsvikariatet er på 9 måneder og med ønsket opstart d. 1. august 2025.

Er du interesseret?

Så send os din ansøgning og CV snarest muligt, da vi indkalder til samtaler løbende.

Vi opfordrer alle kandidater, uanset køn, alder, etnicitet, seksualitet og handicap til at søge stillinger i Gjensidige, da vi er en virksomhed, der ønsker at afspejle det mangfoldige samfund vi er en del af.

Ansættelsesleder Kontakter: Ariane,

(+47)97193475, ariane.grumstad@gjensidige.no

Ansøgningsfrist: 29/05/2025
Show more

  • Gåpåmod og er vedholdende

Title: Impact Analyzer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".

We are now looking for an Impact Analyser to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Analytics & Innovation Director.

How you can contribute and have an impact?


Follow and measure the impact of the incubators work and ensure the sustainability aspect within the projects and activities and to record/share learnings.
Impact Measurement: Develop and implement metrics and methodologies to measure the impact of incubator projects and activities.
Sustainability Assurance: Ensure that all projects and activities within the incubator are designed and executed with sustainability in mind.
Data Collection and Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret data to assess the effectiveness and sustainability of incubator initiatives.
Reporting: Prepare detailed reports on the impact and sustainability of projects, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
Knowledge Sharing: Record and share learnings from incubator projects with internal teams and external stakeholders to promote best practices and continuous improvement.
Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with project teams, mentors, and external partners to gather feedback and ensure alignment with sustainability goals.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for enhancing the impact and sustainability of incubator activities and implement necessary changes.


What we look for:


Proven experience in impact measurement, sustainability management, or a related role.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Sustainability, Innovation Management, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage.
Business viability mindset.
New business model experience
Customer journey understanding.
Lifecycle management.
New business model design, Pricing, Market sizing.
Workshop animation.
Strong analytical, project management, and communication skills.
Ability to work with diverse stakeholders and drive continuous improvement.
Detail-oriented, proactive, and passionate about sustainability and innovation.


Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Amsterdam Netherlands


Show more

Title: Analytics Senior Team Lead
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for an Analytics Senior Team Lead for our Analytics team

We are looking for an experienced and hands-on Analytics Senior Team Lead to lead our global, dynamic team of data analysts based out of Denmark, United States and Serbia. In this role, you will lead the improvements of our analytics and reporting processes, helping the business make better, data-informed decisions. You’ll be working closely with our Data Platform team to improve data literacy among both Business Owners and support functions globally.




Your key responsibilities

Lead and mentor a global team of talented data analysts. Foster a collaborative and innovative team environment focused on continuous improvement.
Develop and execute an analytics strategy aimed at enhancing analytics capabilities and data literacy both among stakeholders and internally in the team.
Work closely with Finance Business Partners to produce reporting that supports group-level and leadership decision-making..
Perform analytics and deep dives across various business areas and domains.
Maintain high standards for data accuracy and consistency across departments.
Provide hands-on support to local analysts when more advanced analysis is needed.
Collaborate with colleagues in the data platform team to ensure alignment and integration of analytics efforts across the organization.
Help raise the overall level of data literacy in the company by mentoring and advising analysts in different teams.
Define meaningful KPIs for the analytics team and ensure they’re effectively tracked and acted upon.




What you need to be successful

Extensive experience (5+ years) in a senior analytics role, with at least 2 years in a leadership position.
Strong proficiency in analytics tools and platforms (e.g., SQL, and data visualization or BI tools).
Great problem-solving skills and the ability to translate complex data into simple insights.
Understanding of data modeling concepts.
Strong communication skills with experience in presenting to senior leadership.
A proactive, strategic thinker with a passion for data-driven decision-making.




Your colleagues say you

Work in English with ease (it’s our company language)
Bring a solution-centric mindset
Are a continuous learning and systematic thinker
Are a person that they enjoy having a coffee with (virtual or not)




What we offer

Join an innovative international company in growth and be part of a strong team where you can create value and make a real business impact. We are on a journey to become the leading digital sports media group, relying on the innovations of forward-thinking individuals. Better Collective provides a unique opportunity in a dynamic, creative, and fun environment with a flat organisational structure. Enjoy freedom with responsibility, ample room to grow, and the chance to manage various responsibilities.




Benefit from flexible working hours supporting a healthy work-life balance, private health insurance, and great office perks such as lunch, snacks, gym access, and social events—experience a varied everyday life in a fast-paced international business with a professional yet casual working climate alongside skilled, passionate, and fun colleagues.




Your path to Better Collective

We process applications continuously, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. For more information about the job, contact Anders Bjerregaard Nielsen, Director of Group Data & Analytics, at anielsen@bettercollective.com. We look forward to receiving your application, with a starting date as soon as possible.




Why join Better Collective?

At Better Collective, we pride ourselves on fostering a workplace where talent thrives and collaboration flourishes. We are committed to nurturing a learning environment where your growth is a priority. Imagine working alongside a dream team of talented individuals who not only bring their skills to the table but also complement each other. You’ll have ample opportunities to learn on the job from talented colleagues eager to share their knowledge, taking on responsibilities that challenge and inspire you.

Guided by our core values of respect, integrity, ambition, and collaboration, we strive to maintain an inclusive and safe space for all employees. Our culture is built on support and camaraderie. Here, you’ll find caring colleagues who unite over shared passions and ambitions, creating a supportive environment where everyone can succeed together. We believe in having fun while achieving great things, ensuring that work is both enjoyable and rewarding.




About Better Collective

We are a global sports media group headquartered in Copenhagen, thriving in a vibrant international environment with more than 1,600 talented professionals working in offices across four continents and representing over 30 nationalities. Our dedicated employees drive our ambition to conquer the sports media world and become the leading digital sports media group. We are home to renowned international and national sports media brands such as HLTV, Futbin, Action Network, VegasInsider, Bolavip, SvenskaFans, Tipsbladet, Betarades, and more. Our mission is to excite sports fans through engaging content and foster passionate communities worldwide.

For those who love sports, Better Collective offers the opportunity to work on something you are passionate about, making work both purposeful and enjoyable. Even for those not into sports, the strong sense of sportsmanship woven into our organization and core values creates a collaborative and fun environment.

Better Collective is dual-listed on Nasdaq Stockholm (BETCO) and Nasdaq Copenhagen (BETCO DKK).




We are an equal opportunity employer

We strongly believe diversity gives us the edge and we are committed to creating a safe working environment where employees can thrive. By embracing our diverse perspectives and experiences, our teams collaborate to innovate and deliver superior sports content and products. We hire for cultural growth and welcome everyone, regardless of background, ethnicity, age, religious and political beliefs, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, and other characteristics.

Title: Data Engineering Student Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Drive Meaningful Change

Are you ready to support a dynamic Data Engineering team and grow your skills in building scalable data solutions? Join our team at Abacus Medicine Group, where you’ll play an integral role in developing and maintaining data pipelines while contributing to impactful projects. You will be part of a fast-paced, collaborative environment, gaining hands-on experience and enhancing your technical capabilities.

Get a Glimpse of Our World

The Data Engineering team is a growing team of skilled professionals responsible for building and maintaining the backbone of our company’s data ecosystem. We work closely with various departments and stakeholders, ensuring that data infrastructure and workflows run smoothly and efficiently. We value curiosity, innovation, and collaboration, making this an exciting place to grow both professionally and personally.

As a Data Engineering Student Analyst, you will work alongside experienced Data Engineers, supporting various teams while contributing to the development and optimization of our data infrastructure. If you’re looking for a fast-moving and dynamic team where you can apply your skills and learn new technologies, this is the right place for you.

Realize Your Opportunities as Data Engineering Student Analyst

The Data Engineering Student Analyst will support the Data Engineering team in developing, maintaining, and optimizing data pipelines and infrastructure. You will work on data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes, monitor and troubleshoot workflows, and collaborate with different teams to improve our data systems.

Your Main Responsibilities Include


Developing and maintaining data pipelines that extract, transform, and load data from various sources.
Monitoring and troubleshooting data workflows, identifying and resolving issues proactively.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and design scalable data solutions.
Optimizing data storage and retrieval processes to enhance system performance.
Staying up to date with emerging data engineering trends and contributing to continuous improvements.


Fuel for Your Success in the Role

We are looking for someone who is proactive, curious, and eager to learn, with a strong interest in data engineering. You should be comfortable working independently while also contributing to a collaborative team.

Furthermore, We Hope The Following Points Describe You


You have 2 to 3 years left of your education in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
You have proficiency in Python and an understanding of SQL.
You can work independently while also being a strong team player.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud) is an advantage, but not required.
Prior knowledge of the Azure data stack (Data Factory, Databricks, Data/Delta Lake) is a strong advantage but not required.
You have strong communication skills in English and a proactive mindset.


Would you like to know more about us?

If you want to apply for the position, please follow the link and attach your CV and cover letter.

Interested?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn and get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For job openings, check our Career page.

Moving Healthcare. Moving You.

In Abacus Medicine Group, you’ll experience the power of Moving Healthcare. With our change mindset, we're moving the industry and improving healthcare as we broaden access to medicine.

But it's not just about moving healthcare, it's about Moving You. You’ll be part of a caring community of more than 1,500 people across the World. With us, you will be valued, empowered, and have a direct impact on driving change. Let's access the future of medicine and make a difference together. Your move.

Title: Lead Business Intelligence Specialist, Data & Analytics
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
CIP Fund Solutions - a platform delivery company working exclusively for the global fund management company Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP), is currently looking for a Lead Business Intelligence (BI) Specialist to join our office in Copenhagen, Denmark.

CIP Fund Solutions provides scalable and integrated business services, complex fund management and investments solutions with the aim of advancing CIP’s investment products and channels – and supporting the continuous value creation across the CIP platform.

The role
As our new Lead BI Specialist in our Data & Analytics team, you’ll join a team of ambitious professionals. The Data & Analytics team is responsible for delivering scalable digital solutions and advisory to the business with the intention of enabling growth across the CIP platforms. The team is comprised of a set of specialists focusing on master data management, data engineering, and business intelligence.

You will be the technical lead on Power BI, in a growing BI team. In this role, you will ensure the team adheres to best practices and delivers high-quality BI solutions.

You will be responsible for the Power BI platform, ensuring that usage of the platform follows best practices as a subject matter expert. You will manage larger BI projects, develop new dashboards, as well as maintain existing dashboards as needed. Additionally, you will work closely with other departments to ensure BI solutions align with business goals and effectively communicate insights to stakeholders.

You will also be expected to stay updated with the latest features of Power BI and Microsoft Fabric, continuously improving the BI solutions to meet the evolving needs of the business.

Responsibilities will further consist of:

Creation of new and maintenance of existing BI solutions such as dashboards and semantic data models
Refinement and estimation of new BI projects and solutions in collaboration with stakeholders
Management of consultants for externally staffed BI projects, ensuring alignment with internal standards and practices
Ensuring that the future BI setup is maintainable and scalable by implementing best practices in data architecture and governance
Staying updated on new features being released for Fabric and Power BI, and evaluating their potential impact on current and future projects
Design and implement self-service guidelines and governance with the aim of enabling citizen developers
Training and supervision of business units who wish to develop BI solutions together with the D&A team, providing guidance and support to ensure adherence to best practices
Maintain high visual standards and ensure uniformity across new BI products, contributing to a cohesive user experience
Design and implement efficient reporting solutions that enhance data accessibility and usability for informed decision-making


You
We are looking for candidates who have completed their master’s degree and have several years of full-time experience in a similar position, using Power BI and preferably Microsoft Fabric.

We expect you to possess a curious and outgoing mindset that allows you to educate yourself about the business and thoroughly understand its needs. This will enable you to develop appropriate and effective solutions tailored to those needs. With a solid understanding of data structures and modeling, you can design and implement efficient reporting solutions that enhance data accessibility and usability for informed decision-making.

We look for the following in a candidate

Self-igniting and customer-centric: You have a proactive attitude and a keen focus on understanding and meeting customer needs.
Close attention to detail and a high level of accuracy: You are meticulous and ensure precision in your work.
Comprehensive analytical and problem-solving skills: You possess strong analytical abilities and can effectively troubleshoot and solve complex problems.
Fluency in English, both verbal and written, as well as excellent communication skills: You can communicate clearly and effectively with various stakeholders.
Willingness to work in an international, efficient, and highly varied environment: You thrive in a dynamic and diverse setting, collaborating with teams across different regions.


The process
Please apply online as soon as possible as applications will be processed on an ongoing basis. For questions related to the role, please reach out to our Talent Acquisition team at talent@cisc.dk. We do not include CV's and Cover Letters sent by email.

As we continue to improve our candidate experience, diversity and avoid unconscious bias, please avoid having a photo in your CV. We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality for all applicants.

Please be aware that we will not accept speculative CV submissions for any of our roles from recruitment agencies, and any unsolicited candidate submissions will be exempt from any payment expectations and ownership.

CISC’s commitment to diversity and inclusion
CISC is committed to securing a diverse and inclusive work environment where everyone feels respected and heard. A diverse workforce allows CISC to achieve results through different approaches and solutions to task execution and problem solving. We want all our employees to have equal opportunities for personal growth and career opportunities regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, religion, nationality, and ethnicity.



---



Copenhagen Infrastructure Service Company

CISC is a service company working exclusively for Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP). CISC is owned by the funds managed by CIP with the purpose of delivering best-in-class services to the growing portfolio of renewable assets.

We engage in the energy transition through specialist services, project development and value creation with trusted third-party suppliers. Our core focus is conducting due-diligence, development, construction, and operations of renewable assets, and we deliver a range of services within technical, commercial, and financial management, compliance, tax, legal, transaction and ESG.

We provide global support and a local presence in our key markets, and our teams are continuously delivering and developing services that are tailored to our wide range of projects – from offshore and onshore wind, solar and battery energy storage systems, to advanced bioenergy assets. For more information, please visit cisc.dk.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Group

Global Operations >>> Technology >>> Data & Insights

Reports To

Head of Data & Insights

LOCATION:

Hybrid/Remote (Based in country with STG Offices}

Position Summary

Do you want to make a real impact — not just write code, but build something that matters?

As a Data Engineer, you’ll help fuel global transformation; your work will bring clarity to chaos, connecting scattered data into a single source of truth that powers our next generation planning platform, o9.

If you’re driven by purpose, hungry to grow, and excited to see your work make a visible difference, this is where you belong.

As a Data Engineer, you will build and improve data pipelines for the o9 planning tool, ensuring clean, governed, and ready-to-use data from various sources. You’ll also contribute to broader platform development, supporting our data warehouse and other analytics initiatives.

You’ll be part of a global company on a bold data-driven transformation — shifting from gutfeel to insight, from silos to clarity. Your work will help shape how we plan, decide, and act at every level. This isn’t just about building pipelines; it’s about building trust in data, unlocking scale, and enabling smarter decisions across the business. You’ll play a real part in turning data into a true driver of change — and that change starts with you.

Key Responsibilities


Developing and maintaining data pipelines that deliver refined, high-quality data to our o9 planning platform
Consolidating and transforming data from multiple internal and external systems for planning and analytics use
Supporting and enhancing our data warehouse infrastructure , ensuring consistency and reliability of source data
Applying data validation rules , quality checks, and governance standards throughout the pipeline
Implementing and maintaining monitoring , alerting, and documentation to ensure system transparency and stability
Collaborating with team members and stakeholders to continuously improve workflows, tools, and technical practices


Who We Are Looking For

A hands-on builder who thrives in a structured but evolving environment, that enjoys making things work — not just once, but reliably, and at scale.

You take pride in delivering clean, maintainable pipelines and are comfortable following guidance, standards, and best practices set by more senior engineers.

You’re curious, eager to learn, and ready to grow your craft by working on real-world data challenges with business impact.

Key Skills & Experience


Solid experience developing data pipelines using modern tools and frameworks
Proficiency in T-SQL and scripting languages like Python or PowerShell
Hands-on familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP)
Understanding data integration and transformation across varied source systems
Basic knowledge of data governance, quality, and security principles
A team-oriented mindset with a willingness to collaborate and ask questions
Attention to detail and a structured, quality-focused approach to building pipelines
Clear communicator who can explain what you're doing and why
Adaptable to changing priorities and tools in a dynamic environment
Proactive learner who seeks out feedback and improvement opportunities


Supplementary Skills & Experience


Experience working with SAP S/4HANA data structures
Hands-on experience with o9 Solutions or similar planning platforms
Exposure to planning-related use cases like forecasting, supply chain, or finance
Familiarity with data warehouse architecture and data modeling concepts
Interest in automation, CI/CD pipelines, or infrastructure-as-code for data


OUR VALUES


A focused mission: enable smarter planning through trusted data
Real impact on business operations, not just behind-the-scenes work
A collaborative, learning-focused team environment
Modern tools, a cloud-first stack, and a platform that’s always improving
Flexibility in how and where you work — remote, hybrid, or onsite
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Billund Municipality, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
As a Data Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in developing and implementing robust data solutions using Databricks and Spark. You will be responsible for enhancing the quality and reliability of our data releases, ensuring data validation, and effectively managing stakeholder expectations. This position requires a strong developer background, with proficiency in multiple programming languages, along with excellent communication skills to liaise with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities:

- Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines and workflows in Databricks.

- Ensure high levels of data quality and integrity through comprehensive data validation techniques.

- Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and understand business requirements and translate them into technical specifications.

- Develop and implement solutions to improve the confidence and reliability of data releases.

- Utilize programming languages (C#, Python) to build and optimize data processing workflows.

- Implement and manage CI/CD pipelines using GitHub to ensure seamless application deployment.

- Monitor and troubleshoot data processing issues, optimizing performance as necessary.

- Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in data engineering, particularly in the context of Azure.

- Work in an Agile environment and contribute to team improvement initiatives.

Qualifications:

- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).

- Proven experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role, with a focus on data integration and processing.

- Strong proficiency in Databricks and Spark for data processing and analytics.

- Experience in data validation processes and techniques to ensure data quality.

- Proficient in at least one of the following programming languages: C#, Python.

- Familiarity with CI/CD practices and tools, particularly GitHub.

- Experience with cloud platforms, preferably Azure; AWS experience is a plus.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a strong focus on stakeholder management.

- Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment

Title: Sproganalytiker
Description:
DataAnnotation er dedikeret til at skabe AI af høj kvalitet. Bliv en del af vores team og hjælp med at træne AI-chatbots, samtidig med at du nyder fleksibiliteten ved fjernarbejde og selv bestemmer din arbejdstid.




Vi søger en tosproget professionel til at slutte sig til vores team og undervise AI-chatbots. Du vil føre samtaler på både dansk og engelsk med chatbots for at måle deres fremskridt samt skrive nye samtaler for at lære dem, hvad de skal sige.




Fordele:

Dette er en fuldtids- eller deltids-fjernarbejdsstilling
Du kan selv vælge, hvilke projekter du vil arbejde på
Du kan arbejde efter din egen tidsplan
Projekter betales pr. time, startende ved $30+ USD pr. time, med bonusser for høj kvalitet og stor volumen




Ansvarsområder (både på dansk og engelsk):

Udarbejde varierede samtaler om en bred vifte af emner
Skrive svar af høj kvalitet ud fra specifikke opgaver
Sammenligne præstationen af forskellige AI-modeller
Undersøge og faktatjekke AI-svar




Kvalifikationer:

Flydende på dansk og engelsk
En bachelorgrad (færdiggjort eller under uddannelse)
Fremragende skrive- og grammatikfærdigheder
Stærke research- og faktatjekfærdigheder for at sikre nøjagtighed og originalitet




Bemærk: Betaling sker via PayPal. Vi vil aldrig bede dig om penge. PayPal håndterer eventuelle valutaomregninger fra USD.

Show more

Title: Senior Martech & Data Specialist
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 116 million registered users and 243,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 431+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.165.000 tonnes of CO2e!

We’re looking for an exceptional Martech and Data Specialist to join the growing Data and Analytics Team at Too Good To Go.

Your mission

We are looking for a technically skilled and data-driven individual to enhance our digital marketing analytics capabilities. This role is critical in optimizing our tools, processes, and data infrastructure, enabling actionable insights and driving data-informed decision-making. You will play a key role in helping to advance attribution models, improving data quality, and supporting marketing performance metrics.

Your ultimate goal is to scale our digital marketing efforts and make Too Good To Go the #1 solution against Food Waste globally.

Your role


Maintain marketing tools and Infrastructure to ensure the highest standards of data quality and completeness.
Lead and manage cross-functional tool integration projects with Product, Tech, and Marketing teams, to design and implement a seamless, end-to-end data pipeline that integrates web and mobile platforms. Tools include web & product analytics platforms, mobile measurement platforms (e.g., Appsflyer), tag management and third-party integrations.
Support self-service analytics capabilities for the marketing team, help prioritize initiatives, and foster a culture of data-driven decision-making to optimize spend and performance.
Lead efforts to enhance and optimize data used in attribution models, enabling deep insights into marketing spend performance and strategic decision-making.
Work closely with compliance teams to ensure marketing tools and practices adhere to GDPR, ePrivacy Directive and other relevant data regulations


Requirements


Full-stack & Technical Marketing Experience. With 5+ years in the industry and 3+ years in a similar role within a fast-paced environment, you bring a solid background in both full-stack and technical marketing.
SQL Proficiency. A strong command of SQL allows for efficient data extraction, manipulation, and transformation.
Infrastructure Scaling. Experienced in optimizing and scaling data pipelines, API integrations, app measurement platforms, and CRM tools (e.g., Braze, Salesforce, GTM, Appsflyer, Amplitude/Mixpanel).
Data Analytics & BI Tools. Expertise in cleaning, normalizing, and analyzing data, with the ability to present insights clearly using BI tools.
Tech-Savvy & Forward-Looking. Always up to date with advancements in marketing technology and analytics, identifying opportunities for innovation and performance improvement.
Proactive & Pragmatic Mindset. Passionate, hands-on, and autonomous, always taking the initiative to get the job done.
Rigorous & Focused. Efficient, precise, and quick to iterate in solving complex problems.
Team Player. A strong communicator who can bridge technical and non-technical teams, translating abstract ideas into measurable actions.
Eco-Conscious. Truly passionate about sustainability and fighting food waste, recognizing the urgency of change and action for the planet.
Perfectly Fluent in English. Full working proficiency in English, ensuring seamless communication and documentation.


Nice to have


Marketing Metrics. You have experience in analyzing and interpreting marketing performance metrics.
Attribution Modeling. You have experience modelling attribution, especially for mobile applications
AB Testing Experience. You are skilled in designing, executing, and interpreting A/B tests


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We can do it if we win together as Waste Warriors with no ego. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.


Show more
HTML:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 116 million registered users and 243,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 431+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.165.000 tonnes of CO2e!

We’re looking for an exceptional Martech and Data Specialist to join the growing Data and Analytics Team at Too Good To Go.

Your mission

We are looking for a technically skilled and data-driven individual to enhance our digital marketing analytics capabilities. This role is critical in optimizing our tools, processes, and data infrastructure, enabling actionable insights and driving data-informed decision-making. You will play a key role in helping to advance attribution models, improving data quality, and supporting marketing performance metrics.

Your ultimate goal is to scale our digital marketing efforts and make Too Good To Go the #1 solution against Food Waste globally.

Your role

  • Maintain marketing tools and Infrastructure to ensure the highest standards of data quality and completeness.
  • Lead and manage cross-functional tool integration projects with Product, Tech, and Marketing teams, to design and implement a seamless, end-to-end data pipeline that integrates web and mobile platforms. Tools include web & product analytics platforms, mobile measurement platforms (e.g., Appsflyer), tag management and third-party integrations.
  • Support self-service analytics capabilities for the marketing team, help prioritize initiatives, and foster a culture of data-driven decision-making to optimize spend and performance.
  • Lead efforts to enhance and optimize data used in attribution models, enabling deep insights into marketing spend performance and strategic decision-making.
  • Work closely with compliance teams to ensure marketing tools and practices adhere to GDPR, ePrivacy Directive and other relevant data regulations

Requirements

  • Full-stack & Technical Marketing Experience. With 5+ years in the industry and 3+ years in a similar role within a fast-paced environment, you bring a solid background in both full-stack and technical marketing.
  • SQL Proficiency. A strong command of SQL allows for efficient data extraction, manipulation, and transformation.
  • Infrastructure Scaling. Experienced in optimizing and scaling data pipelines, API integrations, app measurement platforms, and CRM tools (e.g., Braze, Salesforce, GTM, Appsflyer, Amplitude/Mixpanel).
  • Data Analytics & BI Tools. Expertise in cleaning, normalizing, and analyzing data, with the ability to present insights clearly using BI tools.
  • Tech-Savvy & Forward-Looking. Always up to date with advancements in marketing technology and analytics, identifying opportunities for innovation and performance improvement.
  • Proactive & Pragmatic Mindset. Passionate, hands-on, and autonomous, always taking the initiative to get the job done.
  • Rigorous & Focused. Efficient, precise, and quick to iterate in solving complex problems.
  • Team Player. A strong communicator who can bridge technical and non-technical teams, translating abstract ideas into measurable actions.
  • Eco-Conscious. Truly passionate about sustainability and fighting food waste, recognizing the urgency of change and action for the planet.
  • Perfectly Fluent in English. Full working proficiency in English, ensuring seamless communication and documentation.

Nice to have

  • Marketing Metrics. You have experience in analyzing and interpreting marketing performance metrics.
  • Attribution Modeling. You have experience modelling attribution, especially for mobile applications
  • AB Testing Experience. You are skilled in designing, executing, and interpreting A/B tests

Our values

  • We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We can do it if we win together as Waste Warriors with no ego. We believe in a #oneteam.
  • We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
  • We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
  • We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
  • We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.

What We Have To Offer

  • An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
  • To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
  • Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
  • We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
  • To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
  • An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
  • We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
  • We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
  • We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.

How To Apply

  • We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
  • Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
  • Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.

Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Title: Customer Engineer, Data Analytics, Google Cloud
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Copenhagen, Denmark; Viby, Denmark.Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of experience with cloud native architecture in a customer-facing or support role.
Experience with Big Data technologies or concepts, such as analytics warehousing, data processing, data transformation, data governance, data migrations, ETL, ELT, SQL, NoSQL, performance or scalability optimizations, or batch versus streaming.
Experience engaging with, and presenting to, technical stakeholders and executive leaders


Preferred qualifications:


Experience in technical sales or consulting in cloud computing, data analytics, or Big Data.
Experience with developing data warehousing, data lakes, batch/real-time event processing, streaming, data processing (ETL/ELT), data migrations, data visualization tools and data governance on cloud native architectures.
Experience with architecture design, implementing, tuning, schema design and query optimization of scalable and distributed systems.
Experience in understanding customer requirements with the ability to break down requirements and design technical architectures.
Experience with aspects of cloud computing (infrastructure, storage, platforms and data), as well as the cloud market, competitive dynamics and customer buying behavior.


About The Job

When leading companies choose Google Cloud, it's a huge win for spreading the power of cloud computing globally. Once educational institutions, government agencies, and other businesses sign on to use Google Cloud products, you come in to facilitate making their work more productive, mobile, and collaborative. You listen and deliver what is most helpful for the customer. You assist fellow sales Googlers by problem-solving key technical issues for our customers. You liaise with the product marketing management and engineering teams to stay on top of industry trends and devise enhancements to Google Cloud products.

As a Customer Engineer, you will partner with technical Sales teams as a data analytics subject matter expert to differentiate Google Cloud to customers. You will help prospective and existing customers and partners understand the power of Google Cloud, develop creative cloud solutions and architectures to solve their business challenges, engage in proofs of concepts, and troubleshoot any technical questions and roadblocks related to database migrations, data back ends and all aspects of the data lifecycle. You will use your expertise to engage with customers to understand their business and technical requirements, and persuasively present practical and useful solutions on Google Cloud.

You will be a part of a team of fellow Googlers working in an environment of respect and inclusion where we promote equal opportunities to succeed.

Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities


Work with the team to identify and qualify business opportunities related, understand key customer objections, and develop the strategy to resolve technical blockers, in relation to aspects of the data lifecycle.
Share in-depth data analytics expertise to support the technical relationship with customers, including technology advocacy, support bid responses, product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and partner with product management to prioritize solutions impacting customer adoption to Google Cloud.
Identify business and technical requirements, conduct full technical discovery and architect client solutions to meet gathered requirements.
Work with Google Cloud products to demonstrate and prototype integrations in customer and partner environments.
Prepare and deliver sales messaging in an effort to highlight the Google Cloud value proposition, use techniques such as whiteboard and slide presentations, product demonstrations, white papers and RFI responses.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Junior Consultant med flair for data til Salgsorganisationen
Description:
Vil du være med til at optimere og skabe forandring inden for ét af vores vigtigste nøgletal i vores butikker? Brænder du for at skabe overblik og analysere større dataset – og kan du formidle det på en overskuelig måde? Så er du måske den Junior Consultant, vi søger til Salgsorganisationen!




Stillingen som Junior Consultant er for dig, som motiveres af analytiske opgaver og optimering af processer, som er med til at gøre hverdagen lettere for vores kolleger i butikkerne.




Få en vigtig rolle i en central afdeling

Salgsorganisationen er bindeleddet mellem vores butikker og hovedkontoret. Afdelingens overordnede mål er at støtte kollegerne i vores butikker ved at sikre enkle og effektive arbejdsgange. Det gør vi gennem udvikling og implementering af koncepter, der standardiserer og optimerer processer og arbejdsrutiner i butikkerne.




Vores fornemste opgave er at servicere vores butikker bedst muligt. Vi sætter derfor en ære i at forstå den praktiske butiksdrift, hvilket du også vil få indsigt i med indarbejdning i to af vores butikker i en periode på 4-6 uger. På den måde får du et godt indblik i vores kerneforretning.




Om jobbet

Du vil sammen med dine kolleger indsamle og behandle data, som herefter skal analyseres og bearbejdes. Herefter vil du præsentere dine anbefalinger til optimeringer
Bidrage til tværfagligt samarbejde på tværs af IT, Controlling og regionale salgsafdelinger – du skal kunne agere både som fagspecialist og slutbruger, der ved ”hvad” og ikke kun ”hvordan”
Arbejde i forskellige interne og eksterne systemer og behandle data herfra
Udarbejdelse af diverse nøgletalsoversigter
Opfølgning på processer fra butiksdriften og optimeringer hertil
Forberede og analysere data, der skal synliggøre evt. problemstillinger og optimeringer
Ad hoc-opgaver




Om dig

Du er øvet bruger af Google Sheets eller Excel (macro, automatisering, Power-BI og lignede mester du også allerede)
Du evner at omsætte store datasæt i et brugbart og overskueligt overblik – og formidle det på en forståelige måde
Du kan selvstændigt udlede konklusioner fra data og på sigt komme med forslag til løsninger (når processer og organisation kendes)
Du stræber hele tiden efter at optimere og videreudvikle eksisterende løsninger – og/eller finde på nye
Du har et stort servicegen, der kommer til udtryk i din kommunikation og evne til at skabe relationer
Du kan bevare overblikket og følge op, når det er nødvendigt
Du har en relevant uddannelse og gerne krydret med erfaring fra detail – du må gerne være nyuddannet
Du har et godt sprogligt niveau for engelsk – tysk er en fordel




Vi tilbyder

Et uformelt arbejdsmiljø med faglig sparring, motiverede kolleger og humor
En arbejdsdag med spændende og alsidige opgaver, som du har mulighed for at præge og udvikle
Målrettet oplæring i alle processer samt mentorordning, så du har de bedste forudsætninger for at lykkes i jobbet
Grænseløse karrieremuligheder og faglige udfordringer
Mulighed for sundhedspakke
Rabatordning hos flere udbydere af rejser, shopping, kultur mm.




Hovedkontor i hjertet af Aarhus

Du vil have din daglige gang på vores store og innovative hovedkontor på Godsbanen i Aarhus.




På vores hovedkontor, får du som medarbejder adgang til:

Gratis fitnesscenter
In-house massageordning
Sund kantineordning med mulighed for morgenmad, frokost og nem aftensmad (take-away) – alt samen medminimum 30 % økologi.




Du får derudover også mulighed for at deltage i sociale aktiviteter som f.eks. morgenyoga på tagterrassen, løbeklub, familiedag og fredagsbarer.




Ansøgningsfrist d. 25. maj

Vi behandler løbende indkomne ansøgninger, så send gerne ansøgning og CV hurtigst muligt.




I rekrutteringsprocessen kan du forvente: screening, telefoninterview, jobsamtaler, case og kognitiv test.




Tiltrædelse er hurtigst muligt efter aftale.




Har du spørgsmål?

Ved spørgsmål til jobbet eller rekrutteringsprocessen kan du kontakte den ansvarlige Recruiter, Ida Marie, på +45 60 34 03 08 på hverdage mellem kl. 9.00-15.00 eller ved at sende en mail til jobilidlhq@lidl.dk.




Vi ser frem til at modtage dit motiverede CV!

Show more

  • Gratis fitnesscenter

Title: Seeking a Process Data Scientist to our Process Science Analytics Team
Place: Hillerød, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a Process Data Scientist to help us translate our manufacturing and supporting processes pain points, into first class Manufacturing Intelligence Use Cases via data analytics /science. If you thrive by being a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data, then you just might be a great colleague to our highly skilled Process Analytics organization.

Your New Role

The Process Data Scientist is a critical role within FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) as the business is expanding and we are introducing new technologies, programs, and customers continuously – with data excellence being one of the mission enablers. We will provide ongoing support to our new site in Holly Springs, NC, USA.

You will be a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data usage and analytics value chain, whilst being the owner of already validated monitoring applications, e.g., an electronic chromatogram review setup and machine learning batch performance models. We continuously strive to identify opportunities to improve internal systems and practices, as well as provide direction and development of digital/data offerings to our partners.

Your Primary Tasks Will Be


Support process investigations, root cause analysis, optimization with data support and analysis
Process Analytics systems support to manufacturing across all product modalities
Develop, validate, and deploy ETL pipelines and help build the process data ecosystem
Support process trending, continued process verification (CPV) and annual product reviews (APQR)
Support development of applications with models for process characterization and scale-up/out
Develop, validate, and deploy multivariate batch monitoring models
Support innovation and systems improvement initiatives in the Process Analytics space



The Skills & Knowledge We Hope You Possess


You have a master’s degree in in a relevant science or engineering discipline (i.e., Engineering, Bioinformatics or similar) with 2 years of industry experience or a Bachelors in the same area with 4 years of industry experience.
You have working-knowledge of SQL and a solid understanding of data science and the Python data science ecosystem (NumPy, SciPy, pandas, Scikit-learn, Jupyter Notebook).
Familiarity with SIMCA-online, TIBCO Statistica, Visual Basic and Git version control are a plus.
It would be considered an advantage if you also have GMP experience, having worked on delivering GxP applications.



We value candidates who are naturally curious, greet people with a smile, and possess a can-do attitude. You demonstrate humility and respect for those around you. As someone who is pragmatic and structured, you have a keen focus on quality and enjoy working independently. You are proactive in dynamic entrepreneurial environments. Most importantly, you possess strong communication skills and appreciate the support of a cross-functional team.

The team

The Process Analytics team is embedded in the Process Science (PS) organization and provide leadership and subject matter expertise to existing production-ready process data business processes, while also seeking to develop and introduce new Manufacturing Intelligence in clinical, PPQ and commercial processes primarily in the large-scale Cell Culture manufacturing.

We are a growing team of highly professional dedicated scientists/engineers with data management and data science expertise - but also broad experience within pharmaceutical development and manufacturing of monoclonal antibodies.

The work environment is international and informal. The role is based in our Hillerød, Denmark location, and we offer a flexible work arrangement where a defined number of working hours can be carried out in the employee’s home.

We keep a high pace and focus on a vital work life balance while having fun. We put a strong emphasis on psychological safety through trust and empowerment within our teams and hope that this is something that speaks to you as well.

Application

Has this sparked your interest, then please upload your CV and cover letter as soon as possible, as we screen candidates on a continuous basis and call in for interviews.

The Company

FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies is an industry-leading Biologics Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with locations in Hillerød, Denmark, Teesside, UK, RTP, North Carolina and College Station, Texas, USA. We use our skills, dedication, and ambition to enable impact for the world’s most innovative biotech and biopharma companies reimagining healthcare’s potential. We work across the entire lifecycle of our customers’ products – enabling success throughout. Every cure, vaccine, biologic, and advancement we contribute to starts with our people and our passion. We fuel one another’s passion, help accelerate progress, expand capabilities, strengthen innovation, and improve processes to improve lives.

We offer the chance to be part of a global workplace where passion, drive and commitment are met with opportunities for professional and personal development. Deeply committed to diversity and inclusion, we ensure that everyone no matter their background or gender has an opportunity to develop. We take pride in enriching our communities, caring for our environment, and cultivating a world of opportunity for future generations.

We aim to foster a collaborative, innovative and rewarding environment, where diverse perspectives and people come together united by a common purpose and shared values. We pursue our fullest potential as individual contributors and team members. We strive to be the employer of choice and offer a competitive compensation and benefit package.

FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identify or any other protected class.

To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of FUJIFILM about this requisition. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at FUJIFILM via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of FUJIFILM, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by FUJIFILM for this requisition and a valid agreement with FUJIFILM is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the FUJIFILM agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

HTML:
We are looking for a Process Data Scientist to help us translate our manufacturing and supporting processes pain points, into first class Manufacturing Intelligence Use Cases via data analytics /science. If you thrive by being a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data, then you just might be a great colleague to our highly skilled Process Analytics organization.

Your New Role

The Process Data Scientist is a critical role within FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) as the business is expanding and we are introducing new technologies, programs, and customers continuously – with data excellence being one of the mission enablers. We will provide ongoing support to our new site in Holly Springs, NC, USA.

You will be a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data usage and analytics value chain, whilst being the owner of already validated monitoring applications, e.g., an electronic chromatogram review setup and machine learning batch performance models. We continuously strive to identify opportunities to improve internal systems and practices, as well as provide direction and development of digital/data offerings to our partners.

Your Primary Tasks Will Be

  • Support process investigations, root cause analysis, optimization with data support and analysis
  • Process Analytics systems support to manufacturing across all product modalities
  • Develop, validate, and deploy ETL pipelines and help build the process data ecosystem
  • Support process trending, continued process verification (CPV) and annual product reviews (APQR)
  • Support development of applications with models for process characterization and scale-up/out
  • Develop, validate, and deploy multivariate batch monitoring models
  • Support innovation and systems improvement initiatives in the Process Analytics space


The Skills & Knowledge We Hope You Possess

  • You have a master’s degree in in a relevant science or engineering discipline (i.e., Engineering, Bioinformatics or similar) with 2 years of industry experience or a Bachelors in the same area with 4 years of industry experience.
  • You have working-knowledge of SQL and a solid understanding of data science and the Python data science ecosystem (NumPy, SciPy, pandas, Scikit-learn, Jupyter Notebook).

Title: (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst - based at our Luxembourg
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.

The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Legal Directorate (JU) – Coordination Division (COORD) – at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst* - This is a full time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.


internal benchmark (Associate) Officer Business Support for IT Applications


Panel interviews are forseen as of March 2025.

Purpose

This role is based in the Coordination Division of the Legal Directorate. As an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst, you will work in coordination with a Senior Legal Engineering and Innovation Officer to: (i) co-ordinate the prospecting of new applications suitable for the Legal Directorate, (ii) ensure maintenance, assistance, development and deployment of IT applications for the Legal Directorate, (iii) liaise with stakeholders in the Legal Directorate to ensure close alignment with business needs, and (iv) contribute to successful IT project delivery and change management. You will also contribute to the development and maintenance of the Legal Directorate’s intranet presence and to compliance with the Bank’s data governance and data quality frameworks.

Operating Network

You will report to and work under the supervision of the Head of Division of JU Coordination. You will work closely with the senior management team of the Legal Directorate, JU divisions and various other counterparts. You will cooperate with central IT Services with other Data Officers and with external consultants.

Accountabilities


Contribute to the development and deployment of new IT applications in the Legal Directorate to ensure broad-based, timely and efficient take up of new technologies
Provide support to internal clients concerning existing IT applications used by the Legal Directorate
Develop, deploy and provide ongoing support for the intranet presence of the Legal Directorate
Find new use cases for existing or new IT applications, taking into account the needs of the Legal Directorate relative to the overall IT environment of the Bank
Perform the role of JU Data Officer by: (i) taking the lead in matters related to compliance with EIBG’s data governance, data management and data quality framework, (ii) identifying and remedying data governance issues adversely affecting the functioning of the Legal Directorate; and (iii) participating in meetings of the Information Governance Steering Committee and analogous bodies to represent the interests of the Legal Directorate
Contribute to streamlining of JU internal processes and map, standardize, control, and automate legal workflows, documents, templates, and electronic records
Provide change management support to IT, Legal Tech & Innovation projects in the Legal Directorate


Qualifications


University degree, preferably in Business Administration, Computer Science/Engineering and / or in another area relevant to the job
At least 3 years of relevant professional experience in a role related to IT engineering and/or innovation
Familiarity with the SDLC (software development lifecycle), ideally at the EIBG or other relevant organization, is required
Business analysis and change management experience would be a strong asset
Knowledge of all or most of the following: Microsoft Sharepoint online, Business Object, Microsoft 365, OpenText Livelink, Smart-IT is required
Excellent organisational skills and ability to prioritise and meet deadlines, with strong result and customer orientation
Understanding of the EIB ’s mission, organisation and activities
Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (*) with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage


Competencies

Find out more about EIB core competencies here

To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here

(*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.

We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.

We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.

Deadline for applications: This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.
