Title: Lead Data Engineer
Description:
About LGND

LGND is an early-stage startup revolutionizing geospatial AI infrastructure. We bridge the gap between large Earth observation models and specific application developers, enabling intuitive interaction with geospatial data. Our core mission is to empower decision-makers with rapid insights from vast, complex datasets. As part of our small, dynamic team, you will play a foundational role in building tools that have never existed before.

Role Summary

We are seeking a Lead Data Engineer to design, build, and scale our inference pipeline for geospatial embeddings. This pipeline is the backbone of LGND's technological product, integrating with a point-and-click web application to generate embeddings for geographic areas of interest based on user-defined parameters. These embeddings will populate a custom vector database designed for massive scale and speed.

The ideal candidate is a seasoned engineer with experience in production-grade data pipelines, thrives under uncertainty, and is eager to collaborate across engineering, DevOps, and science disciplines. AI and geospatial experience are not required, if you are willing to learn fast with our help. Over time, this role will evolve into an engineering lead position, overseeing all technological components while focusing on engineering excellence.

Role is remote. We have team members in San Francisco, Philadelphia, and Coppenhagen.

Key Responsibilities


Build the Inference Pipeline:
Develop a scalable, efficient pipeline to generate geospatial embeddings based on user input, integrating parameters such as geographic area, model type, time range, tiling strategy, and imagery source
Balance pre-processed tokens (e.g., cloud-free Sentinel imagery) with on-the-fly inference for optimal performance
Ensure the pipeline supports billions of embeddings at scale and leverages advanced compute capabilities for fast inference, mostly on commercial clouds but also local resources.
Integration and Collaboration:
Work closely with front-end engineers to ensure seamless integration of the pipeline into a user-friendly web application
Collaborate with leadership to determine which components of the pipeline and storage system should remain proprietary versus open-source
Partner with external groups like AWS and Asterik Labs for open-source contributions and technical integrations
Scalability and Professionalism:
Design a pipeline that other high-level data engineers can immediately inherit and build upon
Move large amounts of data around professionally, focusing on scale, extensibility, and maintainability
Ensure compliance with best practices in data engineering, DevOps, and MLOps
Enhance Existing Projects:
Build upon existing foundational work to increase pipeline speed, scale, and extensibility. Key repositories include:
embeddings-worker: A Python module that creates vector embeddings of satellite images using the Clay Foundation Model. The system splits geographic regions into smaller chips, processes them in a distributed manner, and manages status tracking in a database
embeddings-api: A REST API module that manages the vector database and orchestrates embedding generation tasks. It includes robust endpoints for scheduling geographic regions for processing, retrieving task status, and searching for similar vectors
Future Leadership:
Serve as the lead for the inference pipeline, one of four core technological components at LGND (inference pipeline, fine-tuning and retrieval algorithms, vector search database, and SDK)
Optionally grow into an engineering manager role, overseeing future hires and cross-functional development efforts

Scope of Work: First Two Months


Increase the Speed and Scale of the Pipeline:
Optimize the inference pipeline to efficiently handle the generation of embeddings at massive scale
Focus on performance improvements to support billions of embeddings and reduce inference runtime
Tokenize Source Imagery:
Develop a process to "tokenize" source imagery for a given geographic region and time range
Produce image chips according to the large Earth observation model architecture
Store these image chips in Amazon S3 for easy recall during subsequent inference runs
Run Model Inference:
Implement the pipeline to run inference on a couple of existing, pre-trained models
Output the resulting embeddings and store them in a scalable, performant vector search database
Collaborate with external partners, such as AWS, to ensure pipeline compatibility with the vector database infrastructure
Nice-to-Have Feature:
Develop functionality to process source imagery into mosaics to address cloud cover and other image quality issues, improving the quality of inputs for inference


Scope of Work: First Two Months, expanded


Operationalize the CLIP-based Retrieval Pipeline
Implement and optimize a scalable inference pipeline to generate CLIP embeddings (and embeddings from other pre-trained models) for remote sensing imagery
Design the system to tokenize source imagery into manageable image chips for specific geographic areas and time ranges. Store these chips efficiently in Amazon S3 for reuse
Ensure flexibility to incorporate additional embedding models in the future
Experiment with Multi-Modal Retrieval
Enable interaction with both image and text queries in a combined retrieval framework using pre-trained vision-language models (e.g., CLIP)
Implement functionality to combine multiple embeddings (image-to-image and text-to-image similarity) and experiment with methods like WEICOM for modality control (e.g., weighted combinations of embeddings)
Database and API Design
Collaborate with external partners (e.g., AWS) to design a scalable vector search database capable of handling billions of embeddings
Develop APIs to allow efficient storage and retrieval of embeddings based on user-defined queries (geographic area, model, time range, and textual context)
Pre-Processing for Image Quality (Nice-to-Have)
Develop a feature to process source imagery into cloud-free mosaics, improving image quality for inference and retrieval
Performance Optimization
Optimize the pipeline for speed, ensuring embeddings can be generated at scale. Explore trade-offs between pre-processed tokens and on-the-fly inference
Focus on building a robust, scalable system that reduces latency while maintaining flexibility



Requirements

Required Technical Skills:


Proficiency in Python and familiarity with Docker
Expertise in building production-grade data pipelines at scale (10+ years of experience preferred)
Familiarity with tools and frameworks like:
Geospatial libraries: numpy, pandas, rasterio, geopandas, xarray
Machine learning: PyTorch (torch, torchdata, torchvision), timm, einops
Cloud integration: boto3 for AWS
Database management: SQLAlchemy, GeoAlchemy2, pgvector, psycopg2
Experience with inference pipelines, including pre-processing and real-time inference strategies


Preferred Experience:


Familiarity with satellite image formats and protocols (e.g., STAC, Cloud Optimized GeoTIFFs, Zarr)
Experience with AWS infrastructure (bonus, not required)
Background in MLOps and geospatial AI applications


Soft Skills:


Self-led and able to navigate uncertainty
Excited by the opportunity to build tools and systems that have never been built before
Collaborative, humble, and eager to learn



Benefits

Cultural Values


Humility: You value collaboration and learning from others
Integrity: You uphold honesty and transparency in your work
Effectiveness: You are results-driven, with a focus on building scalable, impactful solutions



Compensation And Benefits


Competitive salary based on experience
Equity options in a Seed Stage Startup
Flexible work arrangements
Opportunity to play a foundational role in shaping LGND's technological infrastructure

  • Familiarity with satellite image formats and protocols (e.g., STAC, Cloud Optimized GeoTIFFs, Zarr)
  • Experience with AWS infrastructure (bonus, not required)
  • Background in MLOps and geospatial AI applications

Soft Skills:

  • Self-led and able to navigate uncertainty
  • Excited by the opportunity to build tools and systems that have never been built before
  • Collaborative, humble, and eager to learn


Benefits

Cultural Values

  • Humility: You value collaboration and learning from others
  • Integrity: You uphold honesty and transparency in your work
  • Effectiveness: You are results-driven, with a focus on building scalable, impactful solutions


Compensation And Benefits

  • Competitive salary based on experience
  • Equity options in a Seed Stage Startup
  • Flexible work arrangements
  • Opportunity to play a foundational role in shaping LGND's technological infrastructure

Title: Data & AI Engineer
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about developing large enterprise solutions with the latest technology? Do you want to implement large cloud-based solutions in Microsoft Azure?

📍 Location: Ballerup, Aarhus

As a data engineer, you will develop and implement Azure-based solutions that improve data integration, data quality, and data flow to support business processes and strategies. You will be a key part of our projects from start to finish and contribute to decisions regarding technology selection that meets customer needs.

Your role

Responsibilities

In this role, you will help customers achieve their data and analytics strategy by setting up robust data warehouse and reporting solutions for processes such as finance, logistics, sales, manufacturing, projects and more. You will collaborate with developers, customers and business consultants to implement solutions on Azure. You will have the opportunity to use cutting-edge technology such as Azure Synapse, Databricks, Analysis Services and the Power BI Premium platform. A senior data engineer has extensive experience and in-depth knowledge of data warehouses, ETL tools, SQL, APIs and data modeling. You understand complex requirements and thrive when transforming these into robust data flows and structured views with high data quality and where future changes can be easily implemented. In this role, you will manage how decisions within each area affect the overall solution. Responsibilities will include:


Develop robust data warehouses with an end-user focus for a variety of processes
Building the infrastructure required for data extraction, transformation, and loading from a variety of sources
Write good, clean and efficient code
Use new technology like Microsoft Fabric, Azure Synapse, Databricks, Analysis Services, Power BI Premium and more
Create fast and accurate data models


Why is this a great job opportunity?

We focus on the latest trends in the market and Microsoft technology to ensure that we match the customer's needs to develop their own business with our technological insight. This means that you will work with the latest solutions for a future in the cloud. We want a lifelong customer relationship and work together with exciting companies, both locally and internationally. We are committed to following standards so that the solutions we deliver have a long life and are easy to develop as the customer's needs change.

Qualifications

Just like us, you are passionate about making the world more data-driven based on the latest technologies and methods.

To be successful in the role, we see that you have:


A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Experience within Microsoft's Data Platform, on-premises or cloud (AWS or Azure)
Experience with ETL processes, data warehousing and data modeling
Very good skills and experience with SQL
Speaks fluent Danish and English
Experience with developing SSIS, SSAS and Power BI and preferably Microsoft ERP
Proficiency in programming languages as Python, Java or Scala
Danish residency


Why become part of Columbus?

At Columbus, we care about each other as much as we care about our business. Therefore, we offer:


Not just a job, but a career: You will have access to a varied training program, including online and physical courses, to accelerate your career development and support your personal and professional growth
Belonging: At Columbus, we value teamwork and have a good collaborative environment. You will be part of a company where your colleagues have deep industry insight and a strong understanding of our customers' needs
Work-life Balance: The well-being of our employees is a priority. We want you to be the best version of yourself at work, so we offer high flexibility to shape your own workday
Global Impact: You will be part of a local and global team that is at the forefront of industry trends, with opportunities to influence and improve our service offerings on an international level


Become a part of Columbus!

You can easily apply by connecting your LinkedIn or by uploading a CV via the link. Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis.

We are looking forward to receiving your application!

About Columbus

At Columbus, you’ll be joining a global IT consulting company with over 1,600 dedicated professionals. We are at the forefront of digital transformation, present in 7 countries helping 1,100 customers securing their future by driving growth through data-driven insights and creating seamless digital experiences.

With our broad industry experience in both B2B and complex B2C, we stand out as the leading digital sales partner in the Nordic region. You’ll be part of a team that designs and implements top-tier, industry-specific solutions, unleashing the full potential of our customers' digital businesses.

We believe in Digital transformation for a better tomorrow, where we also commit to drive positive social and environmental change on a global scale!

www.columbusglobal.com

Work at Columbus

Curious about life at Columbus? Check out our Instagram or LinkedIn feed to see our team in action, get insights into our culture, and discover what makes Columbus a great place to work!


Show more

Title: Chief/Principal Strategy Consultant to Data & Analytics
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you an experienced strategy professional who wants to accelerate your career by driving complex strategy development at the intersection of data, AI, analytics and business in one of the largest banks in the Nordics? If yes, then we would like to hear from you!

About The Team

Our team is responsible for defining, developing and driving execution of Danske Bank’s data, AI and analytics strategy. We partner with key stakeholders from across the group, ensuring strong strategic and financial planning, with clear alignment of strategic ambitions.

We are an international team with a diverse mix of backgrounds from the banking industry, consulting and beyond.

At Danske Bank, success comes from teaming up, maintaining an open mind, and collectively owning what we do striving for high-quality results – we expect these are qualities which you also bring with you into this role.

About The Role

We are looking for an experienced strategy consultant with a strong strategy consulting toolbox and an affinity for data, AI and analytics strategy and transformation, preferably with experience from the financial services industry.

The right candidate for this position should thrive in a fast-paced environment, be proactive and enjoy both planned and ad-hoc tasks.

As a senior member of the team, you will be responsible for your own assignments from day one and we trust that you drive and manage tasks to deliver great results – both for yourself and through other team members. You must be a strong team player and find it refreshing to work at an executive level, but should also be ready to roll up your sleeves to deep-dive.

Key Responsibilities Of The Role

We are looking for a person with:


Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills, leading qualitative and quantitative strategic analysis resulting in tangible outcomes and recommendations
High level of integrity and work ethic and thrive in a team where you are proactive and have a can-do mentality
Strong project and stakeholder management skills in in cross-functional settings and towards executive management, ensuring deliveries on time and of the right quality as per stakeholder expectations
Ability to communicate and break down complex topics into a clear and precise narrative
Deep experience in PowerPoint, Excel and other Microsoft Office applications
Interest in finance, strategic planning and data, AI and Analytics as an enabler of business outcomes


Expected Qualifications


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business Administration, Economics, Data Science, or a related field.
5-10 years of experience (depending on seniority) in strategic planning and execution, either from consulting or in-house strategy & transformation functions and preferably in the banking or financial services industry.
Proven track record of successfully managing and implementing strategy projects.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a demonstrated ability to drive projects based on data insights.
Excellent leadership and communication skills, capable of persuading and influencing senior management and stakeholders.
Proficiency in data & analytics tools and methodologies.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.


Would you like to join us? Send us your application!

Please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your qualifications and why you are the best fit for the role. If you are curious to hear more about the job, please contact Axel Philip, Head of Strategy, Execution & Business Management, at +45 22 12 68 96.

Please note that we are processing applications on an ongoing basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

We look forward hearing from you!
Show more

Title: Senior Product Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. We’re democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levels—a privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

But what truly sets us apart? Our people. We’re a diverse group of innovative thinkers, creators, and problem-solvers who believe in delivering an incredible product—and having fun while doing it.

The Opportunity

We're looking for a Senior Product Analyst to join our Product Analytics Team - a team focused on instrumenting and using data to enable better product decisions and opportunities.

You’ll be bringing your perspectives and recommendations on our business and customers to help drive better decisions for our product, and communicate and influence teams and stakeholders through close collaboration.

Veo is in a foundational stage in how we approach building a shared understanding of metrics, baselines and drivers, and so you will play a key role in ensuring proper instrumentation and tracking, as well as ensuring that teams have common metrics which best align with goals and are build with an eye towards reusability.

What You'll Do


Common Metrics & KPIs: Define, implement, and maintain the metrics that align with product goals - ensuring they’re reusable, well-documented, and widely understood across teams
Quantitative Research & Insights: Conduct deep-dive analyses and experiments to verify product opportunities, making data-driven recommendations that inform our roadmap
Instrumentation & Event Tracking: Oversee proper tracking for product features. Validate, test, and document analytics events to ensure accurate and consistent data collection
Cross-Functional Alignment: Ensure all relevant teams—product, marketing, engineering, etc. - have access to meaningful insights that guide decision-making and align with our business objectives




What You Could Bring


5+ years of professional experience in a data analytics role, ideally within SaaS, sports technology, or other analytics-driven products
Proven ability to handle ad-hoc requests, manage stakeholder expectations, and deliver actionable insights
Solid experience with setting up event tracking and instrumenting features (we use Segment)
Strong experience based knowledge in SQL and Python (or similar language)
Acumen on product intuition
Experience with BigQuery, Looker, Amplitude, Segment or similar tools
Track record of translating complex analyses into actionable recommendations
Experience setting up and running experiments
Full professional proficiency in English




Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology – with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

What Values We Hold at Veo.

Dare - We take initiative, stay curious, and challenge the status quo in our work.

Own it - We drive impact by identifying opportunities, taking responsibility, and confidently executing.

Level up - We embrace growth, continuously learning and shaping our skills.

Play as a team - We collaborate across a diverse organization, leveraging shared insights for stronger outcomes.

Customer Centric - We deliver value by having close partnerships and a deep understanding of our customers (internally and externally)

We value diversity and inclusion and welcome applicants from all backgrounds, even if your experience doesn’t completely match every qualification listed. What matters most is your creativity, potential, and ability to contribute meaningfully.
Show more

Title: Student Worker, IT Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Milestone, your work goes beyond what the human eye can see. With our unique video technology software, you help people make wiser and more responsible decisions – in and beyond security. Whether you advance our software, inspire to new integrations, or elevate our customers, you are part of a growth company recognized by the industry. We have a unique people-first approach to everything we do, and it’s not just empty words. Being part of a fun, friendly, and flexible environment you’ll find, that working here almost feels like a home away from home. If you are curious to know more about who we are, we suggest you visit http://milestonesys.com/career 

As an IT Data Analyst, you'll be at the forefront of supporting critical data-related tasks within our organization, particularly within the IT department. Working closely with your team members, you'll actively contribute to our organization's data-driven decision-making processes, leveraging insights gleaned from the data you manage.

Your primary focus will revolve around handling IT-related data, including costs associated with software, hardware, and other IT resources. Your role is pivotal in ensuring transparency and accuracy in this crucial area. You'll have the opportunity to expand your skill set and knowledge base on the job, with ample room for growth and development.  

Your responsibilities will include:

Creating and Updating Reports:


Assist in creating new reports to address specific needs, guided by stakeholders' requirements.
Collaborate closely with team members to gather and organize data, and contribute to report development through data loading, transformation, and visualization techniques. 
Support the updating of existing reports as needs evolve, ensuring accuracy and relevance.


Maintaining Data Integrity:


Assist in routine maintenance tasks to ensure data accuracy and consistency. 
Proactively identify and troubleshoot errors and communicate resolutions effectively to team members.


Supporting Other Tools and Platforms:


Provide assistance in creating PowerPoint presentations and Excel spreadsheets as needed.


Your Profile
You are currently studying a related field within IT, Data Science, Data Analytics or studying business with a flair for data analytics and insights. Furthermore, we hope you see yourself in most of below:


Comfortable using Power BI for data visualization and reporting. 
Familiarity with DAX, the coding language of Power BI, or exposure to SQL basics. 
Ability to recognize and perform common data preprocessing tasks, such as data cleaning and transformations. 
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, vital for collaborating with stakeholders across teams. 
Able to create intuitive and user-friendly reports to convey insights effectively. 
Capable of conducting thorough investigations into the root causes of errors or anomalies. 
High level of English skills, both verbal and written


Please note that the position is on-site at our headquarters in Brøndby, Denmark, and requires that you have a valid Danish work visa.

Welcome to Milestone Systems
At Milestone you will experience a positive and welcoming environment with a global and diverse culture. We are more than 50 different nationalities in the Danish office and English is the corporate language.

We have our own gym with all the equipment you need and additional benefits like fruit, breakfast, lunch, free soft drinks, Friday bars and more.

If you want to develop your professional competencies we offer individual development plans, where you and your manager agree on the right learning path for you.

As our office is 5 minutes cycling from the nearest train station, we have bicycles that you can use.

Contact & Application
Please apply at our website using the ”Apply” button.  

If you have any questions for the position, please contact Director, IT Operations and End User Services, Anne Mikkelsen amk@milestone.dk

We are reviewing resumes on a continuous basis and recommend that you apply as soon as possible.

You will experience an inclusive and unbiased recruitment process where all employment decisions are based on qualifications rather than race, color, ethnicity, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, and religion. We advise you not to attach a cover letter to your application but instead, we encourage you to write a few lines about why you are applying for the position in your resume/CV. Additionally we recommend you not to add a photo in your resume/CV.  

We are looking forward to receiving your application.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you value being able to immerse yourself in data? Are you interested in using data and insights to optimize and support operational actions and business decisions? We are looking for a new colleague with a good understanding of data and a keen analytical mind to join our Tech team. Are you the one we are looking for?




The role of Business Intelligence Specialist

You will play a pivotal role in our company, overseeing the continued development of the BI landscape and Qlik applications across teams throughout our Nordic business. You will be part of our technical department and have a unique opportunity to be involved in projects from A to Z, which typically involve everything from needs assessment, scoping, and investigation of data sources to development, testing, and implementation. Specifically, your tasks will be to ...




Design and develop interactive dashboards and visualizations using Qlik.
Translate complex data sets into clear and compelling business insights.
Work closely with business stakeholders to define KPIs and reporting requirements.
Optimize data models and load scripts for performance and scalability.
Monitor BI tool performance and troubleshoot data/reporting issues.
Support end-users with training and documentation.
Support and contribute to integration work between Qlik and other platforms, systems, or data sources (e.g., CRM, Data warehouse, APIs).







We would like to hear from you if you...

Have 2+ years of experience in BI development with a strong focus on Qlik.
Are proficient in scripting, data modeling, and set analysis in Qlik.
Have experience connecting and transforming data from various sources (e.g., SQL, Excel, APIs).
Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Understand data warehousing principles and ETL processes.
Have excellent communication skills and the ability to work with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.







Ideally, but not necessarily, you have...

Hands-on experience with integration between Qlik and third-party systems (e.g., HubSpot, Business Central, REST APIs)
Are familiar with other BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau)
Basic knowledge of Python for data analysis
Understanding of GDPR and data privacy practices







What we offer

We are an exciting and expanding workplace with offices located across the Nordic region.
An attractive position that offers both personal and professional development.
A rich, professional environment and supportive colleagues who are always willing to help.
A company with high spirits, many social events, and monthly Friday bars. You will feel welcome and experience our special sense of community from day one.
Flexible work setup (remote/hybrid possibilities).
A unique location in the heart of Copenhagen with a view of the Round Tower.







Interested?

This is a full-time position, and we are looking for candidates to start as soon as possible. We are accepting applications until 20 May 2025. Interviews are ongoing.

We look forward to reading your application and CV, which you can send to us through the application portal. Please note that we do not accept applications by email, due to GDPR. Therefore, please do not send documents with CPR numbers.




If you have any questions about the position, please contact our Senior Project Manager, Katja Giedo, at katja.m.giedo@infomedia.dk




We also encourage all qualified candidates to apply for the position regardless of age, gender, religion, or ethnic background.




Show more
HTML:
Do you value being able to immerse yourself in data? Are you interested in using data and insights to optimize and support operational actions and business decisions? We are looking for a new colleague with a good understanding of data and a keen analytical mind to join our Tech team. Are you the one we are looking for?


The role of Business Intelligence Specialist

You will play a pivotal role in our company, overseeing the continued development of the BI landscape and Qlik applications across teams throughout our Nordic business. You will be part of our technical department and have a unique opportunity to be involved in projects from A to Z, which typically involve everything from needs assessment, scoping, and investigation of data sources to development, testing, and implementation. Specifically, your tasks will be to ...


  • Design and develop interactive dashboards and visualizations using Qlik.
  • Translate complex data sets into clear and compelling business insights.
  • Work closely with business stakeholders to define KPIs and reporting requirements.
  • Optimize data models and load scripts for performance and scalability.
  • Monitor BI tool performance and troubleshoot data/reporting issues.
  • Support end-users with training and documentation.
  • Support and contribute to integration work between Qlik and other platforms, systems, or data sources (e.g., CRM, Data warehouse, APIs).



We would like to hear from you if you...

  • Have 2+ years of experience in BI development with a strong focus on Qlik.
  • Are proficient in scripting, data modeling, and set analysis in Qlik.
  • Have experience connecting and transforming data from various sources (e.g., SQL, Excel, APIs).
  • Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Understand data warehousing principles and ETL processes.
  • Have excellent communication skills and the ability to work with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.



Ideally, but not necessarily, you have...

  • Hands-on experience with integration between Qlik and third-party systems (e.g., HubSpot, Business Central, REST APIs)
  • Are familiar with other BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau)
  • Basic knowledge of Python for data analysis
  • Understanding of GDPR and data privacy practices



What we offer

  • We are an exciting and expanding workplace with offices located across the Nordic region.
  • An attractive position that offers both personal and professional development.
  • A rich, professional environment and supportive colleagues who are always willing to help.
  • A company with high spirits, many social events, and monthly Friday bars. You will feel welcome and experience our special sense of community from day one.
  • Flexible work setup (remote/hybrid possibilities).
  • A unique location in the heart of Copenhagen with a view of the Round Tower.



Interested?

This is a full-time position, and we are looking for candidates to start as soon as possible. We are accepting applications until 20 May 2025. Interviews are ongoing.

We look forward to reading your application and CV, which you can send to us through the application portal. Please note that we do not accept applications by email, due to GDPR. Therefore, please do not send documents with CPR numbers.


If you have any questions about the position, please contact our Senior Project Manager, Katja Giedo, at katja.m.giedo@infomedia.dk


We also encourage all qualified candidates to apply for the position regardless of age, gender, religion, or ethnic background.

Title: Data Analyst til Herd Management team hos Lattec
Place: Allerød Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Har du lyst til at analysere på dyrs helbredsdata samt afprøve hypoteser til udvikling af avancerede analyseapparater, så læs videre her…




Vores kunde Lattec har travlt og vi søger nu endnu en Data Analyst til deres Herd Management team, også kaldet Bio-teamet. Du vil få et tæt samarbejde med en erfaren Data Analyst samt med dyrlæger, agronomer m.v. – og med ingeniører i R&D afdelingen.




Lattec i Allerød har stor international succes med deres avancerede produkter til højteknologiske landmænd i hele verden. Virksomheden udvikler proaktive analyse- og sensorsystemer til at måle malkekøers helbredstilstand på gårdene, og de har kunder overalt i verden. Lattec har også en mindre afdeling i Fredericia.




I denne nyoprettede stilling som Data Analyst vil du primært løse følgende opgaver:




Eksplorative analyser af data, herunder hypotese test
Statistiske analyser af store sæt af biologiske data med komplekse afhængigheder
Brug af data til kvalitetsovervågning på eksisterende produkter
Data udtræk (primært SQL-databaser) til understøttelse af udviklingsarbejde
Prototyping af algoritmer (Python) i forbindelse med udvikling og test af nye digitale løsninger til sensordata
Der kan forekomme tilknytning til kundesupportopgaver




Du vil naturligvis få en grundig oplæring i Lattec’s produkter, udviklingsproces m.v. Opgaverne er mangfoldige og vil udvikle sig i takt med dine interesser og kompetencer, virksomhedens vækst og nye udviklingsprojekter.




Du må påregne rejseaktivitet nogle dage månedligt, bl.a. i forbindelse med teamdage og samarbejde med kollegaer på de to lokationer Allerød og Fredericia – afhængigt af din bopæl.




Lattec har et stærkt tværfagligt team på ca. 50 medarbejdere, heraf ca. 8 softwareudviklere og ca. 15 hardware-, elektronik- og mekanikingeniører samt kemiingeniører, dyrlæger og biologer.




Din baggrund




Du har en Master indenfor dataanalyse, matematik eller lignende. Du har formentlig et par års erfaring som Data Analyst, eller er nyuddannet med relevant erfaring fra studiejob.




Du har en del erfaring med:

Python
SQL og NoSQL
Excel
Datavisualiseringer i PowerBI (til internt brug)




Vi vægter højt, at du har lyst til validering af biologiske hypoteser og algoritmer ifm. produktudvikling. Desuden er du vant til at skabe indsigt i data og formidle disse til kollegaer og interessenter, som ofte ikke har databaggrund.




Du er god til både dansk og engelsk i skrift og tale. Hvis du ikke er flydende i dansk, er det vigtigt, at du har lyst til at lære sproget samt er flydende i engelsk. Der vil være en del dokumentation og kommunikation på engelsk, også med DeLaval i Sverige.




Vi tror på, at du som person




har et godt drive, er nysgerrig og elsker at prøve ting af
er lærenem, struktureret, proaktiv og meget kvalitetsbevidst
er udviklingsminded med lyst og evne til ikke-bundne opgaver
kan arbejde selvstændigt og samtidigt evner at være en god teamplayer
har et godt humør og tager et medansvar for den gode stemning
trives i et miljø med frihed under ansvar




Lattec tilbyder




I denne stilling får du stor mulighed for selv at præge jobbet og udvikle dig – og du samarbejder med mange forskellige faggrupper. Du bliver en del af en virksomhed med glade og dedikerede medarbejdere i en flad organisation med en uformel atmosfære og med fokus på team sammenhold.




Her er høj grad af fleksibilitet og rigtig gode medarbejderforhold, bl.a. 5 ugers ferie, 5 feriefridage og fire Lattec fridage, pension og sundhedsforsikring og frokostordning med temadage.




Sidst og ikke mindst lægges der vægt på at afsætte tid til teambuilding, afdelingsmøder og firmaarrangementer – det er vigtigt at alle lærer hinanden godt at kende for at skabe et godt sammenhold og gode produkter.




Dit arbejde vil være på kontoret i Allerød – alternativt i Fredericia, og der er mulighed for at arbejde fra din bopæl et par dage om ugen.




Mere om virksomheden




Lattec I/S blev grundlagt i 2001 og er ejet af DeLaval – og er velfunderet økonomisk. De udvikler og producerer avancerede analytiske løsninger for pro-aktiv styring af malkekvægsbedriften. Disse giver mælkeproducenterne værktøjer til at optimere driften og på samme tid forbedre dyrevelfærd. Lattecs løsninger giver information om den enkelte kos reproduktions- og sundhedstilstand, samt giver landmanden forslag til en handlingsplan.

Læs mere på www.lattec.com




Interesseret?

Hos Bloom ser vi frem til at modtage din ansøgning og CV. Vi indkalder løbende til samtaler, så send gerne din ansøgning snarest muligt.

Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, er du velkommen til at kontakte Sara Juhl hos Bloom via sj@bloom.dk eller telefon 2086 0865.




Hvis du søger jobbet via ’Easy Apply’ skal du ikke forvente et svar på din ansøgning. Det vil du altid få, hvis du søger via jobannoncen på https://bloom.dk/jobs/data-analyst-til-herd-management-team-hos-lattec-337/

Title: BI Reporting and Analytics Specialist BOLIA
Description:
At BOLIA, we are constantly evolving and have high ambitions for our IT solutions to create the best possible experiences for our customers, colleagues, and partners. We are heavily data-driven in our decision-making, and we have a growing need for outstanding BI reports and analyses across the entire business. This encompasses everything from store personnel to back-office functions, as well as BOLIA's management group.

About The Job

In short, we have a wealth of data at BOLIA, and we aim to utilize it even more effectively than we do today! To strengthen this effort, we are looking for a new colleague to act as BI Reporting and Analytics Specialist with a primary focus on the PowerBI platform. In this role, you will have a broad interface across all departments at BOLIA, and you will also collaborate with our many external partners in developing new reporting solutions.

Your tasks

The tasks in this role are numerous and varied. Examples include:


Drive and participate in the development of reporting solutions in PowerBI to enhance BOLIA's decision-making capabilities and foster a performance-driven culture.
Take ownership of BOLIA’s BI platform, with a primary focus on the front-end. This includes defining governance and best practice principles for BI in BOLIA.
Collaborate closely with your colleague responsible for backend BI tasks, who will establish the data foundation for your work, primarily by integrating it into our BI cube.
Participate in the ongoing project including taking our current on-prem BI platform to the next level using Microsoft Fabric, expanding our current reporting capabilities.
Provide second-level support for BI frontend-related tasks.
Manage vendors and follow up on deliveries from external partners who assist with BI work.
Participate in various business projects in collaboration with all departments at BOLIA.
Participate in the BI Center of Excellence in BOLIA to align on the BI efforts.


BOLIA and our IT solutions are undergoing rapid development, providing you with the opportunity to make a significant impact from day one by setting the agenda within the BI area, in collaboration with your colleagues. You will become a key figure at our headquarters, collaborating closely with many of your colleagues across all departments. Additionally, we will continue to engage external partners to assist with BI tasks, who will also serve as your professional sparring partners.

Your Qualifications

We value personality and practical experience far more than educational background, which can vary. The more of the following points you can check off, the better.


You are highly skilled at developing precise and advanced PowerBI reports, consistently delivering insightful and impactful data visualizations, with 3+ years of documented experience.
You are passionate about inspiring others and showcasing the potential of data and Business Intelligence to drive better decision-making across the organization.
You possess strong analytical skills to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.
You have knowledge of DAX, Star Schema modeling, GIT, and the creation of custom visuals, which is considered an advantage.
You have excellent verbal and written communication skills to convey complex information clearly and concisely.
You have a high level of attention to detail to ensure accuracy and quality in your work.
You have a collaborative approach, working effectively with cross-functional teams to achieve common goals and drive organizational success.
You are eager to acquire new knowledge and stay updated on the latest trends in your field, such as AI and Microsoft Copilot for PowerBI.


BOLIA as a workplace


We are located in the heart of Aarhus, close to the train station, in what are arguably the most beautiful office spaces in Denmark!
We have a very active staff association that regularly organizes a variety of events, from parties to knitting clubs.
We have a young working environment with an amazing unity across all departments.
We are part of the Lars Larsen Group, which means that as an employee, you will receive a good staff discount in all Lars Larsen Group companies, including furniture, restaurants, and spa stays.
Our workday is flexible with possibilities for sometimes working from home.


Do you want to join our journey?

We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so we recommend sending your CV as soon as possible. If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact IT Business Performance Manager, Kasper Poulsen, at kpo@bolia.com.

All inquiries will be treated confidentially.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Advanced Analytics Lead
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Drive impactful operational outcomes through Advanced Analytics and become a key enabler of data-driven decision-making at LEGO. In this role, you'll support advanced analytics across the Operations and take a leading role within Manufacturing, integrating insights into strategic decisions. Join us as an Advanced Analytics Lead and shape the future of Operations!


Core Responsibilities





Develop and implement advanced analytics models, including predictive modelling, machine learning, and statistical analysis, to enable higher efficiency and productivity.
Analyse large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and insights that drive business value using python/coding expertise in Databricks
Collaborate with project teams, data analyst, product teams and subject matter experts to identify data science opportunities and provide actionable recommendations based on data-driven insights to support strategic decision-making
Actively contribute to advanced analytics principles and best practices in collaboration with Data Office and BI Manufacturing and be an inspiration and sparring partner for colleagues.
You are a collaborative person by nature and want to be a part of a global cross functional team.
Curious and passionate about exploring and evaluating new methodologies and tools to enhance the organization's analytical capabilities




Play your part in our team succeeding

This role will be part of team Industry 4.0 and a new Data Engineering & Analytics team supporting Manufacturing in becoming even more data driven than today.

Industry 4.0 is part of Operation Transformation, which has the purpose of “stimulating” a shared E2E Innovation focus and by that enabling our Operation Aspirations. Operation Transformation functions as a network organization with teams of specialists interacting with relevant departments and functional areas within the LEGO organization as well as with external partners such as suppliers, universities, industry partners, technical institutes.

Do You Have What It Takes





Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL
Experience in DataBricks
Minimum a handful of years experience in data analysis, statistical modelling, and advanced analytics experience in Manufacturing.
Experience working as part of an autonomous team, managing personal goals, and contributing to team direction.
Expertise in machine learning frameworks (e.g., Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch) and an understanding of MLOps practices, including DevOps principles like IaC and CI/CD pipelines.
It would be beneficial to have leadership experience as driving change is key part of the role
Ability to communicate complex analytical concepts to non-technical audiences
Already working in/with established network and forums and by that have easy access to knowledge and sparring.
Experience working in cross-functional teams and managing multiple projects simultaneously
Proficient in English, both written and verbal




The position is based in Billund, DK and relocation support is not offered for this role.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.


Show more

Industry 4.0 is part of Operation Transformation, which has the purpose of “stimulating” a shared E2E Innovation focus and by that enabling our Operation Aspirations. Operation Transformation functions as a network organization with teams of specialists interacting with relevant departments and functional areas within the LEGO organization as well as with external partners such as suppliers, universities, industry partners, technical institutes.

Do You Have What It Takes



  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL
  • Experience in DataBricks
  • Minimum a handful of years experience in data analysis, statistical modelling, and advanced analytics experience in Manufacturing.
  • Experience working as part of an autonomous team, managing personal goals, and contributing to team direction.
  • Expertise in machine learning frameworks (e.g., Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch) and an understanding of MLOps practices, including DevOps principles like IaC and CI/CD pipelines.
  • It would be beneficial to have leadership experience as driving change is key part of the role
  • Ability to communicate complex analytical concepts to non-technical audiences
  • Already working in/with established network and forums and by that have easy access to knowledge and sparring.
  • Experience working in cross-functional teams and managing multiple projects simultaneously
  • Proficient in English, both written and verbal



The position is based in Billund, DK and relocation support is not offered for this role.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.

Title: Performance Intelligence Consultant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about turning complex data into powerful insights that influence decisions for global brands? Do you love uncovering patterns, experiment & testing theories, and translating numbers into actionable strategies? If so, we want to hear from you.

At VML MAP, we’re looking for a Performance Intelligence Consultant who thrives at the intersection of data, strategy, and storytelling. You'll play a key role in helping our clients optimize performance across digital channels and drive real business results.

What will your day look like?

As Performance Intelligence Consultant, you'll be at the forefront of data-driven decision-making and play a vital role in understanding client priorities and objectives. With a foundational understanding of user experience and a strong grasp of data and analytical approaches, you’ll be the bridge between data and strategy. Your daily activities will include conducting detailed data analysis to identify performance trends, designing and executing A/B tests and analyzing the results to provide optimization recommendations. You’ll also be preparing and presenting performance reports, and your strong communication skills and storytelling abilities will ensure that actionable insights are delivered in an easily understood format, and in a way that motivates and provides a clear direction for various teams.

More Specifically, Your Tasks Include


Conduct detailed data analysis to identify performance trends and insights.
Prepare and present performance reports and translate the complex data into actionable insights to internal teams as well as our clients, with a focus on content, audience, and channels.
Maintain and update performance dashboards and analytics tools.
Collaborate with various teams to ensure data-driven decision-making.
Design, execute and analyze A/B tests and experiments to identify the most effective strategies and tactics.
Approach all tasks with curiosity, hunger and open-mindedness, constantly striving to uncover further insights from the available data and to understand the “why” behind the numbers.


Who are you going to work with?

You'll be part of our expanding Insights & Optimization team, reporting directly to the Performance Intelligence Lead. You’ll work closely with data analysts, strategists, content experts, and client teams - acting as the vital link between technical data and business outcomes.

What do you bring to the table?

We're looking for curious minds with a strategic outlook and a passion for data. You're not just comfortable with numbers; you're adept at translating them into narratives that resonate with both technical and non-technical audiences, and you have a strong curiosity to discover the ‘why’ behind the data. Additionally, you are very collaboratively oriented, and you love working with cross-functional teams. Your expertise in detailed analysis and optimization will be instrumental in driving improvements and delivering actionable insights that enhance our daily tasks for clients.

In Addition, You Have


Experience analyzing campaign performance across digital channels and a strong understanding of marketing performance metrics such as open-rates, click through rates, conversions and journey data.
Experience with data visualizations tools such as Power BI and Tableau and strong knowledge of SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions and data manipulation.
Ability to translate complex data into understandable insights for non-technical audiences.
Skills in crafting compelling narratives from data insights.
Experience in presenting findings and recommendations to clients and/or Senior stakeholders.
Skills in managing expectations and building trust with clients and internal teams.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment with an open mind.
Curiosity, adaptability, and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Strong understanding of A/B testing methodologies and tools, with hands-on experience in driving learning agendas and continuous optimization efforts.


A leader in personalized customer experiences

VML MAP is a world-leading Centre of Excellence that helps businesses humanize the relationship between the brand and the customer through hyper personalization at scale, marketing automation and CRM. With the brain of a consultancy, the heart of an agency and the power of technology and data, we work with some of the world's most admired brands to help them on their transformation journey to becoming truly customer-centric. Together, we are 1000 + technology specialists, data scientists, strategic thinkers, consultants, operations experts, and creative minds from 55+ nationalities.

A global network

We are part of the global VML network that encompasses more than 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 60+ markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences.

WPP (VML MAP) is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML MAP on our social channels via Instagram, LinkedIn and X.

When you click “Apply now” below, your information is sent to VML MAP. To learn more about how we process your personal data during when you apply for a role with us, on how you can update your information or have the information removed please read our Privacy policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice.


Show more

Title: Principal Statistician
Description:
Principal Statistician | Global CRO |Denmark| Home Based |

Award-winning global biometric CRO have multiple opportunities for experienced Principal Statisticians to join its growing team.

Partnering with top pharma, biotech, and medical device companies, they deliver high-quality biostatistics, programming, data management, and data science services. Principal Statisticians can either be a hands-on technical role or more focused on being a Lead Statistician and is a great opportunity to grow with a recognized CRO, gain pharma experience, and benefit from continuous learning and development.

What you will be doing:

You will be working as a statistician on clinical trials; producing and validating complex outputs to excellent quality whilst adhering to deliverable timelines.

being responsible for statistical aspects of reporting out study results. Working as a lead statistician across multiple studies, with the opportunity to oversee more junior leads and supporting regulatory interaction Cardiology experience is a plus.

What you will need:

Educated to PhD or MSc in Biostatistics, statistics or a related discipline
Experience within the pharmaceutical industry to have a good awareness of clinical trial issues, design, and implementation.
Familiarity with GCP and regulatory requirements
Experience of writing SAPs, protocols

What’s in it for you:

Recognized as an outstanding workplace, committed to employee engagement, satisfaction, and work-life balance.
Structured training, development plans, and a supportive, friendly environment.
Condensed hours for a shorter workweek.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Fully remote role available in Denmark.

What to do next:

If this opportunity is of interest, please apply now with your CV as the organisation are looking to welcome Principal Statisticians onboard as soon as possible.

Not what you’re looking for?

Please contact Mark O'Brien at mark@warmanobrien.com for a confidential discussion about potential other opportunities in Denmark and across Europe.

Show more

Title: Register in our candidate data base
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. We’re democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levels—a privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

Growing as fast as we do in Veo means that every day is different, exciting, and challenging, both on the front line and in the back office.

But that’s not the most remarkable thing about us.

The coolest thing is our people. We’ve attracted some of the brightest minds in the industry. They are the reason we can create a great product and do it while enjoying ourselves.

Does your dream job at Veo not appear on the list, then sign up in our candidate data base and we will get in contact with you if the right opportunity arises for you.

At Veo, you'll be part of a thriving work environment where every day brings new excitement. Our rapid growth ensures a diverse and ever-changing atmosphere. We believe in work-life balance and providing a positive culture that allows you to thrive personally and professionally.

Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology – with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

Diversity and differences are valuable assets for us. We value diversity and inclusion and welcome people from all backgrounds. If you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we still encourage you to apply.

What Values We Hold at Veo.

Dare - We take initiative, stay curious, and challenge the status quo in our work.

Own it - We drive impact by identifying opportunities, taking responsibility, and confidently executing.

Level up - We embrace growth, continuously learning and shaping our skills.

Play as a team - We collaborate across a diverse organization, leveraging shared insights for stronger outcomes.

Customer Centric - We deliver value by having close partnerships and a deep understanding of our customers (internally and externally)

We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. And you may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Title: Graduate Data Scientist
Place: Vester Hassing, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
The Company

Veovo is a market leader in Airport Smart Technology. With a global footprint of customers and capabilities that cover Airport Operations, Revenue management and Passenger Flow. Some of the world’s largest airports rely on Veovo.  Focused on driving airport performance, our solutions enable airports to handle more aircraft and more passengers, with less delays and less queues. Our platforms are built on a modern tech stack, often delivered from the cloud as SaaS and leveraging intelligence to enable our customer to “go brilliantly”.

Our clients span continents, but all share one thing in common~ they’re big names in airport excellence, with even bigger digital goals. With offices in the UK, Poland, Denmark, New Zealand and the US, Veovo offers a world of opportunity

At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports. At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports.

The Opportunity

We focus on solutions in the analysis of queue and movement patterns as well as capacity forecasts. Our product, is cloud-based system that collects and analyzes data via proprietary (Bluetooth / WiFi) sensors, as well as third-party data sources such as camera, radar, infrared counters, coils, boarding cards, calendars, etc.

The solution primarily helps airports to forecast passenger appearance, optimize staff resources, reduce queue and travel times, and improve the experience for the passengers. In addition, we also create solutions for road traffic, railway stations, ports, ski resorts and amusement parks, with similar work and end-results.

Are you ready to be part of the team that brings our brilliant solutions "live" around the world?

The size of our installations are growing rapidly, and we are therefore seeking a skilled analytical person, who can help implement our solutions to help airports predict passenger arrival and flow. The implementation covers requirements, design, and calibration of the system. The calibration is carried out in-house via the setup of our filtering engine.

The Specifics


Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
Combine models through ensemble modeling
Present information using data visualization techniques
Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges
Collaborate with engineering and product development teams


What We Are Looking For


Knowledge of R, SQL and Python; familiarity with Scala, Java or C++ is an asset
BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
Analytical mind and business acumen
Experience in data mining
Problem-solving aptitude
Excellent communication and presentation skills


What We Offer In Return


A job in a growing industry.
Employment immediately or by agreement.
An exciting position in a company with good working conditions with an open, direct and informal tone
A company where ideas are accelerated into action, and everyone can play a part in the development.
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development through independent work assignments.
Workplace~ Hækken 2, Vester Hassing, 9310 Vodskov
37 hours working week

Title: Junior Consultant med flair for data til Salgsorganisationen
Description:
Vil du være med til at optimere og skabe forandring inden for ét af vores vigtigste nøgletal i vores butikker? Brænder du for at skabe overblik og analysere større dataset – og kan du formidle det på en overskuelig måde? Så er du måske den Junior Consultant, vi søger til Salgsorganisationen!




Stillingen som Junior Consultant er for dig, som motiveres af analytiske opgaver og optimering af processer, som er med til at gøre hverdagen lettere for vores kolleger i butikkerne.




Få en vigtig rolle i en central afdeling

Salgsorganisationen er bindeleddet mellem vores butikker og hovedkontoret. Afdelingens overordnede mål er at støtte kollegerne i vores butikker ved at sikre enkle og effektive arbejdsgange. Det gør vi gennem udvikling og implementering af koncepter, der standardiserer og optimerer processer og arbejdsrutiner i butikkerne.




Vores fornemste opgave er at servicere vores butikker bedst muligt. Vi sætter derfor en ære i at forstå den praktiske butiksdrift, hvilket du også vil få indsigt i med indarbejdning i to af vores butikker i en periode på 4-6 uger. På den måde får du et godt indblik i vores kerneforretning.




Om jobbet

Du vil sammen med dine kolleger indsamle og behandle data, som herefter skal analyseres og bearbejdes. Herefter vil du præsentere dine anbefalinger til optimeringer
Bidrage til tværfagligt samarbejde på tværs af IT, Controlling og regionale salgsafdelinger – du skal kunne agere både som fagspecialist og slutbruger, der ved ”hvad” og ikke kun ”hvordan”
Arbejde i forskellige interne og eksterne systemer og behandle data herfra
Udarbejdelse af diverse nøgletalsoversigter
Opfølgning på processer fra butiksdriften og optimeringer hertil
Forberede og analysere data, der skal synliggøre evt. problemstillinger og optimeringer
Ad hoc-opgaver




Om dig

Du er øvet bruger af Google Sheets eller Excel (macro, automatisering, Power-BI og lignede mester du også allerede)
Du evner at omsætte store datasæt i et brugbart og overskueligt overblik – og formidle det på en forståelige måde
Du kan selvstændigt udlede konklusioner fra data og på sigt komme med forslag til løsninger (når processer og organisation kendes)
Du stræber hele tiden efter at optimere og videreudvikle eksisterende løsninger – og/eller finde på nye
Du har et stort servicegen, der kommer til udtryk i din kommunikation og evne til at skabe relationer
Du kan bevare overblikket og følge op, når det er nødvendigt
Du har en relevant uddannelse og gerne krydret med erfaring fra detail – du må gerne være nyuddannet
Du har et godt sprogligt niveau for engelsk – tysk er en fordel




Vi tilbyder

Et uformelt arbejdsmiljø med faglig sparring, motiverede kolleger og humor
En arbejdsdag med spændende og alsidige opgaver, som du har mulighed for at præge og udvikle
Målrettet oplæring i alle processer samt mentorordning, så du har de bedste forudsætninger for at lykkes i jobbet
Grænseløse karrieremuligheder og faglige udfordringer
Mulighed for sundhedspakke
Rabatordning hos flere udbydere af rejser, shopping, kultur mm.




Hovedkontor i hjertet af Aarhus

Du vil have din daglige gang på vores store og innovative hovedkontor på Godsbanen i Aarhus.




På vores hovedkontor, får du som medarbejder adgang til:

Gratis fitnesscenter
In-house massageordning
Sund kantineordning med mulighed for morgenmad, frokost og nem aftensmad (take-away) – alt samen medminimum 30 % økologi.




Du får derudover også mulighed for at deltage i sociale aktiviteter som f.eks. morgenyoga på tagterrassen, løbeklub, familiedag og fredagsbarer.




Ansøgningsfrist d. 25. maj

Vi behandler løbende indkomne ansøgninger, så send gerne ansøgning og CV hurtigst muligt.




I rekrutteringsprocessen kan du forvente: screening, telefoninterview, jobsamtaler, case og kognitiv test.




Tiltrædelse er hurtigst muligt efter aftale.




Har du spørgsmål?

Ved spørgsmål til jobbet eller rekrutteringsprocessen kan du kontakte den ansvarlige Recruiter, Ida Marie, på +45 60 34 03 08 på hverdage mellem kl. 9.00-15.00 eller ved at sende en mail til jobilidlhq@lidl.dk.




Vi ser frem til at modtage dit motiverede CV!

Show more
HTML:
Vil du være med til at optimere og skabe forandring inden for ét af vores vigtigste nøgletal i vores butikker? Brænder du for at skabe overblik og analysere større dataset – og kan du formidle det på en overskuelig måde? Så er du måske den Junior Consultant, vi søger til Salgsorganisationen!


Stillingen som Junior Consultant er for dig, som motiveres af analytiske opgaver og optimering af processer, som er med til at gøre hverdagen lettere for vores kolleger i butikkerne.


Få en vigtig rolle i en central afdeling

Salgsorganisationen er bindeleddet mellem vores butikker og hovedkontoret. Afdelingens overordnede mål er at støtte kollegerne i vores butikker ved at sikre enkle og effektive arbejdsgange. Det gør vi gennem udvikling og implementering af koncepter, der standardiserer og optimerer processer og arbejdsrutiner i butikkerne.


Vores fornemste opgave er at servicere vores butikker bedst muligt. Vi sætter derfor en ære i at forstå den praktiske butiksdrift, hvilket du også vil få indsigt i med indarbejdning i to af vores butikker i en periode på 4-6 uger. På den måde får du et godt indblik i vores kerneforretning.


Om jobbet

  • Du vil sammen med dine kolleger indsamle og behandle data, som herefter skal analyseres og bearbejdes. Herefter vil du præsentere dine anbefalinger til optimeringer
  • Bidrage til tværfagligt samarbejde på tværs af IT, Controlling og regionale salgsafdelinger – du skal kunne agere både som fagspecialist og slutbruger, der ved ”hvad” og ikke kun ”hvordan”
  • Arbejde i forskellige interne og eksterne systemer og behandle data herfra
  • Udarbejdelse af diverse nøgletalsoversigter
  • Opfølgning på processer fra butiksdriften og optimeringer hertil
  • Forberede og analysere data, der skal synliggøre evt. problemstillinger og optimeringer
  • Ad hoc-opgaver


Om dig

  • Du er øvet bruger af Google Sheets eller Excel (macro, automatisering, Power-BI og lignede mester du også allerede)
  • Du evner at omsætte store datasæt i et brugbart og overskueligt overblik – og formidle det på en forståelige måde
  • Du kan selvstændigt udlede konklusioner fra data og på sigt komme med forslag til løsninger (når processer og organisation kendes)
  • Du stræber hele tiden efter at optimere og videreudvikle eksisterende løsninger – og/eller finde på nye
  • Du har et stort servicegen, der kommer til udtryk i din kommunikation og evne til at skabe relationer
  • Du kan bevare overblikket og følge op, når det er nødvendigt
  • Du har en relevant uddannelse og gerne krydret med erfaring fra detail – du må gerne være nyuddannet
  • Du har et godt sprogligt niveau for engelsk – tysk er en fordel


Vi tilbyder

  • Et uformelt arbejdsmiljø med faglig sparring, motiverede kolleger og humor
  • En arbejdsdag med spændende og alsidige opgaver, som du har mulighed for at præge og udvikle
  • Målrettet oplæring i alle processer samt mentorordning, så du har de bedste forudsætninger for at lykkes i jobbet
  • Grænseløse karrieremuligheder og faglige udfordringer
  • Mulighed for sundhedspakke
  • Rabatordning hos flere udbydere af rejser, shopping, kultur mm.


Hovedkontor i hjertet af Aarhus

Du vil have din daglige gang på vores store og innovative hovedkontor på Godsbanen i Aarhus.


På vores hovedkontor, får du som medarbejder adgang til:

  • Gratis fitnesscenter
  • In-house massageordning
  • Sund kantineordning med mulighed for morgenmad, frokost og nem aftensmad (take-away) – alt samen medminimum 30 % økologi.


Du får derudover også mulighed for at deltage i sociale aktiviteter som f.eks. morgenyoga på tagterrassen, løbeklub, familiedag og fredagsbarer.


Ansøgningsfrist d. 25. maj

Vi behandler løbende indkomne ansøgninger, så send gerne ansøgning og CV hurtigst muligt.


I rekrutteringsprocessen kan du forvente: screening, telefoninterview, jobsamtaler, case og kognitiv test.


Tiltrædelse er hurtigst muligt efter aftale.


Har du spørgsmål?

Ved spørgsmål til jobbet eller rekrutteringsprocessen kan du kontakte den ansvarlige Recruiter, Ida Marie, på +45 60 34 03 08 på hverdage mellem kl. 9.00-15.00 eller ved at sende en mail til jobilidlhq@lidl.dk.


Vi ser frem til at modtage dit motiverede CV!

Title: CRM Analyst
Place: Farum, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Change Lingerie is looking for a motivated and detail-oriented CRM Analyst to manage and optimize customer relationships through our Customer Data Platform. In this role, you'll be a key driver of our day-to-day CRM activities, develop customer segmentation strategies, and provide insights to improve customer engagement, loyalty, and sales across all channels. You will be a self-starter ready to drive multiple projects enhancing our current CRM system and customer experiences.

This position combines CRM system management with customer data analysis, offering you the opportunity to work closely with our wider marketing functions to help deliver personalized, data-driven experiences that enhance our customers’ satisfaction and retention. This position reports into the Senior Customer Insights Manager.

Key Responsibilities

CRM Management:


Assist with the day-to-day operations of our CRM platform, Bloomreach, including user setup, permissions, and troubleshooting.
Help configure and optimize customer journeys, workflows, and triggered communications to improve customer engagement.
Support the integration of CRM with other marketing and e-commerce tools to ensure smooth data flow.


Customer Segmentation & Targeting:


Drive development of customer segments based on purchase history, engagement patterns, and demographics.
Support the marketing team by providing targeted customer audiences for campaigns, loyalty programs, and retention efforts.


Analytics & Reporting:


Monitor CRM KPIs such as engagement rates, purchase frequency, consent and Customer Lifetime Value (CLV).
Assist with the creation of reports and dashboards to track customer behavior and campaign performance.
Provide data insights to support strategies for improving personalization, retention, and conversion rates.


Cross-Team Collaboration:


Work closely with the Marketing, E-commerce, and Web development teams to ensure CRM strategies align with broader business goals.
Support the marketing team by providing data insights that help refine marketing campaigns and customer targeting.


Data Management & Quality Control:


Maintain accurate, clean, and well-organized customer data within Bloomreach.
Implement data hygiene practices to keep our customer database clean and accurate.
Perform regular audits to ensure data consistency and relevance for CRM campaigns.


Key Skills & Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Data Analytics, Information Systems, or a related field.
2-4 years of experience in CRM coordination or management, customer data analysis, or related fields (internships or relevant projects are a plus).
Experience with Bloomreach or similar CRM platforms.
Understanding of customer segmentation, lifecycle marketing, and data management best practices.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to create reports or dashboards.
Familiarity with BI tools (e.g., Power BI or similar).
Attention to detail, problem-solving abilities, and strong communication skills.
Experience or interest in the fashion, beauty, lingerie, or retail industry is a plus.


What We Offer


A great opportunity to continue your career in CRM and data analysis with an international retail brand with a strong focus on driving value in CRM.
A supportive and collaborative work environment where you’ll learn and grow professionally.
Exposure to cutting-edge CRM and personalization technologies like Bloomreach.
Competitive salary, pension plan and health insurance
Great daily lunch


We are looking forward to receiving your application

We will review the applications and conduct interviews continuously. Please use our recruitment system and the "Apply for position"-button. Applications sent via email will not be handled.
